title: Data Science Manager
description:
Apply now
Data Science Manager (Data, Python, Science, Java, Database, Data Mining, SQL, MYSQL, MongoDB, Management) - Permanent - London
Charles Simon Associates are currently looking to recruit for a Data Science Manager on a permanent basis for our prestigious global business based in Central London.
Salary: Up to £80,000 per annum
Location: Central London
Skills/Requirements for the Data Science Manager:
- Strong Data Analytics and statistical skills
- Experience of Data Mining
- Experience with at least 1 of these programming languages: Python, Java, Scala
- Previous experience of leading or managing a data science team
- Skills in a number of data analytics and data science tools / infrastructure components:
- Data Management tech like MongoDB, Apache Spark, Amazon Redshift
- Relational Databases like Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL, Postgres
- Modelling tools like Alteryx, RapidMiner, H2O.ai
- Visualisation / Discovery tools like Tableau, QlikView, Plotly etc
- Experience of data manipulation, cleansing and validation
The Data Science Manager will be responsible for:
- Working alongside other members of the Professional Services, Sales and Service teams to understand the commercial questions which need answering - both from customers and internally
- Designing analytical approaches (including developing hypotheses and formulating tests) to solve these questions
- Developing project plans for data science / analytics work, ensuring clear communication to stakeholders inside and outside
- Building an extensive knowledge of available data within the organisation and how this interrelates - as well as options to bring in data from third-party sources
- Preparing data for analysis - validation, cleansing and transformation
- Building and testing analytical models and workflows
- Keeping all project stakeholders up to date on progress, issues and emerging findings
- Presenting results in a clear, structured and succinct manner to both an analytical/technical audience, and to a broader business audience
- Coaching, mentoring, motivating and supervising project team members
To be considered, please send an up-to-date copy of your CV for this position.
Data Science Manager (Data, Python, Science, Java, Database, Data Mining, SQL, MYSQL, MongoDB, Management) - Permanent - London

title: Data Science Recruiter
description:
Apply now
Data Science Recruiter - £20,000-£26,000 DOE + Benefits - London

The Company:
Our client is well established within the recruitment industry, with a 10-year track record of providing expert talent advisory and delivery for growing global technology, quantitative finance and data-science business'. With their office based in Mayfair they offer one of the most generous commission schemes in London with other amazing benefits such as; gym membership contribution, team holidays, a cycle to work scheme and bonus day off on your birthday!
The role and requirements:
This is a fantastic opportunity for a driven and ambitious individual to join a growing team with the vision to expand and to gain one on one training on all things data science. You will be learning from of the top data science head hunters. You will be supported with building an extensive and successful network of data science professionals. Your role will focus on supporting senior consultants by mapping exercises, contacting and building relationships with candidates along with informing candidates of suitable and relevant job opportunities.
In order to be a successful applicant for this position you must have:
A minimum of 6-12 months recruitment experience.
The ability to build good relationships and rapport with candidates and understand the needs of the candidate.
Excellent communication skills and be able to communicate with candidates effectively.
The ability to understand the needs of a client and be able to advise them appropriately.
A hunger for success, our client is looking for driven and tenacious individuals who are able to learn fast and act quickly.
Data Science Recruiter - £20,000-£26,000 DOE + Benefits - London

title: Data Science Lead
description:
Apply now
DATA SCIENCE LEAD
UP TO £80,000 + BONUS + BENEFITS
MILTON KEYNES/ REMOTE
OVERVIEW
Market Leading Retail Giant hiring for a Lead Data Scientist, you will be focusing on optimisation, automation and machine learning. Extremely customer focused on a macro-scale, you will be involved in a variety of different projects including (but not limited to) focusing on customer behaviour, supply chain and delivery routes optimisation. Your responsibilities will include but not be limited to:
Mining large and complex data sets - both structured and unstructured data including efficient data extraction, transformation and application
Leveraging Machine Learning to influence marketing, sales and understanding customer loyalty
Predicting customer behaviour and values through machine learning and implementing changes at a large scale
Designing models that have real world use and practices in all areas of product sale and production, using Python, Spark, SQL etc
YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
The successful Lead Data Scientist will have the following skills and experience:
Masters' degree level or higher in numerate subject, such as Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science
Comprehensive proficiency in key programming languages (Must-have Python and SQL, desirable AWS and GCP)
Previous software development skills and experience
Experience mentoring or leading data science teams is preferable
HOW TO APPLY:
Please register your interest by sending your CV to Luke Frost via the Apply link on this page.

title: Data Science Consultant
description:
Apply now
Quinton Davies have been engaged by a leading consultancy to secure a Data Science Consultant for their Bristol office.

This is an exciting and rare role where you will be working with inspiring peers, inspirational leaders and complex clients. You will be given a culture that will invigorate you and complex problems to solve that will challenge you. Importantly you will be given the autonomy to deliver but with highly experienced support available.

As an innovator with a huge passion for Data Science and the opportunities this brings you will solve extremely complex problems for a range of clients and be involved in the adoption of cutting edge techniques.

When it comes to your profile and experience there is a lot of flexibility however you will need to meet the following criteria:

* Proven experience within Data Science (or similar field)
* Demonstrable experience utilising Data Science techniques to solve complex problems in real world scenarios
* Proven technical capabilities in R or Python (or similar)

In return our client are able to offer an extremely competitive salary. Flexible working is also available with some remote however 2 days a week in Bristol is expected.

Thanks for considering an application. We do receive a high volume of applicants and as such we aren't unfortunately always able to respond to unsuccessful applicants. As such, if we haven't responded to your application on this occasion then your application has not been successful. Quinton Davies will not discriminate on unlawful grounds. We are committed to equal opportunity and diversity.

title: Data Science Manager
description:
Apply now
Data Science Manager

Data Idols are working with a well known online brand to find an experienced Data Science Manager to join and lead a data science team in this growing tech disrupter. Reporting into the Head of Data, you will cover key aspects ranging across business intelligence, data analytics as well as data science.

THE ROLE

As an experienced Data Science Manager you will be line manager to a team of Data Scientists who are embedded into product team and help Data Scientists provide insightful analysis to discover areas of opportunity that shape roadmaps. You will also work with the Data Scientists to help the product teams produce test plans and analysis of A/B tests and collaborate with Product Managers and other colleagues across the business to develop and provide the strategic context that will allow your teams to identify the most impactful work.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Prior line management experience with data scientists, and a track record of empowering teams to be more impactful.
Masters degree or PhD in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Operations Research, Mathematics, Econometrics, or other quantitative field.
Experience running A/B and multivariate tests and a solid understanding of the statistics involved in running this type of tests.
You are someone who enjoys communicating and building strong relationships with colleagues and stakeholders and are able to explain complex topics in simple terms

This is a great opportunity for an experienced Data Science Manager to work in a fast-paced and technology-focused environment. Please submit your CV for consideration and further details.
SALARY
£100,000 - £120,000

Data Science Manager

title: Data Science Consultant
description:
Apply now
Our client is a market leading analytics team that work with leading banking and capital markets clients. They help their clients work through the most complex business and strategic problems through the use of leading Data Science and Analytics solutions.
They have a high performance culture fostered through years of market leading projects. They hire based on character as much as ability.
As their clients’ challenges have become more complex, and as the sophistication and variety of analytical technologies has evolved, the demand for skilled consulting support to address these challenges has grown rapidly.
Banking or Capital Markets experience is essential.
Statistical analysis techniques, including regression, time series, segmentation, clustering, predictive modelling, propensity modelling, Monte Carlo simulation
Complex linear and non-linear optimisation modelling
Machine learning and AI techniques and tools
Advanced application of statistical languages (such as R and SAS) and wider programming tools (e.g. Python, C++, Java, Scala)
Data analytics and visualisation using e.g. Tableau, Spotfire, Qlikview and Power BI
Application of big data tools (e.g. Hadoop), advanced SQL and data manipulation and cleansing techniques
Cloud based analytics tools (e.g. BigQuery on GCP)

title: Director of Data Science
description:
Apply now
Director of Data Science
London
£150,000 - £170,000 + Benefits
Harnham is working with a leading UK Telco in hiring a Director to lead their Data Science efforts for their consumer business.
You will work across their key brands and help drive the company's efforts in using cutting-edge techniques to improve Customer Decisioning and Marketing/CRM analytics.
There has been significant investment into this area of the company, with continued growth expected throughout 2021, as well as a migration over to Google Cloud Platform (GCP).

THE ROLE
You will be involved with:
Setting a roadmap and driving a culture of innovation across the business, including close collaboration with engineering and technology teams.
Leading a business unit focused on using data science and machine learning to solve key customer/marketing-related problems (e.g. Behaviour / Next Best Action).
Working with key stakeholders across the business to scope out new opportunities for Data Science and AI.
Delivering a strong focus on automation.
YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
You will have:
Significant experience in leading cross-functional data science and analytics teams to successful commercial outcomes.
Proven experience in using cutting-edge techniques (machine learning) to drive value across customer and marketing analytics.
The ability to act as a thought-leader for the business, staying ahead of data science industry changes.
Experience in delivering on a data transformation/roadmap (from conception/ideation through to delivery).
THE BENEFITS
Up to £170,000 base salary + Bonus + Generous Comp Package
KEYWORDS
Data Science, Decision Science, Customer, Marketing, Next Best Action, PEGA, Decisioning, Machine Learning, Data Scientist, Analyst, Models, Modelling, Python, R, SQL, GCP, Google Cloud Platform, Agile.

title: Head of Data Science
description:
Apply now
Head of Data Science
London, UK
£120,000 Salary + Bonus + Benefits
OVERVIEW
Major UK B2B Bank looking for a Head of Data Science, you will be leading up the Data Science function of the company in a key hire for the business. Your responsibilities will include but not be limited to:
Manage a strong team of Data Scientists across a range of commercial projects
Help build a roadmap for the team, engage with senior level business stakeholders and communicate the value/ insights from the team.
Oversee and manage all of the Data Science projects within the business.

A successful Head of Data Science will have the following:
Several years' experience in Data Science and Credit/ Lending on a technical and strategic level
Knowledge of hands-on Machine Learning for various modelling in credit risk/ loans/ lending and also customer/ marketing.
Experience managing large teams on projects and engaging with senior level business stakeholders
Proven experience in a similar level position previously within this field.
HOW TO APPLY
Please register your interest by sending your CV to Luke Frost via the Apply Link below.

title: Head of Data Science
description:
Apply now
Head of Data Science
London
£120,000 + Benefits / Bonus
Harnham are working with a leading fintech in the UK who are hiring for someone to come in and lead their Data Science efforts in London.
As part of a lending business your main focus will be to lead the machine learning capabilities behind their core decisioning engine, as well as to look for other smart ways in which the company can utilise its data.
It is a greenfield environment with plenty of opportunities for high-impact data science to take shape and help the business grow! They have already loaned over £1bn successfully and have a very strong growth trajectory for the next few years. The company has also performed well during Covid-19, and are now looking to invest in their data capability, starting with this hire.

THE ROLE
You will:
Report into C-Level Executives and take ownership over the company's data infrastructure and analytics capability
Help lead the company's data transformation and be responsible for implementing innovative machine learning in several key areas
Help grow the function in the future and build a world-class team!

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
You will have:
An MSc in a quantitative discipline
Experience in both a credit risk/decisioning and data science capacity
Proven experience in Python
Demonstrated experience in delivering impactful machine learning across several years in industry

THE BENEFITS
Up to £120,000 base salary + bonus

KEYWORDS
Data Science, Decision Science, Credit Risk, Machine Learning, Data Scientist, Analyst, Decisioning, Marketing, Scorecards, Models, Modelling, Python, R, SQL, Financial Services, Lending.

title: Head of Data Science
description:
Apply now
Head of Data Scientist - London
Wade Macdonald are excited to be working with a highly successful boutique consultancy based in London who are looking to add a lead Data Scientist to their team. You will be working with leading FTSE companies as they bring cutting-edge, innovative solutions, powered by DigitalDNA, to life. They combine subject-matter expertise with strategy, technology and transformation consultancy to provide our clients with clear value.
About the Role
You will be expected to lead the development of an artificially intelligent system that breaks down a project into the skills and resources needed to fulfil the demand for various clients across law and financial services.
Collect data, performed feature engineering and integrated multiple machine learning algorithms and created a Rest API. Deployed the code to an AWS machine.
Your main areas of focus will be 5g, Blockchain, IoT as well as digital transformation
You will be leading a team of two Data Scientist.
You will also be working with Cambridge and Imperial College London undergraduates throughout the year who will help with code and delivery.
Key Points (must show knowledge and experience in most if not all of these areas)
Expertise in the field of Data Science & Artificial Intelligence
Being able to understand client needs from technical perspective
Target Driven
Strong hands on coding ability
Experience in leading and developing junior data scientist
Knowledge of techniques including, Machine learning, Deep Learning, NLP, Time Series, graph data analytics, pattern detection etc.
Experience using Python, Spark or R
Knowledge and experience using SQL
Use of the up to date Data Science platforms, Experience building and deploying solutions to Cloud (AWS, Google Cloud & Azure)
What you will receive in return
Remote Working
Very Competitive Salary
Centrally located office should you need/want to go in.
Excellent opportunity to grow as two previous Data Scientist have moved on Apple and Hewlett Packard.
Very collaborative working environment
Applications are encouraged from all candidates meeting or exceeding the minimum criteria for the role regardless of age, disability, gender, orientation, race, religion or ethnicity.

title: Data Science Lead (Pricing)
description:
Apply now
Data Science Lead (Pricing)
Manchester
Up to £95,000 + Benefits
Our client, a composite insurer, is currently looking for a Data Science Lead (Pricing).
The purpose of the role is to lead and develop a Data Science strategy for Pricing, one which will ultimately improve the company's competitive standing within the marketplace by building predictive models and extracting insight from data.
The location of the role can be flexible.
Responsibilities
Lead and develop a Data Science strategy for Pricing.
Examine opportunities to source both internal and external datasets.
Deliver predictive models that allow the company to gain a competitive advantage.
Develop Data Science skills and mindset within the team.
Provide technical leadership and direction for a team of Actuaries and Data Scientists.
Create an innovative environment for the team to flourish, identifying value-add initiatives and seeing them through to implementation.
Requirements
Must have a solid Pricing background gained within a general insurance environment.
Experience of Data Science (Pricing) techniques.
Hands on experience of developing predictive models.
An understanding of statistical and mathematical techniques applicable to Insurance Pricing, Risk Selection and Analysis.
Ability to work in a collaborative manner with senior stakeholders.
At least a 2:1 Bachelor's Degree with Honours in appropriate Data Science or Numerical subject, or equivalent experience.
Keywords: Data Science; Data Scientist; Lead Data Scientist; Data Science Manager; Predictive Modelling
Please note that due to a high volume of applications we receive daily, we are only able to contact applicants which have passed the initial CV screening stage. If you have not heard from us within 5 working days of your application, please assume that you have been unsuccessful.
We do not retain any personal information without your permission. Please refer to our data protection policy for more information.

title: Product Manager Data Science
description:
Apply now
Product Manager (Data Science)
Tech Company
£90,000 + benefits

The Company
Harnham is working with a tech company in London that are building a platform and marketplace for goods in the EU.
They have grown rapidly over the last few years, including building out a data science and machine learning team to tackle the companies toughest challenges.
This Product Manager role will be to work as part of this core data & technology team, leading their Routing workflow, focused on bringing an optimised supply chain from when the customer places an order, right through to its delivery at their door!

The Role - Product Manager (Data Science)
You will be:
Leading a key workflow (Routing), defining the strategy and roadmap for all supply chain and logistics problems in the business
Driving product execution and working with data scientists and engineers to scale the company's routing algorithms
Supporting the expansion of the company in new markets
Engaging with both technical and non-technical stakeholders, motivating teams to deliver a world-class product

Your Skills and Experience - Product Manager (Data Science)
You must have:
A BSc or MSc in a STEM degree
Commercial experience as a Product Manager within a data science or machine learning environment
Previous experience as a Data Scientist is beneficial
Strong analytical skills
Strong communication skills and the ability to work with both technical and non-technical teams

The Benefits - Product Manager (Data Science)
£90,000 + Benefits
How to Apply?
Please register your interest by sending your CV via the Apply link on this page. For more information about similar roles, please get in touch with Nick Mandella at Harnham.
Keywords
Product Manager (Data Science), analytics, strategy, Python, AWS, Spark, Machine Learning, Software Engineering, Statistics, Artificial Intelligence, Data Scientist, Data Science, big data.

title: Lead Data Science Consultant
description:
Apply now
LEAD DATA SCIENCE CONSULTANT
UP TO £120,000 + BENEFITS
CENTRAL LONDON
Are you an experienced machine learning engineer/ data scientist who is looking for a hands on, technically focused role? Do you enjoy mentoring and would be interested in training and teaching junior data scientists?
THE COMPANY:
As a Lead Data Science Consultant, you will work for a successful start-up that has seen a significant growth in the last year.
THE ROLE:
The role of Lead Data Science Consultant will divide their time between training and development of junior data scientists and working with clients to deliver machine learning projects.
In specific, you can expect to be involved in the following:
You will be teaching and training junior data scientists
You will be working with clients to deliver machine learning/ data science projects
You will be working to deliver an internal AI product in the financial services space
You will be involved in research and development using state of the art ML techniques
YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
The successful Lead Data Science Consultant will have the following skills and experience:
Proven recent experience as a technical lead/ technically focused role
Experience mentoring/ teaching data science/ computer science topics
Educated to Master's level (PhD preferred) in a STEM degree focused in quantitative methods and statistics (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics etc)
Proficiency in programming languages and statistical analysis tools - fluency in Python
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills and experience working in a data-driven team
THE BENEFITS:
The successful Lead Data Science Consultant will receive a salary, dependent on experience of up to £120,000.
HOW TO APPLY:
Please register your interest by sending your CV to Francesca Curtis via the Apply link on this page.

description:

title: Analytics and Data Science Lead
description:
Apply now
ANALYTICS AND DATA SCIENCE LEAD
£45,000 - £51,000
WEST LONDON
A great opportunity for a Senior Analyst to take the next step in their career! This aviation brand are looking for someone with excellent SQL, Python and Tableau experience who is looking to manage a small team of Analysts.

This is an Aviation company who are world-renowned and own big-name brands, offer a lively working environment. You will be coming in as an Analytics and Data Science Lead to manage a team 4, with plans to expand, as well as being hands on with coding and analytical projects using SQL, Python and Tableau. You will be responsible for strategic elements and interacting with stakeholders too. The business have recently shifted to a new AWS platform, giving you the chance to work with cloud technologies.

As an Analytics and Data Science Lead, your responsibilities will include:
Managing a team of 4 analysts
Being a product owner for Tableau
Hands on coding and ETL work using SQL and Python
Working with senior stakeholders to gather and understand their requirements
Strategic projects including technology reviews
Rolling out Data Science new use cases

Excellent SQL experience
Python scripting
Expert-level Tableau knowledge
Management or mentoring experience desirable
AWS, Snowflake, Redshift exposure beneficial
An interest in Data Science
THE BENEFITS:
The successful Analytics and Data Science Lead will receive a salary, dependent on experience between £45,000 and £51,000. On top of the salary there are a number of amazing extra benefits a candidate can receive such as:
Up to 40% bonus
Flight benefits
Working from home options
HOW TO APPLY:
Please register your interest by sending your CV to Ria Verma via the Apply link on this page.

title: Head of Data Science and Analytics
description:
Apply now
Head of Data Science and Analytics
Data Idols are working with a well-known global client in the e-commerce space. You will be heading up the Data function as well as leading a variety of new projects. You'll be able to create real change within this business, pushing them forward to become Data-leaders in their space.Our client have offices based in London but are open to remote working as the successful candidate will only be required in the office about once a week.
THE ROLE
Within this role as a Head of Data Science and Analytics you will be leading teams to deliver analytic roadmaps and implementing best practices in standards and processes. You will also be leading the Data Science and Advanced Analytics function, who are comprised of forward thinking individuals who specialise in their prospective areas, including statistical analytics. You therefore must have a background of mentor and leadership. However, they are happy to review Candidates who have previously managed a small team and are looking to take the next step into more of a 'Head of' position.

Experience applying advanced analytics to form business strategy

£90,000 - £140,000 + bonus and benefits
Head of Data Science and Analytics

title: Data Engineer - Data Science
description:
Apply now
Recession-proof, shining star in the Manchester FinTech arena - with leading-edge tech, ethics, meritocracy, and real growth. Data and Analytics is at the very heart of everything they do. A growth Business. We saw a >10% increase in staff here during Q3 and Q4 so far this year and this will increase. Benefits include Bonus, Pension, Courses and self-development, food, cerebral colleagues and your chance to genuinely make an impact with cutting edge tech in the biggest projects in the Business. They’re currently working 2 days in office though this is Pandemic dependent.
This role is all about being the Engineering Lead for the Data Science and Modelling team - Building a range of toolsets and helping models to increase the profitability of the organisation, utilising a best in class tech stack. You’ll:

title: Resourcer - Data, Analytics & Data Science
description:
Apply now
Role: Resourcer, Data, Analytics & Data Science
Location: Tunbridge Wells office post pandemic - you’d likely only be coming here twice a week. The rest is work from home, and will be 100% remote for the time being
Salary: £18,000 - £28,000 (DoE)
Benefits: 20 days annual leave rising to 25, placement and target bonuses, life assurance, workplace pension scheme, Employee Assistance Program, health insurance, healthcare cash plan
The job of a resourcer is to locate and engage the right talent for a vacancy, as quickly and efficiently as possible.
Whilst this sounds simple, it can be a challenge.
Imagine you’ve got 6 vacancies with the same deadline. Each needs a shortlist of 4 people. Those people need to be attracted or pro-actively engaged before the week is done.
Worst case, you could be looking for 24 different people, each with rare skills… across hundreds of millions of people to find them.
Then you’ve got other calls for catch ups, interview debriefs, offers to close plus a ton of other people to get back to with feedback.
So it’s fair to say this is a job juggling a lot of balls, constantly looking at solving problems, dealing with a product which at times can be irrational and unpredictable - as it’s people.
THE ROLE
You’ll be joining our team who look after all things Data recruitment related. Reporting into the team leader and supporting them with what is a high volume desk.
The kind of roles you’ll be supporting on require very specialist skills, and the talent in those areas are in incredibly high demand. So to be successful you’ve got to be credible. Great at networking and building relationships with people.
It’s a market which operates at real pace because of the level of demand. Which means you can expect quick turnarounds and deadlines on projects and a constant flow of new requirements given to you which need delivering to.
The team you’ll be joining is fronted by someone who’s got a very strong presence and status in the market, and is a trusted partner to a wide range of businesses. From high street and unicorn digital retailers and dot coms. Technology firms, data and analytics consultancies and some of the biggest names in global marketing, digital and data agencies.
In addition to the tasks outlined in the opening paragraphs, you’ll be networking with industry specialists. Building rapport and relationships in order to effectively build engagement. Looking to gain referrals and recommendations from these too.
Managing candidate experience end to end, ensuring everyone gets an appropriately high quality one. Delivered with upmost respect and professionalism.
There’s also some client facing aspects to the role too. Managing the recruitment process from CV submissions, chasing feedback, arranging interviews as well as offer and onboarding processes.
THE COMPANY
Blue Pelican has been around for 18 years. We survived the financial crisis of 2008, multiple recessions and we’re doing the same again, despite what can be perceived as challenging conditions.
How we’ve done this is a testament to our people and our Values.
Internally the team reshaped to work even more collaboratively, focussed on ensuring our clients hired the talent they needed with as little pain as possible
We created new services and advised on best practice for hiring in a newly on-line only capacity
We supported candidates with their job search, even if it wasn’t through us
In short, we worked tirelessly to create opportunity where it sometimes felt like there wasn’t any.
Just look at our YouTube channels for example.
What we’re experiencing now is a dramatic upturn in demand, brought on through a mix of new client wins and a return to hiring for some of our largest loyal clients. So we’re coming out of this stronger than ever, and this is why we need your help.
KEY EXPERIENCE
Ideally we are looking for someone with experience of working as a resourcer before. If you’ve got this, you already know what skills you need to demonstrate.
However, we will also consider relevant transferable skills.
There’s a few common traits of good resourcers, and it’s these:
- Gregarious characters, happy to pick up the phone and chat with people
- Good research skills. But also don’t bog themselves down in data. They’re quick to spot what they need then reach out to those people to engage
- Bright and switched on. Able to understand the complexities of people and their skills. Looking beyond technical limitations and can see how they could adapt to a client’s need successfully
- Brilliant time management skills - especially with multiple deadline juggling
- Able to react at pace to things which need quick turnarounds
- Very organised - plate spinning is something of a speciality
- Great EQ - able to puts the candidate and client needs first
- Real team player - recognises the part they play in helping the team become more than the sum of its parts
- But is also commercially savvy enough to know when they might be pushing a dead horse
If you’re an experienced hand and looking to command the higher end of the salary spectrum on offer - in support of your application, why don’t you email me and tell me the following:
a) Who’s this role reporting into?
b) How can Amazon.co.uk help you successfully resource talent for a role in the Data Science field?
TO APPLY
Please send CV or LI profile

title: Data Science and Analytics Specialist - Data Scientist, Machine Learning, Data Strategy
description:
Apply now
Data Science and Analytics Specialist - Data Scientist, Machine Learning, Data Strategy
Our leading law firm client are looking to recruit a Data Science and Analytics Specialist (Data Scientist, Machine Learning, Data Strategy) on a permanent basis to help deliver, focus, curate and span data related strategic and forward-looking initiatives across the firm. It will, alongside relevant partners and working groups be an internal and, as appropriate, external face data initiatives.
The Data Science and Analytics Specialist will focus on delivering value and growth under the firms projects related to Data Strategy and Data Science.
The role will apply advanced analytical methods and tools to drive value from the data that the firm have through techniques such as predictive modelling, forecasting and other algorithms. As well as delivering on advanced analytical methods, the role will work closely with internal and external clients to advance these data related insights and incorporate them into how the firm advances its business.
The key responsibilities for this Data Science and Analytics Specialist (Data Scientist, Machine Learning, Data Strategy) are:
Contribute towards the firms overall data strategy
Design, build and support reusable analytical structures within a technical environment for the use of testing hypothesis posed by business and legal management as well as formulating and testing own hypothesis
Apply machine learning and statistical techniques, including regression modelling, random forests and support vector machines.
Provide support to external consultants appointed by the firm to deliver predictive models to be used by the firm
Support the firm's R&D initiatives to help develop new predictive analytical models
Provide written and verbal commentaries to senior leadership and management teams (inclusive of PowerPoint presentations)
Analyse and interpret large volumes of data to show trends and create recommendations.
Ad hoc analysis as required covering a range of topics and support on various projects.
To be considered for this Data Science and Analytics Specialist (Data Scientist, Machine Learning, Data Strategy) you must meet this criteria:
The candidate must have experience of analysing information and having an enquiring mind so that they are prepared to extract and understand the details behind a number when necessary.
The individual must be diligent, have an eye for details and have the ability to review critically and also carefully check his or her own work as well as others. The deliverables from this role will be highly visible and will have a very high profile and errors will be noticed.
The successful candidate will be able to prioritise and plan his or her own work with minimum supervision - a proven ability to plan ahead is essential.

title: Data Science and Analytics Specialist - Data Scientist, Machine Learning, Data Strategy
description:
Apply now
Data Science and Analytics Specialist - Data Scientist, Machine Learning, Data Strategy
Our leading law firm client are looking to recruit a Data Science and Analytics Specialist (Data Scientist, Machine Learning, Data Strategy) on a permanent basis to help deliver, focus, curate and span data related strategic and forward-looking initiatives across the firm. It will, alongside relevant partners and working groups be an internal and, as appropriate, external face data initiatives.
The Data Science and Analytics Specialist will focus on delivering value and growth under the firms projects related to Data Strategy and Data Science.
The role will apply advanced analytical methods and tools to drive value from the data that the firm have through techniques such as predictive modelling, forecasting and other algorithms. As well as delivering on advanced analytical methods, the role will work closely with internal and external clients to advance these data related insights and incorporate them into how the firm advances its business.
The key responsibilities for this Data Science and Analytics Specialist (Data Scientist, Machine Learning, Data Strategy) are:
Contribute towards the firms overall data strategy
Design, build and support reusable analytical structures within a technical environment for the use of testing hypothesis posed by business and legal management as well as formulating and testing own hypothesis
Apply machine learning and statistical techniques, including regression modelling, random forests and support vector machines.
Provide support to external consultants appointed by the firm to deliver predictive models to be used by the firm
Support the firm's R&D initiatives to help develop new predictive analytical models
Provide written and verbal commentaries to senior leadership and management teams (inclusive of PowerPoint presentations)
Analyse and interpret large volumes of data to show trends and create recommendations.
Ad hoc analysis as required covering a range of topics and support on various projects.
To be considered for this Data Science and Analytics Specialist (Data Scientist, Machine Learning, Data Strategy) you must meet this criteria:
The candidate must have experience of analysing information and having an enquiring mind so that they are prepared to extract and understand the details behind a number when necessary.
The individual must be diligent, have an eye for details and have the ability to review critically and also carefully check his or her own work as well as others. The deliverables from this role will be highly visible and will have a very high profile and errors will be noticed.
The successful candidate will be able to prioritise and plan his or her own work with minimum supervision - a proven ability to plan ahead is essential.
A very strong working knowledge of Microsoft Excel, including pivot tables and standard excel formulae
Working knowledge of Powerpoint

The Opportunity
Our client is at the forefront of chemical research and are looking to develop their data science arm. You will be a highly experienced data scientist, with a strong academic background in statistics. This is an exciting time to join this organisation, and you will be involved in global projects from day one. Data driven decisions are at the core of this organisation and you will be using your knowledge accordingly. The role will be highly challenging and engaging, with scope to progress on a chosen path. You will be at the forefront of designing novel engineering and scientific solutions.
This is an excellent opportunity to join a pioneering technical organisation and really progress your career. Benefits include generous bonus schemes, insurance, excellent pension, global opportunities, and company car schemes to name but a few. Apply today to be considered for this opportunity. title: Principal Data Scientist
description:
Apply now
Principal Data Scientist
London
£125,000 - £135,000 + benefits
Harnham are working exclusively with a Private Equity company in London who are in the process of building a Data Science and Engineering capability.
The company have an impressive Founding Team who hold a strong reputation within Data & Analytics and Private Equity, and are now in the process of significant growth for the next 12 months.
As a business model, they will look to acquire companies who hold significant potential, and through the use of Data Science and Engineering, unlock significant value over a number of years to help improve how that company operates, as well as how that company performs.
As a Principal Data Scientist in this team you will be responsible for identifying key areas of improvement within an organisation, scoping out problems through a data science lens, and through the use of advanced techniques it will be your job to deliver multiple key initiatives to drive business performance and revenue.

The Role - Principal Data Scientist
You will be:
Leading engagements from a technical perspective and acting as a key thought-leader on several high profile projects
Working across multiple engagements within the company's portfolio, across various different industry sectors
Combining technical and commercial skills to help drive business operations and performance within the portfolio
Building end-to-end machine learning solutions, as well as driving key strategic insights (you will be a full-stack data scientist)
Working alongside a world class team of Data Scientists and Data Engineers (from junior through to Principal/Director level)
Translating business challenges and converting them into clear and concise insights/recommendations which generate significant value

Experience - Principal Data Scientist
You will have:
Experience in leading high profile data science projects which demonstrate value and commercial impact.
An M.Sc. or Ph.D. in: Machine Learning, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.
Experience using Python is a must
Knowledge of Spark, Kafka, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes is desirable
A strong knowledge of statistical/machine learning models applied to real-world problems
A keen interest in problem solving and using scalable machine learning to solve the biggest data-related problems is important
A strong interest in working across a variety of different industry sectors and problem areas.

BENEFITS
Up to £135,000 base salary
Competitive bonus, Private Medical Insurance, 25 days annual leave
The opportunity to join a world-class and growing team

HOW TO APPLY
Please register your interest by sending your CV via the Apply link on this page. For further details or to enquire about other roles, please contact Nick Mandella at Harnham.

KEYWORDS
Python, SQL, Spark, Kafka, machine learning, statistics, Data Science, Data Scientist, Big Data, Artificial Intelligence.

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
description:
Apply now
MFK Recruitment has an exciting opportunity for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join our global AdTech client, based in Shoreditch, London.
My client has been recognised as one of the fastest growing companies in the US and Europe and they have also won several 'Best Places to Work’ awards. Many of their team hail from tech giants such as Google, Amazon & Facebook.
We are looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer with an in-depth working knowledge of the latest in Machine Learning/Data Science technologies and cloud platforms to join their team.
In this role you’ll work on a wide range of computational challenges such as: CTR prediction, forecasting, bidding models, and delivery optimization. We practice an effective data science process that recognizes the uncertainty in explorations for ML solutions but also emphasizes an agile software engineering workflow. My client uses the most popular tools in the Python data science ecosystem and embrace innovation.
My client’s tech stack is always evolving to meet the challenges of the massive scale of transactions on which they operate. To manage the firehose of data coming in, they explore complex trade-offs and carefully architect high performance distributed systems. Those in turn require elegant and thoughtfully designed interfaces to make the systems accessible to both their team and their customers.
Senior Machine Learning Engineer - What You'll Be Doing:
Lead data science projects and ensure they deliver business value
Work with the Product and Engineering team to build data model pipelines to power customer-driven products
Guide major architectural changes as we scale to improve our engineering velocity
Implement and test the latest research works
Mentor other engineers on architecture and process
Senior Machine Learning Engineer - What You Should Have:
MSc or above in a STEM (science, technology, engineering, mathematics) subject
5+ years of an excellent track record with Machine Learning/Data Science in industry
Strong understanding and experience in distributed computing frameworks, especially in Apache Spark
Expert-level proficiency in Python and SQL
Practical experience with Data Warehousing (especially Snowflake), Deep Reinforcement Learning and out-of-core algorithms
Good understanding of engineering best practices, agile (as it applies to Data Science), and version control
Effective collaboration with Product, Customer, and Engineering teams

title: Data Scientist
description:
Apply now
Data Scientist | Oxford | 60-80k plus package (incl. bonus)
I'm currently working with a fast-growth scale-up who at the forefront of Artificial Intelligence (AI) driven drug discovery and the only company to have used AI to design drug molecules that are currently in clinical studies. As a company, they are committed to getting medicines to patients in the fastest and most effective manner, by applying the latest research in Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning and modern high-performance computational methods. They are a leading market innovator in one of the most important industries right now.
We are seeking Data Scientists to help accelerate our application of AI and Machine Learning to live Drug Discovery projects. Reporting to the Chief Data Officer, this position is integral to support and build the Company's Data Science capability as it executes the next phase of its life cycle. Data Scientists with knowledge of Drug Discovery, would be helpful, to work closely with drug designers and engineers to help provide the predictive capabilities that underpin our drug design platform.
Roles and Responsibilities:
Apply your machine learning skills and creativity with diverse data to a range of applied drug discovery challenges
Use your analytical and data science skills to monitor, maintain and improve our large-scale machine learning platform.
Work closely with drug designers to understand and address project challenges.
Work closely with engineering and MLOps teams to continuously improve our ability to deliver models and algorithms to project teams.
Work with colleagues to wrangle heterogeneous raw data and devise pipelines that generate clean data suitable for downstream ML and analytics.
Key Requirements for this Role:
Proficiency in using Python or R to wrangle complex, large-scale chemistry/ pharmacology data sets.
Experience in developing Machine Learning or Deep Learning models, methods or algorithms.
PhD or equivalent experience in cheminformatics, machine learning, bioinformatics, computational chemistry or related quantitative data science field.
Strong presentation and interpersonal skills with the ability to work in a multi-discipline squad and present insights and analysis to stakeholders.
A passion for data science and the use of data to make good decisions.technical audiences
Nice to have:
Domain knowledge in medicinal chemistry as applied to contemporary drug discovery.
Knowledge of modern drug discovery technologies and enthusiasm to apply algorithm-derived compound designs
Company Benefits:
An opportunity to make a positive contribution to patients by revolutionising the pharmaceutical industry through AI driven discovery.
The ability to strongly influence a scaling AI organisation with world class technical and scientific leaders.
An opportunity to grow your career with us as we grow our organisation.
A highly competitive compensation package to support our employees as we continue to grow and thrive.

description:
Apply Now
Insights Consultancy Director / Applied Sciences Director
Accountability, ownership and trust to pitch, lead and innovate
Join a team growing at pace due to quality of talent and in turn highly successful output
Inspiring senior leadership team
Manage and lead a team of high quality, talented data consultants
LOCATION - Central London/Remote to begin with
SALARY - £80k - £95k & benefits
Having exclusively built over half of the Marketing Sciences function across the last 2 years, we can vouch for the exceptional quality of talent this agency has managed to attract; because of the impressive step change they’ve made from traditional data planning and analytics to advanced data science services and insights consultancy, driven by the vision of their Director.
With intent, innovation and training and development at the heart of their culture you can be confident you will be joining a team which delivers. Time and time again.
As always, ensuring data is at the heart of marketing communications and customer understanding is key for this role - but there’s more. The role requires thought leadership from a data usage perspective, strong team leadership and the ability to solve broader business problems and answer questions using analytics, insights and data science. You will act as a go between the Data Scientists and client stakeholders, working to consult around their challenges and questions, using data creatively to solve these problems.
You will be leading on pitches and big projects with the freedom to really take accountability for decisions and delivery.
You will be managing a team of insights consultants ranging in experience from junior through to senior level. You will report into an impressive, entrepreneurial, and ambitious leader, who has played a key part in growing and developing the overall data offering for this agency over the last few years. Therefore, theirs is one of the fastest growing teams within the Marketing Sciences function so there is still lots of room for personal development and influence upwards through the ranks, even at this level.
WHAT MAKES THIS ROLE DIFFERENT?
Analytics for decision making, and beyond! You are more than an Analyst, you are a business consultant in ways, taking your recommendations to new levels where you recommend wider client strategies off the back of your findings. They’re less prescriptive and more around problem solving.
High level exposure to some of the UK’s most complex data environments
Working for one of the UK’s largest marketing agencies; huge investment into training, impressive clients and inspiring leaders
Range of clients across entertainment, travel, automotive and retail - diversify your sector experience and grow at speed!
WHATS IN IT FOR ME?
Exceptionally high level of talent within this function - so peer learning is a reality, you will be inspired by your team, not just senior leaders. Although they are pretty awesome too and lead from the front with clear vision, strategy and commitment to genuinely disrupting what a long standing approach to analytics from marketing agencies alike. Their approach to date has generated incredible clients and a thirst for more and more advanced data projects - so the best is yet to come and you could be part of that journey. With their rapid growth, there is huge opportunity for promotion and growth into management, whilst also being able to apply your creativity in solution and product design.
EXPERIENCE REQUIRED
Educated to degree level in a relevant subject; numerate or marketing related
Experience in building data strategies and managing the delivery of insights driven and data science projects for large scale brands
A strong understanding of CRM and digital platforms and confident talking to clients about the 'art of the possible’ in terms of highly personalised, customer led marketing and data science solutions
Experience in leading or managing teams is essential
Ideally experience of pitching for new business
Ideally experience from management consultancy, or broader business strategy consulting

description:
Apply now
DATA ARCHITECT
ECOMMERCE (RETAIL)

£70,000-80,000
A well known successful e-commerce company based in Manchester are looking for an experienced Data Architect, ideally with experience across traditional and some cloud tech to come in and be the data expert to support the enterprise architects during a large scale SQL Server->AWS migration
THE COMPANY
The company is well established with a workforce in the hundreds and because of their business model they have been doing really well throughout lockdown.They are well established with a workforce over 1000 and have also recently received £100m worth of investment
THE ROLE
As a Data Architect you would be responsible for :
Support Enterprise Architects to define and maintain roadmaps, providing input into strategic technology direction
Create robust and consistent data-specific architecture principles, standards and artefacts as well as the governance of conceptual and logical solution designs.
Evaluation of the structure of data for the whole organisation, ensuring integrated data across the business.
Aligning with Data & Analytics to define: BI reporting approach, Data Migration needs including ETL approach and Clarification and standardisation of business rule management
Supporting and developing the right approach towards a goal of 'single sources of truth' for all data.
Supporting both the development and creation of standard methods for modelling data (conceptual, logical, object, document etc)
Supporting the Data Science team with the definition, population and build of our data lake, and the Analytics team with the data warehouse
Aligning with the Data Science roadmap, ensuring alignment with IT Data Squads and supporting allocation of resource.


SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
A successful Data Architect will have:
Have great experience in data architecture or similar lead technology role, applying industry recognised data modelling patterns and standards to diverse data sets
Be excellent at conceptual & rational data modelling and database design (not fussed on which tools you've used for this)
Experience building high quality data and governance structures and knowledge ofhow to interpret a Data Science and Analytics roadmap and turn business problems into data designs
Understand how to deploy data in support of complex machine learning projects
Cloud fundamentals - preferably AWS S3, IAM, EC2, Cloudwatch etc.
Strong experience with relational databases and ideally reporting tools such as Power BI


HOW TO APPLY

SQL, Power BI, Data Architecture, Data modelling, conceptual, logical

title: Principal Data Scientist
description:
Apply Now
As the PDS of a team of data specialists, you will lead by example in the development of innovative solutions that keep Reed Online at the forefront of a data-driven market and have a proven track record of developing and deploying machine learning models in a commercial environment.
You will help grow, support and mentor your members. As a recognised leader in the data science community you will leverage sophisticated machine learning and big data technologies, overcoming a variety of data and engineering challenges to allow customers to discover their perfect career.
You'll have experience in the latest tech available such as deep learning, probability, statistics, machine learning theory, data mining algorithms, and cloud technologies, helping to design the platform and practices for the future of data science at reed.co.uk. You will be involved in some of the latest advancements in the recruitment technology field and be able to use your skills to help guide the businesses technology stack to improve and understand the jobs market.
Key Responsibilities
The PDS role will provide technical and strategic guidance to the business while offering leadership and the opportunity to influence the future roadmap and strategic direction. You will be able to grow a small team of data specialists and their career development whilst maintaining a culture of continuous learning and iteration.
The role will involve using machine learning to identify patterns and trends by analyzing, interpreting enriching and running experiments on both jobs and candidate related data to improve our products and services. Additionally you will be responsible for guiding the team on delivery best practices and the team’s data architecture developing a CICD platform for a regular release process into a production environment.
Working alongside engineers to help us build-out a core suite of data products and services based around improving the experience of job seekers looking for jobs and recruiters looking for candidates.
Drawing on your strong stakeholder management skills, and ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical audiences, you’ll contribute to securing the necessary support and funding to ensure the success of these capabilities.
Skills and Experience
You will be a data evangelist, with a background in data science, and good knowledge of statistical analysis, data processing and modelling of large datasets to derive new insights; presenting insights back to stakeholders, developing prototypes of tools or learning models.
You will need
A Masters/PHD Degree in a quantitative subject with strong technical or scientific background
A recognised machine learning expert with recognition and publications
Advanced knowledge of ML and deep learning
Experience in developing senior stakeholder relationships
Experience with cloud platforms, infrastructure and delivery
(Desirable) Fluency of Python, and common machine learning packages i.e. scikit-learn
To be a self-starter, bringing your own curiosity, creativity, enthusiasm and real world problem-solving to a highly motivated team
Join REED - Improving Lives Through Work
Proud winners of:
#1 Recruitment Agency - Glassdoor Best Places To Work 2019 & 2020
Glassdoor Top CEOs 2019
The JobCrowd Top Companies For Graduates To Work For 2018/19
Our Values, Your Values; Our Future, Your Future
All job offers are subject to satisfactory references and compliance with vetting requirements applicable to the job role. REED is an equal opportunities employer. We aim to ensure that no candidate or employee receives less favourable treatment on the grounds of gender, race, disability, sexual orientation, religion or belief, age, gender identity, marital or civil partnership status, pregnancy or maternity. We are a MINDFUL EMPLOYER and offer a guaranteed interview scheme for disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria.

SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST

You
2+ years of experience as a data analyst

title: Head of Digital Media Analytics
description:
Apply Now
Head of Digital Media Analytics
** Major digital agency **
Global sports brand client
Variety - own and deliver analytical solutions across web, media, digital, eCommerce and performance marketing channels
Accountability, ownership and trust to pitch, lead and innovate
Join a team growing at pace due to quality of talent and in turn highly successful output
LOCATION - Central London/Remote to begin with
SALARY - £85k & benefits
Having recently won an additional significant stake in a global sports brand account (making them their largest agency supplier for creative and production worldwide) this global digital agency are looking to grow the centralised data team in order to support its growth and in turn the growth of other clients in the same vein, from an analytical perspective.
You will lead a team of 10-15 analytics experts who specialise in the media/audience, social and web analytics plus data science and marketing performance - so a broad analytics understanding is key in order to lead from the front, but we can also be a little flexible around where your main strengths lie across this spectrum.
What’s crucial is the ability to grasp this opportunity with both hands, set a strategy for the client around measurement and data solutions, and scale and grow the capabilities and team. You will need to demonstrate you have the adaptability to work with a global client, who is going to have varied and complex requirements, across different regions and therefore we require a certain level of relationship management, innovative thinking as well as an understanding of what’s possible.
You report into the Director of Data for the whole agency, who has an impressive data agency background, and the plan is to grow the function and in turn offering, significantly, so you will be joining at an exciting time of growth and change; a huge opportunity to diversify your skills across lots of different analytical projects and own the analytics team and vision.
This is a hands on role, requiring someone who can roll their sleeves up initially to deliver to the initial workload and strategy, whilst also work towards scaling and growing the solutions and team, eventually moving towards more of a strategic lead position. A combination of experience in attribution modelling, econometrics, customer journey analysis, digital tagging implementation, social media measurement, data science and eCommerce platform experience would be great!
But given this is a lot to ask for, the focus right now is around media analytics and social. So strong analytics experiences both these disciplines is essential, coupled with any bonus background in data science and/or more traditional customer and marketing analytics.
You will also need to be very comfortable with building out reporting solutions and frameworks as BI and insights will be a strong focus for this role across a variety of channels; so again, tools such as Alteryx, Tableau and Power BI should be familiar to you.
Ultimately, being a brand new role this offers a unique greenfield opportunity to grow your analytical skills, build your own team, and own the analytics offering for one of the most successful digital agencies in the world!
EXPERIENCE REQUIRED
Educated to degree level in a numerate subject
Experience in leveraging traditional media analytics techniques such as market mix modelling (MMM), attribution modelling, A/B testing around optimisation and working with ad server data in a cloud environment
Skilled in measuring social media (both paid and organic) marketing activity and usage behaviour and trends
Strong understanding around digital, web and content marketing and how to effectively measure its performance using tagging and journey analytics
Ideally some experience with more tradition statistical customer insight analytics and modelling would be preferred, but is not essential
Strong hands-on technical skills using a combination of some of the following tools: Python, R, SQL, Adobe, Google Analytics, Google Big Query, Sprinklr, Crimson Hexagon, Brandwatch, Optimizely, Alteryx
Ability to story tell and bring data to life through the delivery of actionable insights and engaging presentations
Strong knowledge around how to build out visually engaging reporting solutions and dashboards
Experience in leading or managing teams is essential
Ideally experience of pitching for new business
TO APPLY

For further information or to apply please contact:

Kate McDermott

Management Consultant - Blue Pelican Marketing

title: Senior Data Scientist - Renewable Energy / Financial Services
description:
Apply now
Expanding financial service start-up specialising in Renewable Energy require a Senior Data Scientist to support strategic analytics and decisioning in the UK energy markets and maintain competitive advantage. You will work on cutting-edge forecasts, tools and strategies, progressing to take data science leadership responsibilities, reporting directly to the board.
Client Details
Expanding financial service Start-up in Renewable Energy markets
Description
Expanding financial service start-up specialising in Renewable Energy require a Senior Data Scientist to support strategic analytics and decisioning in the UK energy markets and maintain competitive advantage. You will work on cutting-edge forecasts, tools and strategies, progressing to take data science leadership responsibilities, reporting directly to the board.
Background / Key Initiatives & Opportunity:
As with any smaller-sized company, you will have to be somewhat of a full-stack developer: able to get data (sFTPs, push-services, APIs), store data effectively (MySQL database on AWS), retrieve data and process it into a tool (R, Julia, or Python), get the tool running live (AWS) with an intuitive interface for the end user (React JS). That is not to say you are on your own in this process, you will be supported by the Technology Lead and Data Scientists who know the ins-and-outs of the business and the market they operate in. There are also dedicated developers who can bring your tool to browser to help the UK energy sector - providing liquidity, security of supply and the smooth integration of renewables.
Key initiatives include:
Improving spotlight on UK electricity demand
UK wind energy generation forecasts
UK solar energy generation forecasts
Various energy price forecasts which assist and drive the company strategies
Develop new Tools generated from in depth understanding of certain industry processes
Further advancement of automated strategies
Progressing within the company (and with support of the Technology Lead) you will improve processes of taking ideas to production tools, helping decide new hires, task-setting, keeping up-to-date with developments in the field, and guiding company expansion as the data science representative to the board. Over time, the role will still remain focused on solving some of the organisations most interesting and far reaching problems.
Please note: this is a highly collaborative environment so proximity to the Head Office in Bristol is essential.
Key Experience and Skills Required:
Essential
Outstanding programming in R, Python or Julia.
Direct training in Statistics, or a similar highly numerate field to minimum degree level.
Well versed in the tools available to the data scientist.
Experience making live/production tools/models which have been used by others.
Experience with SQL databases/ data acquisition and management.
Experience using version control
Meticulous with your data, fantastic models are wasted on incorrect data.
A good human-interface; you will be communicating with a wide audience with Developers, Directors, Data Scientists and non-technical staff
Desirable
Meteorological expertise - knowledge of weather data and models is highly desirable
Direct energy market expertise; past employment at a TSO, supplier, aggregator, energy market service provider will help transition and perhaps bring something new to the team.
Experience in financial services risk / analytics modelling
Experience with AWS
A quantitative Masters/PhD/ an extensive number of relevant MOOCs
A desire to understand everything to fine detail.
You have no issues with hounding someone for an answer, sometimes the best knowledge discovery is done via call and email.
Experience managing a small team.
If you primarily code Python or Julia, a willingness to get to dabble in R where necessary.
Profile
Outstanding programming in R, Python or Julia.
Direct training in Statistics, or a similar highly numerate field to minimum degree level.
Well versed in the tools available to the data scientist.
Experience making live/production tools/models which have been used by others.
Experience with SQL databases/ data acquisition and management.
Experience using version control
Meticulous with your data, fantastic models are wasted on incorrect data.
A good human-interface; you will be communicating with a wide audience with Developers, Directors, Data Scientists and non-technical staff
Job Offer
Opportunity to work with a high growth start-up in Renewable Energy
Opportunity to lead and influence on Data Science capabilities

title: Account Manager
description:
Apply now
Account Manager
Location: Remote Working (Temporarily) - London/SE (in time)
Salary: £28,000 to £32,000, DOE
Contract: Full time, Permanent
Vuzo is a fast-growing data science agency formerly based in London and Bristol, and now fully remote.
We are home to world-leading data science talent and patent-pending AI tech. We grew rapidly during 2020 and added many household name ecommerce retail brands and public sector agencies to our client base. If you’re looking for a new challenge with more autonomy and influence in the direction of your company and role, this is a rare ground-floor opportunity at a profitable start-up.
Account Manager - The Role
Due to our continued growth, we are looking for a talented Account Manager to join our team. Previous experience working with data science is not required - we are looking for someone who, with support from the wider Vuzo team, can help bridge the gap between the technical explanations of analysis into practical support for our clients!
Account Manager - Duties and skills:
Being a friendly and reliable key liaison for our clients
Preparing monthly client presentations
Ensuring key client milestones are being set and met
Support Account Director/Technical Director with project priorities based on client meetings
Preparing client project plans
Checking in on client Google Analytics accounts and sales numbers
Spotting potential variances to the plan before they become critical
Active listening for opportunities to develop the account
Conduct satisfaction surveys and audits to uncover upsell opportunities
Monitoring billed and logged project hours vs target/scope
Attend client meetings, present results
Channel input from client requests into Vuzo’s product roadmap
Desirable Skills/Experience:
2+ years’ experience in a similar role working in a communications/digital marketing agency
PowerPoint/Keynote
Google Analytics
Mailchimp
A good grasp of the fundamental concepts of Paid Search (PPC) and SEO
Our Culture:
At Vuzo, we understand the importance of work/life balance. We are hard workers, but as a company we also ensure that our team has plenty of opportunity for personal development as well as growing our team’s culture and most importantly, have fun while doing it!
Whether that be a virtual glass of wine at the end of the working week, team days out (once all this is over with!) or training days and conferences - we are committed to ensuring that all Vuzo employees can cultivate their own personal growth and align this with their professional goals.
We are a fast-paced company with innovative thinking and collaboration at its heart, so all we ask is that you can demonstrate a track record of:
Getting stuck in
Finding fulfilment in learning new skills
Curiosity - questioning the status quo
Empathy - tapping into client pain points and understanding where Vuzo can fill the gaps
Enthusiasm - we want someone who gets excited about the solutions we offer our clients and can get our clients just as excited!
Package and Benefits:
Fully remote working while Covid restrictions are in effect. Our client base are in London and the South East so when things get back to normal and regulations allow, you will need to visit them in person.
Herman Miller ergonomic chair
3% of Salary Company Pension Scheme Contribution
Bike to work scheme
Lifestyle perks e.g. gym membership, car hire and gig ticket discounts
28 days of holiday increasing with tenure
To Apply:
If you’re ready to take the next step in your career and join our friendly, professional team who are dedicated to delivering our vision for global growth, then please click on APPLY to be considered.
Due to the volume of applications, we receive we are unable to respond to all applicants. If you do not hear from us within four weeks please assume that your application has been unsuccessful.
Note: We are not offering sponsorship or a relocation package for this role. We always welcome international candidates to apply providing they are eligible to work and live in the UK.
No agencies Please!

description:

title: Data Architect
description:
Apply now
Role - Data Architect
Location - Manchester (with plenty of home working available)
Up to £75,000 + bonus + benefits
Keen to join one of the North's most successful consumer brands? Want to take the lead on enterprise data architecture projects?
Then, reach out for a discussion about this Data Architect opportunity! You will be working for a rapidly growing brand, working on AWS cloud architecture, and have ownership of the entire data architecture solution.
What more could you want?
This is an incredible opportunity to design, implement and then build a complex data architecture using the best tools available. You will have a huge amount of freedom and autonomy to create the solution as you see best and have support from engineers in the process.
The ideal candidate will have experience with AWS cloud architecture from front to back, experience of transitioning from legacy platforms to cloud platforms, and a strong understanding of data infrastructures (data modelling, data management etc).
THE ROLE - DATA ARCHITECT:

Lead wide-scale, brand wise, enterprise level data architecture projects within an AWS infrastructure
Operate as a subject matter expert within the brand for all things data architecture, translating technical requirements to non-technical stakeholder
Identify areas of improvement for the data team (new technology that can be implemented, etc.) - offering a rare opportunity to shape the architecture yourself.

Supporting the Data Science team with the definition, population and build of our data lake, and the Analytics team with the data warehouse
Aligning with the Data Science roadmap, ensuring alignment with IT Data Squads and supporting allocation of resource.
Working closely with ML Engineers during definition of Data Science Projects, reviewing feasibility and potential designs and opportunities.
YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

To qualify for this Data Architect role, you must have:
Extensive experience with a cloud data architecture (AWS ideally but GCP and Azure experience will certainly also be considered)
Extensive understanding and experience of data modelling
A true "self-starter" attitude, with the initiative to identify issues, an rectify them (both with tech, and processes)
Strong stakeholder management skills, with a personable, communicative manner.

Experience using languages/tools such as SQL and NoSQL, Python and Docker

Experience developing, deploying and maintaining machine learning APIs 0 using flask and java springboot

title: Data Scientist - Digital Platform
description:
Apply Now
Data Scientist
** Digital Platform **
SALARY - £60k - £65k
LOCATION - Remote to begin with, then Central London
We are searching for an experienced Data Scientist to join this recognisable online platform, amongst a growing team of machine learning and AI experts.
THE TEAM
The business are hugely invested in data and using this to drive decisioning across the business. You will be working alongside some very credible data experts, who hail from the likes of Aimia, Dunnhumby and other major marketing agencies who specialize in this field.
You will be joining a small team of 5 and will responsible for leading on innovative approaches and new ways of thinking, helping to upskill those around you with your technical knowledge. It’s a great time to join the team as they plan to expand and grow further next year, so you will be part of a small, visible, and influential set up at an early life stage - great if you want to make your mark!
THE TECH
We require the following skills as a base:
Strong Python programming experience - data manipulation, preparation and processing of data, feature engineering, modelling and using all the regular libraries.
Machine learning skills - experience with one or more of the following; logistic or linear regression, gradient boosted trees, supervised techniques such as classification
PLUS at least one of the following unsupervised learning techniques; segmentation, cluster analysis, NLP, text recognition, deep learning, Bayesian techniques
Basic stats knowledge - this does not mean you should understand the formulas behind every statistical technique, but you should be able to talk confidently about why and how one algorithm is a better option than another, be able to talk about their pro’s and con’s and why you would use (for example) Random Forest over another technique?
They are also in the throws of embedding Data Bricks, so the team will have their own environment to play in, a notebook environment which encourages a very collaborative approach from the team, where you can build, monitor and optimise your models.
They are also about to embark on using open source banking data, so yet another data set at your fingertips! Which can be used in a variety of ways and even added to existing models and algos to optimise them too.
YOU
In addition to the above, equally as importantly, we are looking for someone who is outcome focused, able to deliver to high standards (has due diligence to check own work) and on time, and should be able to evidence this at interview. You should be of a curious nature, as this role will allow you to work fairly freely when thinking about new approaches and coming up with fresh ideas.
This is also a highly collaborative role whereby you will be working with other teams such as CX UX, CRM, BI and analytics, so an ability to present technically at varying levels of complexity is key.
