title: Insight & Reporting Analyst - Product (Leading eCommerce Fashion Brand)
description:
Apply Now
Insight & Reporting Analyst - Product
** Leading eCommerce Fashion Brand **
Join this small yet influential team as part of major growth phase
Exceptional leadrship in your Director, heralding from management consultancy and major retail brands
Chance to grow your own personal technical skills and abilities as they enter into the modern world of data science
SALARY - £25k - £35k & benefits
LOCATION - Remote / Manchester - flexible working with some travel required
THE OPPORTUNITY
With investment from the top into data and all its uses, this is an exciting time to be joining the company and they look to understand and explore their customer’s behaviours and relationships with the brand in more detail than ever before. As always, there is the challenge of educating and liberating existing stakeholders across many different functions within this fashion giant as to the possibilities of data driven decision making and actionable insights - which is where this role comes in.
Working as part of a team of data experts across customer analytics, product, marketing, finance and customer service, you will focus on delivering reports, self service analytics and insights around product performance for the group. You will report into the Product Analytics Manager and will both work to build relationships with key stakeholders in buying, merchandising and finance to understand their needs, challenges and potential for using data to improve decision making around demand forecasting, customer engagement and in turn commercial product performance. In this role, we’ll need people with natural intellectual curiosity to go beyond the basics of just building out regular reports, and expect you to provide proactive insights and commentary on the data analysed.
This role still requires hands on SQL programming skills, plus knowledge and demonstrable experience with a reporting tool such as Power BI, Tableau or Qlikview (the latter being the tool they currently use inhouse). There is huge opportunity for personal and technical growth and development within this role, as the business accelerates it’s data function into the modern age, embracing AI and machine learning techniques where appropriate as well as step changing the influence data has on decisioning across the group of brands. They have already invested in a cloud based platform (GCP) and are very open to using open source tech such as R and Python for more advanced analytical solutions and projects.
The culture is fast paced, young and agile, and with double digit growth YOY, this company continues to lead the way in fast fashion. But with the inevitable slowing of such growth on the horizon, there is an agenda to make the brand unique and distinctive, by tapping into the data and through the use of analytics and data science.
Skills and experience required:
Educated to at degree level in a numerate subject; Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, Chemistry, Economics, Machine Learning, Computer Science etc.
At least intermediate coding skills using SQL for data analysis, manipulation and extraction
Proven experience using a reporting and data visualisation tool such as Power BI, Tableau or Qlikview for building engaging and interactive dashboards
Exposure to big data sets (millions) and ideally some experience of working in a cloud based environment; Azure, AS or Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
Strong communication and relationship building skills - you will be business facing and working to develop relationships in multiple departments
A curious nature, and inquisitive nature with the ability to spot commercial opportunity to use data to improve business or product performance

title: Senior Decision Science Analyst
description:
Apply now

Up to £65,000
London
I'm currently seeking a Senior or Lead Analyst for a Predictive Modelling role at an exciting financial services brand. You'll need experience developing Credit Risk Scorecards as well as strong academics and an excellent record of problem solving through data within a Financial Services environment.
Use data and apply advanced analytics to accurately predict customer defaults in a Credit Risk environment through application and behavioural Scorecard development, using both traditional and machine learning techniques. With end to end ownership, you'll need to present and defend the accuracy of these models to the credit committee as well as mentoring and leading the team. This is the perfect role for someone looking for an opportunity to learn and grow, with increased responsibility and accountability on offer!
THE ROLE
Develop statistical models using rtraditional and machine learning techniques (logistic regression, KNN, Random Forests, XGBoost, etc.) to accurately predict Credit Risk defaults and customer behaviour across the customer life-cycle (Scorecards)
Present your analysis and models to the Decision Committee and Stakeholders
Dig into data and raw information through statistical analysis to discover trends and patterns that can be used to drive the lending strategy across the Credit Risk lifecyle
Actively push the boundaries in modelling, predictive analytics and business insights to ensure the latest developments in data science and analytics are leveraged
Develop and manage models for IFRS9 purposes (PD, LGD, EAD)

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
The successful candidate will likely have the following skills and experience:
Master degree (preferred) in a STEM or similar discipline
Previous experience developing predictive models or applying machine learning algorithms withina consumer Credit Risk setting (Credit RIsk Scorecards)
Proven stakeholder management experience
Experience managing databases with SQL and using statistical computing languages R, Python or SAS (some not all of these are required)
HOW TO APPLY
Email your CV or use the apply feature on this page
KEYWORDS
Credit Risk Analytics, Credit Risk Models, Basel, AIRB, Scorecards, Decision Science, Machine Learning, Data Science
SAS, SQL, PD, LGD, EAD, IFRS9, Logistic Regression, Decision Tree, Probability of Default, Exposure of Default, Loss Given Default

title: Data Scientist
description:
Apply now
DATA SCIENTIST
£50,000 - £80,000 + BENEFITS
REMOTE (MUST BE UK BASED)
THE COMPANY
This up and coming health start-up are looking for a Data Scientist to deliver actionable and meaningful product insights using advanced analytics. This company has a vast amount of data to work through and as a Data Scientist, you will be working to deliver essential product insight that will allow the company to continue growing.
THE ROLE
As a Data Scientist, you can expect to be analysing and interpreting results of both testing and optimisation experiments in a statistical and scientifically sound manor. By collaborating data engineers, you will be making sure that the right data is collected to produce actionable, but more importantly, relevant insights to the business.
More specifically, you can expect to be involved in the following:
Identification of opportunities to increase revenue through product optimisations
Analysis and interpretation of testing results and optimisation experiments in a statistical and scientific manor using SQL and visualisation tools such as Looker, Tableau, etc
Using Data Science techniques and methodologies with open source tech such as Python or R
Analysis of customer behaviour for the purpose of generating insights and testable hypotheses
Identification, design and iterative improvement of workflows and processes
YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
The successful Data Scientist will have the following skills and experience:
Educated to a degree level with a significant quantitative component (e.g. math, computer science, physics or economics), Master's or PhD desirable
Statistical background with knowledge of regressions and hypothesis testing
Full proficiency using SQL, coding from scratch(or similar)
Significant experience with large-scale A/B testing and familiar frameworks
Experience using Python for data science techniques, building models of attribution, LTV, segmentations
Experience using data visualisation tools such as Power BI, Looker, Tableau
THE BENEFITS
The successful Data Scientist will receive a salary between £50,000 and £80,000 with an extensive benefits package. title: Senior Insight Consultant / Senior Applied Sciences Expert
description:
Apply Now

Senior Insight Consultant / Senior Applied Sciences Expert
SALARY - £60k - £70k plus excellent benefits
LOCATION - Remote, then Central London
ROLE
We are looking to hire an experienced analytical Insight Consultant or Insights Analyst, someone skilled in using analysis and data science to solve business problems for end clients.
But this is more than just an Analyst role, you will be using your skills to dive into the data to pull out information which helps major brands to better understand 'how we should segment our customer base to improve targeted marketing’ or 'where we should locate our next stores - and most importantly, why?’…the possibilities are broad and fascinating!
This is all about being able to make recommendations to clients, act as a go between the Data Scientists and client stakeholders, working to consult around their challenges and questions, using data creatively to solve these problems.
WHAT MAKES THIS ROLE DIFFERENT?
Analytics for decision making, and beyond! You are more than an Analyst, you are a business consultant in ways, taking your recommendations to new levels where you recommend wider client strategies off the back of your findings. They’re less prescriptive and more around problem solving.
High level exposure to some of the UK’s most complex data environments
Working for one of the UK’s largest marketing agencies; huge investment into training, impressive clients and inspiring leaders
Range of clients across entertainment, travel, automotive and retail - diversify your sector experience and grow at speed!
WHATS IN IT FOR ME?
Exceptionally high level of talent within this function - so peer learning is a reality, you will be inspired by your team, not just senior leaders. Although they are pretty awesome too and lead from the front with clear vision, strategy and commitment to genuinely disrupting what a long standing approach to analytics from marketing agencies alike. Their approach to date has generated incredible clients and a thirst for more and more advanced data projects - so the best is yet to come and you could be part of that journey. With their rapid growth, there is huge opportunity for promotion and growth into management, whilst also being able to apply your creativity in solution and product design.
EXPERIENCE REQUIRED
Educated to degree level in a numerate subject
You will have experience in analytics and insight consulting, developing data driven recommendations for large brands, solving problems using modern data science solutions, thinking strategically and commercially about the application of data in a wider business context
You will have skills in analysis using SQL to an advanced level, plus ideally use of Python
Excellent skills in building relationships with stakeholders, working with them to uncover needs for data solutions and working to enhance client strategies off data driven recommendations
TO APPLY

- Work closely with the development team to build a best in class tech stack
- Drive data performance and analaytics

-  MSc, ideally PhD, in  Data Science, Maths or technology
- Ideal candidate will come from a Quant background
- Experience within Personal Lines Insurance is preferable but not essential

description:
Apply now
Data Scientist - NLP
£70,000 + Equity
London

THE ROLE

Harnham are currently working with a start-up in London who are looking to hire a specialist in Natural Language Processing and Deep Learning.

As a business they look at complex social listening problems, analysing vast amounts of unstructured data, and they are currently building a very exciting product in the market.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Apply now
Data Scientist - Central London - £60000 - £80000
Wade Macdonald are excited to be working with a highly successful boutique consultancy based in London who are looking to add a lead Data Scientist to their team. You will be working with leading FTSE companies as they bring cutting-edge, innovative solutions, powered by DigitalDNA, to life. They combine subject-matter expertise with strategy, technology and transformation consultancy to provide our clients with clear value.
About the Role
You will join the business as part of the senior leadership team, being the lead data scientist. Along with the duties / objectives below you will manage two members of staff, supporting their development as well as assigning tasks to them.
You will be expected to lead the development of an artificially intelligent system that breaks down a project into the skills and resources needed to fulfil the demand for various clients across law and financial services.
Collect data, performed feature engineering and integrated multiple machine learning algorithms and created a Rest API. Deployed the code to an AWS machine.
Your main areas of focus will be 5g, Blockchain, IoT as well as digital transformation
You will also be working with Cambridge and Imperial College London undergraduates throughout the year who will help with code and delivery.
The Successful Candidate:
You will have experience in the majority of things below.
Expertise in the field of Data Science & Artificial Intelligence
Being able to understand client needs from technical perspective
Target Driven
Strong hands on coding ability
Experience in leading and developing junior data scientist
Knowledge of techniques including, Machine learning, Deep Learning, NLP, Time Series, graph data analytics, pattern detection etc.
Experience using Python, Spark or R
Knowledge and experience using SQL
Use of the up to date Data Science platforms, Experience building and deploying solutions to Cloud (AWS, Google Cloud & Azure)
What you will receive in return
Along with having a great opportunity to step up into the senior management team and be able to have impact into the strategic development of the organisation you will benefit from:
Remote Working
Very Competitive Salary
Centrally located office should you need/want to go in
Next Steps:
Apply to this advert and I will be in touch!
Applications are encouraged from all candidates meeting or exceeding the minimum criteria for the role regardless of age, disability, gender, orientation, race, religion or ethnicity.

title: Web Application Developer
description:
Apply on employer's website
We are looking for a skilled and experienced Web Application Developer with a strong data management background.

You will work within the Data & Information Systems department working on projects focused on Data modelling, platform integrations and building data flows between essential business systems. The projects you will work on will be driven by data in close collaboration with senior stakeholders and external 3rd party service providers.

We are looking for candidates that are ready for a challenge, who work well in a fast-paced and rapidly growing ecommerce environment, and have experience iterating on front-end interfaces with a working knowledge of back-end data handling.

Responsibilities:

* Responsible for the design, development, and maintenance of data-driven web applications.
* Work with the Data & IS team to ensure data capture, management and intelligent design is at the core of every project and that thorough documentation and coding standards are adopted in line with efficient and growth-focused processes.
* Develop and leverage data products that will be used to propose innovative and profitable business initiatives to senior leadership.
* Work in an Agile environment to deliver high quality products against aggressive schedules.
* Drive technical projects with Senior Stakeholders and Data/Business Analysis teams which will require candidate to manage timelines and requirements.

You will have:

* BSc in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or relevant experience.
* Proficiency in functional programming languages (e.g. Python) as well as declarative programming languages (e.g. SQL).
* Comfortable writing and analysing data using SQL.
* Strong experience working with Python, using up to version 3.5 or later.
* Proficiency in modern web development including HTML5, CSS, and JavaScript frameworks (Angular JS, React, Backbone.js etc).
* Experience with browser APIs and optimizing front end performance.
* Familiarity with RESTful and SOAP web services as well as other integration technologies is strongly desired.
* Ability to implement features and user interfaces of internal client tools.
* Experience communicating with users, other technical teams, and senior management to collect requirements, describe product features, technical designs, and product strategy.
* The often-remote nature of the work requires excellent communication skills to provide clear, concise, accurate, and timely communication (verbal and written) to the right stakeholders.
* A strong track record of iterative design, working closely with business, product, and tech partners from inception through implementation.
* Write and maintain documentation to describe program development, logic, coding, testing, changes, and corrections.
* An interest in Machine Learning/ Data Science/ AI.

Desirable but not essential:

* An understanding of NetSuite, SAP or other business administration platforms.
* Experience or knowledge of eCommerce platforms, Amazon, eBay and other marketplace channels is strongly desired.
* Relevant work experience in BI, Analytics, or Data Science fields or comparable fields is strongly desired.
* Ability to take a project from scoping requirements through actual launch of the project.
* Experience with data visualization software like Power BI or Tableau.
* Experience in SuiteScript 2.0, SuiteFlow, jQuery or a strong desire and ability to learn and develop skills in other programming languages or disciplines.

Start: ASAP
Location: Cambridge, Cambridgeshire
Hours: Full Time
Salary: £32,000 to £35,000

If you are interested in this position, feel you have the relevant experience and skills and would like to apply, please call our team on or apply online.

Whilst we'd love to get back to every applicant, it is not always possible, so if you haven't heard from us within 3-5 days, please note that your application has not been successful on this occasion.

Aspire Cambridge is acting as an Employment Agency in regards to this Permanent opportunity.

title: Lead Data Engineer
description:
Apply now
Lead Data Engineer - £90,000- Banking - Manchester
Join a well-established player in the Banking industry who for ten consecutive years have held a four-star Fair banking mark and a 4 star rating on Trustpilot to recognise that we help customers manage money well.
They’ve undergone a huge digital transformation in the past few years. For example, they’ve revolutionised their mobile banking app so that it now has 3x the function it had when they started, and have really exciting plans in the pipeline. Their aim is to have the group be one of the leading digital businesses in Manchester and they are well on their way to achieving this vision.
It’s been incredible to watch them grow and develop over the past few years into a business that on one hand is slick, efficient and commercial, but also fosters a culture of putting people first - whether this by ensuring staff are happy, fulfilled and healthy, or the vast amount of volunteering and fundraising they do for good causes each year.
They are now looking for a Lead Data Engineer to join a diverse and friendly team, building dataflows into a data lake and data warehouse from a wide range of sources.
The wider Data Team is currently moving from a SQL Server based stack to a cloud-native solution in AWS. You will steer the development of a cloud native data platform that will enable sophisticated analysis and data science.
In this role you will:
Plan with analysts and data scientists on a regular basis to translate requirements into solutions and ensure delivery of successful business outcomes.
Architect the data warehouse and data lake for the cloud.
Ensure environments are stable and available.
Lead a team using Agile Kanban workflows to safely code, review, test and deploy solutions, using source control to manage changes.
Manage the DevOps processes for Data, and any tooling that guides the processes.
Design and build with the on-premise Microsoft BI stack, including SSIS, SQL Server and Power BI.
Design and build with an AWS-based BI stack, including Lambda, Redshift and Matillion.
Design and build connections to APIs, flat files, databases and data streams to our data lake (ELT).
Shape data from our data lake and form into a Kimball data warehouse (ETL).
About you:
Be experienced leading, mentoring and training a team of data engineers.
Be experienced with ETL tools like SQL, SSIS, AWS, Lambda and Python.
Be experienced with data warehouse concepts, including Kimball methodology.
Be experienced with SQL Server and Redshift management.
Have enthusiasm for deduction and problem solving, with a logical and curious mind.
Have a positive, enthusiastic and methodical attitude to development, business intelligence and data science.
Why work here?
As well as having the opportunity to work with, and learn from, one of the most commercially focused and results driven businesses in the North West, you’ll find lots of great extras too! These include:
Hapi benefits program, including discounts at leading supermarkets, cinemas and other leading retailers
On-site gym with free personal training
Personal lockers and showers
Basic 23 days holiday, plus public holidays. You’ll get an extra days’ holiday for every year served (up to 28 days)
An extra day of annual leave (taking the starting total to 24) on your birthday
Ability to buy and sell holiday entitlements
Paid Charity volunteer day, where the company give one working day a year to every employee to help out a charity
On-site training centre and self-learning facilities

title: Insight & Reporting Analyst - Ops & Customer Service (Leading eCommerce Fashion Brand)
description:
Apply Now
Insight & Reporting Analyst - Ops & Customer Service
** Leading eCommerce Fashion Brand **
Join this small yet influential team as part of major growth phase
Exceptional leadership in your Director, heralding from management consultancy and major retail brands
Chance to grow your own personal technical skills and abilities as they enter into the modern world of data science
SALARY - £25k - £35k & benefits
LOCATION - Remote / Burnley / Manchester - various options, flexible working with some travel required
THE OPPORTUNITY
With investment from the top into data and all its uses, this is an exciting time to be joining the company and they look to understand and explore their customer’s behaviours and relationships with the brand in more detail than ever before. As always, there is the challenge of educating and liberating existing stakeholders across many different functions within this fashion giant as to the possibilities of data driven decision making and actionable insights - which is where this role comes in.
Working as part of a team of data experts across customer analytics, product, marketing, finance and customer service, you will focus on delivering reports, self service analytics and insights around customer service and operations for the group. You will report into the Customer Service Analytics Manager and will both work to build relationships with key stakeholders in the call centres, supply chain logistics and carrier management departments to understand their needs, challenges and potential for using data to improve decision making. In this role, we’ll need people with natural intellectual curiosity to go beyond the basics of just building out regular reports, and expect you to provide proactive insights and commentary on the data analysed.
This role requires hands on SQL programming skills, plus knowledge and demonstrable experience with a reporting tool such as Power BI, Tableau or Qlikview (the latter being the tool they currently use in house). There is huge opportunity for personal and technical growth and development within this role, as the business accelerates its data function into the modern age, embracing AI and machine learning techniques where appropriate as well as step changing the influence data has on decisioning across the group of brands. They have already invested in a cloud based platform (GCP) and are very open to using open source tech such as R and Python for more advanced analytical solutions and projects.
The culture is fast paced, young and agile, and with double digit growth YOY, this company continues to lead the way in fast fashion. But with the inevitable slowing of such growth on the horizon, there is an agenda to make the brand unique and distinctive, by tapping into the data and through the use of analytics and data science.
Skills and experience required:
Educated to at degree level in a numerate subject; Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, Chemistry, Economics, Machine Learning, Computer Science etc.
At least intermediate coding skills using SQL for data analysis, manipulation and extraction
Proven experience using a reporting and data visualisation tool such as Power BI, Tableau or Qlikview for building engaging and interactive dashboards
Exposure to big data sets (millions) and ideally some experience of working in a cloud based environment; Azure, AS or Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
Strong communication and relationship building skills - you will be business facing and working to develop relationships in multiple departments
A curious nature, and inquisitive nature with the ability to spot commercial opportunity to use data to improve business or product performance

title: Customer Insight & Campaign Analytics Manager - Leading eCommerce Fashion Brand
description:
Apply Now
Customer Insight & Campaign Analytics Manager
** Leading eCommerce Fashion Brand **
Join this small yet influential team as part of major growth phase
Exceptional mentor in your manager, heralding from management consultancy and major retail brands
Chance to step change your own personal technical skills and abilities as they enter into the modern world of data science
SALARY - £50k - £55k & benefits
LOCATION - Remote / London / Manchester - flexible working with some travel required
THE OPPORTUNITY
With investment from the top into data and all its uses, this is an exciting time to be joining the company and they look to understand and explore their customer’s behaviours and relationships with the brand in more detail than ever before. As always, there is the challenge of educating and liberating existing stakeholders across many different functions within this fashion giant as to the possibilities of data driven decision making and actionable insights - which is where this role comes in.
With investment from the top into data and all its uses, this is an exciting time to be joining the company and they look to understand and explore their customer’s behaviours and relationships with the brand in more detail than ever before. As always, there is the challenge of educating and liberating existing stakeholders across many different functions within this fashion giant as to the possibilities of data driven decision making and actionable insights - which is where this role comes in.
Working as part of a team of data experts across customer analytics, product, marketing, finance and customer service, you will focus on delivering reports, self service analytics and actionable insights around customer and marketing performance for the group. You will have one direct report initially and will both work to build relationships with key stakeholders in many departments to understand their needs, challenges and potential for using data to improve decision making around customer behaviour and engagement, churn and retention, acquisition as well as marketing performance across multiple channels (predominantly digital). In this brand new role, we’ll need people with natural intellectual curiosity to go beyond the basics and establish the best way of measuring and improving marketing performance through test and learn frameworks and coming up with innovative and creative ideas around engaging and targeting customers, use data generated through the website, app and other channels such as CRM, third party, transactional and warehouse to do this.
This role still requires hands on customer and marketing analytics skills (SQL as a minimum), as with any opportunity that arises through change, you will need to bridge the gap between what they are currently doing now and where they are aiming to get to - working to build out capabilities and eventually a bigger team. So, there is huge opportunity for personal and technical growth and development within this role, as the business accelerates it’s data function into the modern age, embracing AI and machine learning techniques where appropriate. They have already invested in a cloud based platform (GCP) and are very open to using open source tech such as R and Python for more advanced analytical solutions and projects - all of which will be led by you, from a customer and marketing perspective.
The culture is fast paced, young and agile, and with double digit growth YOY, this trail blazer continues to lead the way in fast fashion. But with the inevitable slowing of such growth on the horizon, there is an agenda to make the brand unique and distinctive, by tapping into the data and through the use of analytics and data science.
Skills and experience required:
Educated to at least degree level in a numerate subject; Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, Chemistry, Economics, Machine Learning, Computer Science etc.
A strong background in customer and marketing analytics
Strong programming skills using SQL as a minimum for campaign analysis, measurement and targeting (campaign selections)
A problem solving approach, ability to apply analytics to improve customer understanding and in turn CRM and marketing campaign performance
A curious nature, and inquisitive nature plus an ability to build strong relationships with direct reports and senior level stakeholders

As the Data Scientist you will be responsible for boosting my client’s data analytics capabilities, working to enhance the quality of the data and analysis they provide to their customers. The Data Scientist will lead the way in creating creative and innovative solutions to novel problems.
The Data Scientist will be working with multiple stakeholders internally, including Software Developers, DevOps Engineers, and Product Managers. As a senior member of the team, the Data Scientist will also be expected to mentor more junior colleagues.

Founded by a group of University of Oxford academics, the Data Scientist will be joining an incredibly exciting research company. Based in central Oxford, their office is easily accessible by public transport. Currently at 150 members of staff over 3 offices, the company are looking to increase by 50% over the next 18 months and offer brand new services to their clients, so it’s an exciting time for a Data Scientist to join!
What’s Required?

Established experience as a Data Scientist within a commercial environment
Knowledge of statistics, linear regression, nonlinear models etc.

title: Lead Data Engineer (Relocation Opportunity in Manchester)
description:
Apply now
NB this role is based in Manchester City Centre
Lead Data Engineer - £90,000- Banking - Manchester
Join a well-established player in the Banking industry who for ten consecutive years have held a four-star Fair banking mark and a 4 star rating on Trustpilot to recognise that we help customers manage money well.
They’ve undergone a huge digital transformation in the past few years. For example, they’ve revolutionised their mobile banking app so that it now has 3x the function it had when they started, and have really exciting plans in the pipeline. Their aim is to have the group be one of the leading digital businesses in Manchester and they are well on their way to achieving this vision.
It’s been incredible to watch them grow and develop over the past few years into a business that on one hand is slick, efficient and commercial, but also fosters a culture of putting people first - whether this by ensuring staff are happy, fulfilled and healthy, or the vast amount of volunteering and fundraising they do for good causes each year.
They are now looking for a Lead Data Engineer to join a diverse and friendly team, building dataflows into a data lake and data warehouse from a wide range of sources.
The wider Data Team is currently moving from a SQL Server based stack to a cloud-native solution in AWS. You will steer the development of a cloud native data platform that will enable sophisticated analysis and data science.
In this role you will:
Plan with analysts and data scientists on a regular basis to translate requirements into solutions and ensure delivery of successful business outcomes.
Architect the data warehouse and data lake for the cloud.
Ensure environments are stable and available.
Lead a team using Agile Kanban workflows to safely code, review, test and deploy solutions, using source control to manage changes.
Manage the DevOps processes for Data, and any tooling that guides the processes.
Design and build with the on-premise Microsoft BI stack, including SSIS, SQL Server and Power BI.
Design and build with an AWS-based BI stack, including Lambda, Redshift and Matillion.
Design and build connections to APIs, flat files, databases and data streams to our data lake (ELT).
Shape data from our data lake and form into a Kimball data warehouse (ETL).
About you:
Be experienced leading, mentoring and training a team of data engineers.
Be experienced with ETL tools like SQL, SSIS, AWS, Lambda and Python.
Be experienced with data warehouse concepts, including Kimball methodology.
Be experienced with SQL Server and Redshift management.
Have enthusiasm for deduction and problem solving, with a logical and curious mind.
Have a positive, enthusiastic and methodical attitude to development, business intelligence and data science.
Why work here?
As well as having the opportunity to work with, and learn from, one of the most commercially focused and results driven businesses in the North West, you’ll find lots of great extras too! These include:
Hapi benefits program, including discounts at leading supermarkets, cinemas and other leading retailers
On-site gym with free personal training
Personal lockers and showers
Basic 23 days holiday, plus public holidays. You’ll get an extra days’ holiday for every year served (up to 28 days)
An extra day of annual leave (taking the starting total to 24) on your birthday
Ability to buy and sell holiday entitlements
Paid Charity volunteer day, where the company give one working day a year to every employee to help out a charity
On-site training centre and self-learning facilities
Please note due to high volumes of applications unfortunately we are not always able to respond to all unsuccessful applicants. However we wish everyone who applies the very best with their job search.

With investment from the top into data and all its uses, this is an exciting time to be joining the company and they look to understand and explore their customer’s behaviours and relationships with the brand in more detail than ever before. As always, there is the challenge of educating and liberating existing stakeholders across many different functions within this fashion giant as to the possibilities of data driven decision making and actionable insights - which is where this role comes in.
Working as part of a team of data experts across customer analytics, product, marketing, finance and customer service, you will focus on delivering reports, self service analytics and insights around product performance for the group.
You will have one direct report initially and will both work to build relationships with key stakeholders in buying, merchandising and finance to understand their needs, challenges and potential for using data to improve decision making around demand forecasting, customer engagement and in turn commercial product performance. In this role, we’ll need people with natural intellectual curiosity to go beyond the basics and establish the best way of measuring and improving product performance and coming up with innovative and creative ideas around how to use data generated through the website, app and other channels such as CRM, third party, transactional and warehouse to do this.
This role still requires hands on predictive analysis and modelling skills (SQL as a minimum, ideally experience with R or Python), as with any opportunity that arises through change, you will need to bridge the gap between what they are currently doing now and where they are aiming to get to - working with the Head of Analytics to build out capabilities and eventually a bigger team. So, there is huge opportunity for personal and technical growth and development within this role, as the business accelerates it’s data function into the modern age, embracing AI and machine learning techniques where appropriate. They have already invested in a cloud based platform (GCP) and are very open to using open source tech such as R and Python for more advanced analytical solutions and projects - all of which will be led by you, from a product perspective.
The culture is fast paced, young and agile, and with double digit growth YOY, this trail blazing brand continues to lead the way in fast fashion and there is an agenda to make the brand unique and distinctive, by tapping into the data and through the use of analytics and data science.
Skills and experience required:
Educated to at least degree level in a numerate subject; Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, Chemistry, Economics, Machine Learning, Computer Science etc.
Ideally experience of working in a digital environment
A strong background in commercial and product analytics, preferably in retail or fashion
Strong programming skills using SQL as a minimum, plus, ideally, experience using R or Python for more advanced programming and modelling
An understanding around demand forecasting, supply chain and logistics, as well as sales performance and product related challengesd
A problem solving approach, ability to apply analytics to improve product performance and customer engagement
A curious nature, and inquisitive nature plus an ability to build strong relationships with direct reports and senior level stakeholders

Salary: £40,000 to £50,000, DOE
Contract: Full time, Permanent
Vuzo is a fast-growing data science agency formerly based in the heart of London’s thriving Moorgate tech community, and now fully remote.
We are home to world-leading data science talent and patent-pending AI tech. We have been rapidly adding household name retail brands and public sector agencies to our client base. If you’re looking for a new challenge with more autonomy and influence in the direction of your company and role, this is a rare ground-floor opportunity at a profitable start-up.
Data Scientist - The Role
Reporting to the Technical Director, you’ll be responsible for turning data into decisions that have a large impact on our clients’ businesses.
You’ll be drawing insight and meaning from large datasets, and you’ll also use Vuzo’s IP to enrich these datasets with an abundance of third-party data such as ONS, CDRC, and our own proprietary datasets.
Working closely with the Account Management team and Technical Director, and supported by our team of senior data scientists and one junior data scientist, you’ll be responsible for scoping projects, importing & cleansing data, running analysis, and reporting back insights.
You’ll work within our established processes for data security, business continuity and GDPR compliance.
Ethically, you’ll remember that asking "should we" is just as important as "can we".
Data Scientist - Skills & Experience
Essential skills:
Good knowledge of R and SQL.
BSc degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics or similar quantitative discipline.
Version Control
Analysis workflows (Notebooks, Drake etc)
Loading and cleaning data from a variety of sources, (APIs, Databases, CSVs)
Statistical/ML techniques (clustering, time series, A/B tests)
Experience presenting results of complex analysis orally and in writing to stakeholders with
a range of quantitative skills
Desirable Skills:
Shiny development
R package development
Software development skills (testing, CI etc)
Docker
Your Traits
Curiosity and a willingness to learn is important. We want you to grow as the business grows.
Determination, grit and stamina: building a start-up is exciting, challenging and rewarding.
A natural dedication to nurture, lead & inspire your team-mates to achieve their potential.
Precision in working practices and ability to glean insights from data without a pre-given hypothesis.
*Personal Skills*
A self-starter who can move forward in the face of client uncertainty/ambiguity and can help bring clarity and impact to projects
Able to build and maintain good relationships throughout the organization and collaborate with other groups
A quick learner and able to adapt to changing environment and learn new, complex topics
Able to balance mathematical rigor with an action mind-set to solve real business problems expeditiously
Driven to solve problems and to collaborate with and learn from others
Package and Benefits:
Stock Options
Fully remote working. If we all decide to go back to an office one day, it will probably be in London and Bristol, and you’re welcome to join us there if you want to.
Herman Miller ergonomic chair
AXA PPP Private Health Insurance Scheme
3% Company Pension Scheme Contribution
Bike to work scheme
Lifestyle perks e.g. gym membership, car hire and gig ticket discounts
28 days of holiday increasing with tenure
To Apply:
If you’re ready to take the next step in your career and join our friendly, professional team who are dedicated to delivering our vision for global growth, then please click on APPLY to be considered.
Due to the volume of applications, we receive we are unable to respond to all applicants. If you do not hear from us within four weeks please assume that your application has been unsuccessful.
Note: We are not offering sponsorship or a relocation package for this role. We always welcome international candidates to apply providing they are eligible to work and live in the UK.
No agencies Please!

title: Insight Consultant / Insight Analyst
description:
Apply Now

Insight Consultant / Insight Analyst
Problem solver rather than prescriptive Analyst?
Enjoy being business or client facing and working with people?
Confidence to suggest innovative or new ways of doing things?
Then this role is JUST what you’ve been looking for….neither a Management Consultant or Analyst role, but a blend of the two within a marketing environment!

SALARY -                    £35k - £50k depending on experience, plus excellent benefits
LOCATION -               Remote, then Central London
ROLE
We are looking to hire an ambitious analytical Insight Consultant or Insights Analyst, someone skilled in using analysis and data science to solve business problems for end clients.
But this is more than just an Analyst role, you will be using your skills to dive into the data to pull out information which helps major brands to better understand ‘how we should segment our customer base to improve targeted marketing’ or ‘where we should locate our next stores – and most importantly, why?’…the possibilities are broad and fascinating!
This is all about being able to make recommendations to clients, act as a go between the Data Scientists and client stakeholders, working to consult around their challenges and questions, using data creatively to solve these problems.
WHAT MAKES THIS ROLE DIFFERENT?
Analytics for decision making, and beyond! You are more than an Analyst, you are a business consultant in ways, taking your recommendations to new levels where you recommend wider client strategies off the back of your findings. They’re less prescriptive and more around problem solving.
High level exposure to some of the UK’s most complex data environments
Working for one of the UK’s largest marketing agencies; huge investment into training, impressive clients and inspiring leaders
Range of clients across entertainment, travel, automotive and retail – diversify your sector experience and grow at speed!
WHATS IN IT FOR ME?
Exceptionally high level of talent within this function – so peer learning is a reality, you will be inspired by your team, not just senior leaders. Although they are pretty awesome too and lead from the front with clear vision, strategy and commitment to genuinely disrupting what a long standing approach to analytics from marketing agencies alike. Their approach to date has generated incredible clients and a thirst for more and more advanced data projects – so the best is yet to come and you could be part of that journey. With their rapid growth, there is huge opportunity for promotion and growth into management, whilst also being able to apply your creativity in solution and product design.
EXPERIENCE REQUIRED
Educated to degree level in a numerate subject
You will have experience in analytics and ideally insight consulting, developing data driven recommendations for large brands, solving problems using modern data science solutions, thinking strategically and commercially about the application of data in a wider business context
You will have skills in analysis using SQL to an advanced level, plus ideally use of Python
Excellent skills in building relationships with stakeholders, working with them to uncover needs for data solutions and working to enhance client strategies off data driven recommendations
TO APPLY

For further information or to apply please contact:

Kate McDermott  - Managing Consultant @ Blue Pelican Marketing


Share through your CV to
Text me on
Share through your LI profile if you’re non-active and simply curious
You don’t have to have a CV to find a new job! We’re always keen to talk to good data experts.

For more vacancies which may suit your needs, please visit us at www.bluepelican.com

title: Lead Software Engineer Python OR .NET Greenfield Project
description:
Apply now
Lead Software Engineer | Greenfield Project, HealthTech, Fully Remote
£80,000
Happy 2021. This is my first job of the new year and it's a banger! Are you a Senior Engineer looking to move up or someone who is ready to take on more of a management position but don't want to lose the hands-on element? We have worked with this company for 3 years and have built one of the best software teams in Bristol. They are a software engineering and data science consultancy who support pioneering organisations deliver new products and services that rely on data and data science.
I'm looking for someone who has a background using Python or you may be someone who is really intrested in moving into it as your core skill so we are also intrested in speaking to developers with solid backend expereince, ideally in a C based lanuage to be able to transion into Python.
The business has been going for 10 successful years and we have helped them grow to 55 Python Developers, data scientist and engineers who have been busy building a first of its kind software product in the emerging space of Genomic Medicine. The majority of the team were based in Bristol, however due to covid moved to a remote first business and that's the plan for the future, however they are planning on getting together once a month later in the year.

About the role:

This role will be dedicated to working exclusively on a new service, which is backed by an alpha-stage data platform, to develop specific analytical feature-sets for the clients. You'll interact with customers alongside SME's. The ULTIMATE goal will be to help establish the new service in the marketplace by creating the new, capabilities.
To move things forward we're looking for a Lead Engineer to join their talented engineering team to achieve their ambitious goals for the rest of this crazy year and beyond. You will have a transformative impact by contributing significantly to the software of this new project as well as leading a high performing engineering team.
You will be expected to be a hands-on leader giving your team a high level of autonomy while assisting and mentoring them in a number of areas. You will be an ambassador of their values and continue to implement the right approaches. You'll create an inspiring team environment where ideas and knowledge are shared, and openness is valued.

What you'll be doing day to day:

Delivery of assigned development work to agreed timelines and standards
Client satisfaction with the quality of the product delivered and service experienced
Leadership and development of a high-performing software engineering team. - 20% of your time coding and 80% will be managment and some architecture decisions.
What your background will look like:
Experience with a backend lanuage, ideally Python, Java OR .NET - Willingness to cross skill into Python.
Experience in leading, coaching and mentoring.
Experience building and designing scalable and performance systems and making significant contributions to the wider engineering goals of the company.
Experience in software architecture patterns, database optimizations, infrastructure, scalability and deployment.
If you are more fullstack and have experience with Typescript and React then woohoo they'd love that!
Cloud experience big plus!

Benefits:
Salary £80,000
25 days holiday plus bank holidays
Fully Remote working
Pension

They are also building a flexible benefit offering, that will enable you to choose from a range of options including, Private Health, Employer Pension AVCs, Nursery Vouchers, Additional Holiday, Perk box, gym and yoga membership etc.
They have built a brilliant diverse team and value diversity and foster inclusive environment. They are committed to equal employment opportunity and want to ensure that their recruitment process is accessible to everyone
Sound good, 2 stage interviews asap.

title: Credit Risk Manager - Credit Cards
description:
Apply now
Our Client
Our client are a very early stage financial services provider operating in the personal finance space. They will be looking to launch their business with a focus on credit cards and then growing into current accounts and then looking to apply for a banking licence in due course.
The role of Credit Risk Manager
We are looking to hire a dynamic and seasoned credit risk professional to join the credit card risk team.
In this role you will be responsible for the development and execution of the credit risk policy and form part of the first line of defence. You will develop data driven updates to our credit playbook and hold our first line accountable to deliver meaningful outcomes for our merchants and develop a framework that helps the business to be part of the growth journey for businesses of all sizes.
Your strong knowledge of financial statements and ability to assess businesses individually and as a portfolio will be your key to success within this role. We are looking for an individual with a humble approach to get the job done and test and trial hypothesis hands on.
What you’ll do in the role of Credit Risk Manager
Lead root cause analysis into credit risk events
Create frameworks where there is limited structure
Write procedural flows for our first line of defence
Maintain a credit risk register and controls
Build dashboards which are the source of truth and keep our fingers on the pulse
Conduct regular macroeconomic assessments to forecasts stress in our portfolio
Work with big data and with data science professionals
What you’ll need to be a Credit Risk Manager
4+ years credit risk management experience - ideally in the credit cards space
Quantitative credit risk experience
Knowledge of credit risk mitigating products like bank guarantees, third party liability insurance, director’s guarantees and others
Strong knowledge of financial statements including P/L, Banks Statements, Cashflow and Projections
Strong partnerships experience with internal and external stakeholders
Strong people skills and capacity to get people motivated
Knowledge of the payments space and all key players including issuers, acquirers, merchants and networks
Capacity to work under pressure and tight deadlines

title: Customer Insight & Campaign Analytics Manager - Leading eCommerce Fashion Brand
description:
Apply Now
Customer Insight & Campaign Analytics Manager
** Leading eCommerce Fashion Brand **
Join this small yet influential team as part of major growth phase
Exceptional mentor in your manager, heralding from management consultancy and major retail brands
Chance to step change your own personal technical skills and abilities as they enter into the modern world of data science
SALARY - £50k - £55k & benefits
LOCATION - Remote / London / Manchester - flexible working with some travel required
THE OPPORTUNITY
With investment from the top into data and all its uses, this is an exciting time to be joining the company and they look to understand and explore their customer’s behaviours and relationships with the brand in more detail than ever before. As always, there is the challenge of educating and liberating existing stakeholders across many different functions within this fashion giant as to the possibilities of data driven decision making and actionable insights - which is where this role comes in.
With investment from the top into data and all its uses, this is an exciting time to be joining the company and they look to understand and explore their customer’s behaviours and relationships with the brand in more detail than ever before. As always, there is the challenge of educating and liberating existing stakeholders across many different functions within this fashion giant as to the possibilities of data driven decision making and actionable insights - which is where this role comes in.
Working as part of a team of data experts across customer analytics, product, marketing, finance and customer service, you will focus on delivering reports, self service analytics and actionable insights around customer and marketing performance for the group. You will have one direct report initially and will both work to build relationships with key stakeholders in many departments to understand their needs, challenges and potential for using data to improve decision making around customer behaviour and engagement, churn and retention, acquisition as well as marketing performance across multiple channels (predominantly digital). In this brand new role, we’ll need people with natural intellectual curiosity to go beyond the basics and establish the best way of measuring and improving marketing performance through test and learn frameworks and coming up with innovative and creative ideas around engaging and targeting customers, use data generated through the website, app and other channels such as CRM, third party, transactional and warehouse to do this.
This role still requires hands on customer and marketing analytics skills (SQL as a minimum), as with any opportunity that arises through change, you will need to bridge the gap between what they are currently doing now and where they are aiming to get to - working to build out capabilities and eventually a bigger team. So, there is huge opportunity for personal and technical growth and development within this role, as the business accelerates it’s data function into the modern age, embracing AI and machine learning techniques where appropriate. They have already invested in a cloud based platform (GCP) and are very open to using open source tech such as R and Python for more advanced analytical solutions and projects - all of which will be led by you, from a customer and marketing perspective.
The culture is fast paced, young and agile, and with double digit growth YOY, this trail blazer continues to lead the way in fast fashion. But with the inevitable slowing of such growth on the horizon, there is an agenda to make the brand unique and distinctive, by tapping into the data and through the use of analytics and data science.
Skills and experience required:
Educated to at least degree level in a numerate subject; Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, Chemistry, Economics, Machine Learning, Computer Science etc.
A strong background in customer and marketing analytics
Strong programming skills using SQL as a minimum for campaign analysis, measurement and targeting (campaign selections)
A problem solving approach, ability to apply analytics to improve customer understanding and in turn CRM and marketing campaign performance
A curious nature, and inquisitive nature plus an ability to build strong relationships with direct reports and senior level stakeholders

You will be deploying ML models and solutions development with data scientists.
You will be developing solutions and working through it in an end-to-end role: from modelling, through to implementation.
YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCES
You will have extensive experience in Python.
You will have experience in cloud technologies such as AWS, GCP or Azure.
You will have worked with SQL and No-SQL databases.
You will need an Masters or a PhD in a stats based subject.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Apply now
As a Software Engineer you will be working closely with our Informaticians and Data Scientists. You will be helping to leverage the tools and techniques they design into products that can be, initially, used within the company, then extended to our partners and ultimately as commercial products.
Our codebase is diverse, with a focus on selecting the right tool for the job. We are not afraid to refactor and adapt to meet our goals.
Client Details
We are a Not For Profit organisation who look for insight and innovation regarding the discovery of new drugs and medicines. Based in Alderley Edge we are on the Astrazeneca site, our Software Engineer team works closely with both the Data Science and Informatics team. We sit between academia and the commercial world, developing products that in the future may be adapted to commercial software.
Description
As part of the Software Engineering team you will be working closely with our Informaticians and Data Scientists. You will be helping to leverage the tools and techniques they design into products that can be, initially, used within the company, then extended to our partners and ultimately as commercial products. You will be helping the team solve problems around data management and processing, along with then working to productise the team's effort
All our Software Engineer are unique and bring not only enthusiasm but also a vast range of expertise and knowledge. A new member to the team will be accomplished in building a diverse range of software and tools, from hardcore data crunching engines to front end web interfaces and should be able to demonstrate this through a portfolio of work. They should also be able to discuss and show knowledge of different design patterns as well as the coding paradigms of procedural, object oriented and functional programming.
Profile
Our current technology stack includes, but not limited to:
Python, NodeJS, Go, Java, Scala, Bash, HTML, CSS, JavaScript
PostgreSQL, Cassandra, Redis, MongoDB, Neo4J
Kafka & RabbitMQ
Docker & Kubernetes
AWS, GCP & Azure
Job Offer
This role is easily commutable for anyone travelling from the Manchester, Wilmslow, macclesfield, knutsford, Warrington, Liverpool, Northwich area, however remote working is also available. There is free on site parking, and a free shuttle bus from the nearest train station if using public transport.
Excellent Salary, benefits, career progression, pension, work from home.

title: Senior Data Scientist - Time Series/ Forecasting Experience
description:
Apply now
SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST - Time Series/ Forecasting Experience
UP TO £85,000 + BENEFITS
LONDON

Do you want to make a positive difference towards revolutionising the UK energy industry using advanced machine learning techniques?

THE COMPANY:
As a Senior Data Scientist, you will work for an award-winning company that is receiving big investment from one of the largest companies in the world. Their mission is to deliver renewable energy to all their customers and plan on using AI and machine learning technology to lead the way in renewable future.
THE ROLE:
The role of Senior Data Scientist will require you to use complex analytics, data science and machine learning techniques to create business insights, bringing a fresh approach, a problem-solver attitude and previous commercial experience in forecasting.
Specifically, you can expect to be involved in the following:
Researching, developing an implementing machine learning techniques, using Python, Spark, Kafka
Forecasting and predicting energy consumption using large amounts of data and real-time analytics
Creating algorithms that optimise energy assets in real-time
Mentoring Junior Data Scientists and providing help with more advanced machine learning problems
YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
The successful Senior Data Scientist will have the following skills and experience:
Educated to Master's level in a STEM degree focused in quantitative methods and statistics (Science, Technology, Economics, Statistics, Physics, Engineering, Mathematics etc)
Fluency in Python
Mentoring or managing experience of more junior individuals
An innovative, curious and problem-solving mind-set

title: Principal Data Scientist - Supply Chain
description:
Apply now
Principal Data Scientist - Supply Chain
London
£90,000 - £120,000
This is an exciting new opportunity for a Principal Data Scientist to join a successful product company!
THE COMPANY
This product company are extremely popular and have incredible success over the past year leading to substantial growth. They have just received Unicorn status so it's a really exciting time to join them. They've created a brand new role for an experienced Senior or Lead Data Scientist to be the technical lead for their Supply Chain area of the business so if you're a Data Scientist and you've worked within the supply chain space this could be a great opportunity for you to have a huge impact on a growing business.
THE ROLE
As the Principal Data Scientist for the business you will:
You will work with the Data Scientists in the supply chain team and lead them technically on all Data Science projects
You'll be using a variety of machine learning techniques including both classical and deep learning with the aim of optimising the supply chain - this involves procurement, packaging, distribution, couriers and logistics
You'll be liaising with other senior stakeholders in the business such as product managers and engineers
SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Bachelors/Masters/PhD in a numerical field is essential (Operational Research, Mathematics, Physics etc)
An excellent understanding and proven commercial experience using machine learning techniques for supply chain optimisation
Excellent end to end machine learning experience from conception to productionisation
Tech: Python, SQL, AWS/GCP
SALARY AND BENEFITS
Basic salary £90,000 - £120,000
Benefits
Flexible working
HOW TO APPLY

title: Technical Business Analyst / Scrum Master - Tech Consultancy
description:
Apply now
Technical Business Analyst - Tech Consultancy
This niche Technology Consultancy near London are doing some SERIOUSLY cool stuff to help businesses- they use a mixture of Data Science, Machine Learning, and advanced Mathematics to help increase security across sectors including Government and Intelligence, and Finance. They use genuinely ground-breaking, ultra-secure, high performance, cloud-based data infrastructure in order to do this and have gone from strength to strength in the 4 years that they've been around!
As a Technical Business Analyst, you will work within a super fast paced environment, in an agile technical Delivery team. This is certainly a hybrid between business and technical, so you need to be comfortable with both sides! You will lead and own the system, business and data analysis activities for this company's products and services, and you'll also get involved with some scrum mastering. You'll be doing anything from conducting data analysis to identify data requirements, to working closely with the Solution Architect and IT department, and even running workshops.
What you'll ideally have:
At least 5 years-experience within a similar Business Analyst role, either technical, product, or software
A degree or more in Computer Science or similar
Experience with some basic scrum master duties and working within an agile Delivery team
Excellent stakeholder management/engagement skills
Skilled in collating, interpreting data and analysing results
Experience in running workshops
This role is based 3-4 days per week from Croydon and the rest of the time from home, so you'd need to be comfortable with commuting to Croydon.
Please note candidates must be SC Cleared, of if not, you have been in the UK for a minimum of 5 year without a break of 6 months or longer, so you can apply for SC Clearance.
Interviews happening ASAP, please get in touch with Gina from SR2 ASAP or apply using the link, and I'll be in touch.

title: Backend Developer - Remote UK
description:
Apply now
Job; Backend Developer - Remote UK
This company provides deep market intelligence on patients and their medicines. They capture, curate and structure unstructured insights on what people are saying and doing when they take their medicines in the community. Patient insights are captured through proprietary tech tools engaging with patients both directly and indirectly. Data is structured to their database of curated medicines which aligns to approved global medicines. Data insights are aggregated into patterns of behaviour and available by subscription to marketing leads in global pharmaceutical companies to spot opportunities or identify barriers by medicine, putting the patient voice into decision making.
As a Backend Developer in their development team, you will:
Develop their infrastructure, backend and API
Be involved in their whole development process, from design to implementation, testing and launch
Collaborate with NLP experts and Data scientists to integrate their models, and connect to third party data sources (e.g. Twitter, Reddit)
Handle non-functional aspects such as reliability, scalability, security
They are looking for an experienced Backend Software Engineer with expertise in:
Backend and API development, using Python, SQL databases, Azure cloud computing
Software development, with a record of developing and launching successful projects
Agile software development, continuous integration (CI/CD), test-driven development
Working as part of a remote or distributed development team
Other Stuff;
£’s; fully DoE approx. £80k (neg.) + benefits
Location; remote / home based (with very occasional (& fully expensed) travel to their Glasgow office when absolutely required)
Interested? Please send your (Word) CV,
Not for you but you know someone suitable? - Profile 29 can pay a referral fee,

title: Senior Pricing Analyst (Market Pricing)
description:
Apply now
Senior Pricing Analyst (Market Pricing)
Leeds
£40,000 to £60,000 + Benefits
Our client, a respected composite insurer, is currently looking for a Senior Pricing Analyst (Market Pricing).
The main purpose of the role is to assist the Pricing Manager in achieving their strategic objectives, providing risk pricing recommendations and insight, based on leading modelling and analytical work.
Due to the current situation, the position is completely home based.
Responsibilities
Maintain and develop best practice pricing models and price optimisation techniques.
Analyse, evaluate and assess new rating factors and develop pricing structures incorporating these.
Guide the business in determining pricing action required to achieve the business’ objectives.
Maintain an expert level of general technical knowledge of pricing and analysis tools available i.e. Radar, Emblem, SAS, SQL, etc.
Automate, streamline and document pricing processes, to make them as efficient as possible.
Line management responsibility.
Requirements
Graduate with a Degree (2:1 or above) in a numerate subject i.e. Mathematics, Physics, etc.
Excellent numerical, analytical and problem solving skills.
Must have price optimisation experience using Radar.
Must have Motor and/or Household Personal Lines insurance experience.
Experience of using Emblem or Radar or other data modelling tools, such as R, Python, SAS, and SQL.
An understanding, and experience of, statistical and mathematical techniques applicable in general insurance pricing, risk selection and analysis, and/or: a background in data science, with particular experience in machine learning, statistical analysis and predictive modelling on large datasets.
Strong communication skills.
Ideally, you will have experience of managing a small team of Analysts, although this is not essential.
Keywords: Pricing Analyst; Pricing Models; Price Optimisation; Personal Lines Insurance; Motor Insurance
Please note that due to a high volume of applications we receive daily, we are only able to contact applicants which have passed the initial CV screening stage. If you have not heard from us within 5 working days of your application, please assume that you have been unsuccessful.
We do not retain any personal information without your permission. Please refer to our data protection policy on our website for more information.

title: Software Engineering Manager. Global Startup. Big Data
description:
Apply now
A superb opportunity to build & lead a New engineering function for a global startup who specialise in Big data.
Client Details
The client is a leading data platform for secure and effectual use. Powered by core identity resolution capabilities and an unparalleled network, data is used to transform customer experiences and generate more valuable outcomes.
The client is fully interactive and neutral infrastructure delivers end-to-end addressability for some of the world's most sought after brands, publishers and agencies
Description
You will:
Recruit, hire, scale and act as a leader within a growing team of engineers.
Collaborate closely with internal teams and external partners to drive product delivery.
Be actively involved in strategic direction and product decisions for an emerging business.
Bring a wealth of best practices from past experiences to the team.
Foster a positive environment of integrity, empowerment, initiative, and teamwork.
Have an impact across the entire product suite.
Your team will:
Design and build a global data solution that delights our key customers.
Extend our platform capabilities to address in-country requirements in the global market.
Work closely with various internal teams (engineering, product, SRE, and data science) on product delivery.
Profile
The ideal candidate wil be:
About you:
5+ years of hands-on development experience and 3+ years of experience leading engineering teams.
Have strong recruiting skills, with a track record of hiring new team members who are extremely effective over the long term.
Have a passion and track record for leading teams to deliver scalable services, APIs, and infrastructures.
Have a product mindset and enjoy solving complex business problems with technology.
Have extremely strong written and spoken communication, with the ability to effectively change communication style based on the audience (executive leadership, marketing, management, product, engineering, data scientists). Ability to explain complex technical topics at appropriate levels of detail for each audience.
Have prior hands-on experience with the JVM ecosystem and public cloud technology.
Type S(tartup) personality: smart, ethical, friendly, hard-working and proactive.
As a bonus if you have:
Experience working with big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark, Presto, Airflow, etc).
Experience working with external partners to drive product delivery.
Prior experience with customer data platforms.
Job Offer
in return, you will be offered a unique opportunity to build and grow a new engineering function in a business that is going strength form strength and has a solid hub in London as their European base.
You will also be offered an excellent base + bonus package!

title: DV Cleared Data Scientist
advertiser: Anson McCade Ltd - IT and Finance Recruitment
description:
Apply now
Data Scientist
This cutting edge intelligence arm delivers solutions which help to protect and enhance the connected world. Their solutions combine large scale data exploitation, 'intelligence grade' security and complex services and solutions integration. They operate in four key domains of expertise: Cyber Security, Financial Crime, Communications Intelligence and Digital Transformation.
Their people apply intelligence to protect and enhance national and organisational assets so that they can grow and prosper - from improving the health and efficiency of leading corporations to protecting critical infrastructures, safeguarding vulnerable people and catching criminals.
About the Role:
Understands how to gain specific insight from data in order to address a business problem. The Data Scientist creatively applies data science approaches to develop analytic results which turn data into information - information into knowledge and insights - and valuable, actionable insights into better decision making and game-changing strategies.
The Data Scientist can identify the necessary input data and where to obtain it; they combine, clean and prepare the required data to ensure the analysis is robust. The Data Scientist is able to communicate the significance of the results back to the business as actionable insights and to identify next steps.
Data Scientists often work closely with Data Engineers and Solution Architects to embed a specific technique into a production platform.
Skills Needed
Must hold active DV MOD Security Clearance
Understands data manipulation and analysis techniques ranging from data aggregation and Management Information reporting (MI), to statistical-based analytics such as propensity modelling and segmentation, to advanced approaches such as machine learning and predictive analytic approaches.
Able to exploit analytical technology including knowledge of coding languages (e.g. R, Python, etc.)
Combines core consulting skills with technical versatility as they uncover hidden patterns in data and effectively present results to clients with varying levels of technical understanding.
Able to tell stories with data - both verbally and visually, helping key decision makers move from ad-hoc analysis into continual data conversations.
Understands different analytic, algorithmic, data mining and data visualisation techniques to find data insights, underpinned by strong core consulting skills. Has an awareness of machine learning.
Applies appropriate data analysis, data modelling, and quality assurance techniques, based upon a detailed understanding of problem space, business and processes, to establish, modify or maintain data structures and associated components (entity descriptions, relationship descriptions, attribute definitions).
Has an awareness and ability to evaluate analytic technology options.
The Package
Base salary of up to £75,000
Car Allowance - Up to £6,000
Up to 10% Bonus
Pension
Fantastic Career progression opportunities
