Their people apply intelligence to protect and enhance national and organisational assets so that they can grow and prosper - from improving the health and efficiency of leading corporations to protecting critical infrastructures, safeguarding vulnerable people and catching criminals.
About the Role:
Understands how to gain specific insight from data in order to address a business problem. The Data Scientist creatively applies data science approaches to develop analytic results which turn data into information - information into knowledge and insights - and valuable, actionable insights into better decision making and game-changing strategies.
The Data Scientist can identify the necessary input data and where to obtain it; they combine, clean and prepare the required data to ensure the analysis is robust. The Data Scientist is able to communicate the significance of the results back to the business as actionable insights and to identify next steps.
Data Scientists often work closely with Data Engineers and Solution Architects to embed a specific technique into a production platform.
Skills Needed
Must hold active DV MOD Security Clearance
Understands data manipulation and analysis techniques ranging from data aggregation and Management Information reporting (MI), to statistical-based analytics such as propensity modelling and segmentation, to advanced approaches such as machine learning and predictive analytic approaches.
Able to exploit analytical technology including knowledge of coding languages (e.g. R, Python, etc.)
Combines core consulting skills with technical versatility as they uncover hidden patterns in data and effectively present results to clients with varying levels of technical understanding.
Able to tell stories with data - both verbally and visually, helping key decision makers move from ad-hoc analysis into continual data conversations.
Understands different analytic, algorithmic, data mining and data visualisation techniques to find data insights, underpinned by strong core consulting skills. Has an awareness of machine learning.
Applies appropriate data analysis, data modelling, and quality assurance techniques, based upon a detailed understanding of problem space, business and processes, to establish, modify or maintain data structures and associated components (entity descriptions, relationship descriptions, attribute definitions).
Has an awareness and ability to evaluate analytic technology options.
The Package
Base salary of up to £75,000
Car Allowance - Up to £6,000
Up to 10% Bonus
Pension
Fantastic Career progression opportunities

title: Bioinformatician
description:
Apply now
Bioinformatician - Cambridge
This role is an exciting opportunity for a Computational Biologist to join a ground breaking biotech start-up in the Cambridge area.
You will be working alongside a dedicated cross-disciplinary team who are all striving to push the boundaries of synthetic and stem cell biology. Reporting to Senior Scientists, you will be joining a highly collaborative team of computational biologists with diverse skill sets who work together to lead decisions and analysis in discovery and characterisation of reprogrammed cell lines. This is an opportunity to join one of the best stem cell reprogramming start-ups and conduct research with a real-world impact.
Bioinformatician key responsibilities:
Working collaboratively with the wider computational biology team and experimental stem cell scientists under supervision of senior scientists.
Contributing to the design and execution of our ambitious research programmes for uncovering core transcriptional programs that define human cell types.
Performing computational analyses and reporting of results.
Development of tools to facilitate data interpretation by laboratory scientists.
Bioinformatician Profile
Essential:
Have a PhD in computational biology or a related biological field with a strong bioinformatics component.
Enjoy tackling research challenges through critical thinking, scientific rigour and inventiveness.
Are detail-oriented with strong organisational skills for tracking data and recording downstream analysis.
Enjoy working in a dynamic team environment and are comfortable working to tight timelines and managing workload and priorities.
Demonstrable experience with analysis of large high-throughput sequencing datasets (esp. bulk RNA-seq and/or single cell RNA-seq).
Good knowledge of bioinformatics tools, resources and public databases.
Solid biological knowledge and interest, and familiarity with laboratory experimental design.
Proficient in R and/or python.
Working knowledge of statistical approaches in data science.
Ability to clearly communicate requirements for and results of bioinformatics analyses to wet lab biologists
Desirable:
Experience of working with ChIP-seq, ATAC-seq and/or other genomic technologies.
Familiarity with gene regulatory networks, mechanisms of gene expression, developmental biology, and stem cell biology.
Experience in the analysis of whole-genome sequencing data.
Oxford Nanopore sequence analysis.
Experience with cloud computing (preferably AWS; Nextflow a plus).
Experience in development of NGS analysis pipelines for large numbers of samples.
Familiarity with version control systems for code reproducibility.
Experience in the development of tools that help experimental biologists visualise and interrogate data.
This role is with a truly revolutionary company and offers an unrivalled opportunity to be part of their journey moving forwards. If this role sounds of interest to you, please don't hesitate to get in touch directly with Jamie @ Tec Partners.

title: Recruitment Consultant
description:
Apply now
Recruitment Consultant Technology
Are you an experienced Recruitment Consultant looking to move into a more Principal or Senior role? Or perhaps you are already a Principal consultant but looking for a new challenge with better rewards and work life balance?
My client are looking to grow the team within their Technology brand and it is imperative they have individuals join the team who are, like them, driven to make their stamp on the market and providing the best service to their clients, candidates and each other.

The ideal candidate will have a minimum 2 years' 360 recruitment experience and knowledge working within specialisms such as Analytics, Data and Data science, AI etc as well as evidence of building and growing their market. Confident communication skills are key and someone who wants to be part of their team and culture, not just stand on the side lines!
The opportunity
Since starting up they have made it their mission to create an environment of 'Good Humans' who are driven & high achievers, as well as team players who continuously support and encourage one another.
Given recent times, this company have stuck together now more than ever to ensure the wellbeing of one another.
What this client can offer you:
Competitive base salary + uncapped commission and no threshold
(starting salary up to £40,000 DOE, with uncapped commission)
Flexible and remote working with no KPI's
Incentives: Quarterly Lunch Clubs, International and European Trips, Loyalty bonuses such as The gift of time (Sabbatical leave or a personalised gift) and Millionaire centurion club!
Transparent and fast career progression: Their team has a 100% promotion success rate in the first 12 months!
Structured training programme: Be included on their Future Leaders training to help your mentoring and management skills go from "Good to Great"!
A high performing team-based sales culture: They've hit every sales target set over the last 3 years and have an amazing team with individuals full of energy and enthusiasm.
If this sounds like the right next step for you, apply directly!
SW6 Associates recruit into; Technology Recruitment, Finance Recruitment, Oil Recruitment, Media Sales, Business development, Account Management, Gas Recruitment, Energy Recruitment, IT Recruitment, Management Consultant Recruitment, Engineering Recruitment, SAP Recruitment, HR Recruitment, Legal Recruitment, Paralegal Recruitment, Technology Sales Investment Banking Recruitment, Hedge Fund Recruitment, Digital Recruitment, Media Recruitment, Marketing Recruitment, Finance and Economics Sales, Public Sector Recruitment, International Recruitment, Pharmaceutical Recruitment, Bioscience Recruitment, Procurement Recruitment, Business Intelligence Sales, Supply Chain Recruitment, Management Recruitment, Board Recruitment and Executive Recruitment, Banking Recruitment, Consultancy Sales, Change Management Recruitment, Insurance Recruitment, Multi-lingual Recruitment.

title: Population Health Data Analyst
description:
Apply now
Job Title: Population Health Data Analyst
Location: Homebased
Salary: £30,000 to £40,000 + Benefits
Job Type: Permanent
Job Reference: LH10017
Our client is a software house committed to providing clinical software solutions to the healthcare sector and they are seeking a permanent Population Health Data Analyst as part of the Population Health Analytics team. You will work closely with the team and use cutting edge Azure technology to create dynamic analytics for use by health and care professionals.

Experience & Skills:
Experience of using SQL databases and writing SQL queries to analyse databases to an intermediate level
Some knowledge and experience of creating analytical visualisations and dashboards
Experience of data validation and data interpretation
Good numerical skills and good attention to detail
Experience in translating requirements into analytics
Some knowledge of statistical techniques and the application of data science
Experience (Desirable)
Knowledge of the health and care domain including policy, data flows and reporting requirements
Knowledge of NHS data sets and informatics currencies covering GP data sets, acute data sets including SUS data, community, mental health and social care
Knowledge of information governance rules and requirements within health and care
Knowledge of risk stratification, population segmentation and outcomes analysis
Experience of creating dashboards and reports in Microsoft Power BI
Some knowledge of cloud environments and Microsoft Azure functionality
Previous experience of working within a health or care organisation
Experience of testing software
Some knowledge of agile development methodologies
Knowledge of health economics
Qualifications
A Bachelor’s Degree in related subject (desirable)
Key responsibilities:
Supporting the delivery and implementation of the population health product into health and care organisations
Work on customer sites as required
Work with the population health consultant team to design and develop analytical tools to meet customer / national requirements
Support end users in developing their own analytics capability
Support customers in developing analytical reporting and tools that measure benefits of health and care interventions
Engage with clinicians and care professionals to understand analytical requirements
Create supporting documentation and training documentation for end users
Train end users in the use of tools
Perform second line support for analytical tools and use case dashboards
Test and quality assure analytics solutions
Undertake project support tasks as required
Wilde Associates is working in the capacity of an Employment Business for this role

description:
Apply now
Senior Data Analytics Recruitment Consultant
This technology recruitment business is a well-established, collaborative company looking to onboard a Data Analytics/ Data Science recruitment consultant with 3 to 5 years’ experience in their space.
You will thrive in an exciting environment and join an inclusive, family like team. They are an established recruitment agency with about 10 years+ presence in their field, and so a genuine work ethic and commitment are expected. Organisation, discipline and the absolute desire to achieve and work at your maximum every day are expected.
You will join an established team of senior recruiters and will be expected to collaborate and be to learn and develop in a long-term opportunity in a fast growth business.
The Candidate will have the following:
- 3-5 years’ experience working a data desk
- Proven 360 experience picking up and engaging new business
- Previously billed 150k+ in 12 months
- Previous experience recruiting in Europe is a big plus but not mandatory
- Established Tech network/ candidate database
- Driven, ambitious and money hungry
What’s in it for you:
- Market leading commission structure going up to 40%
- Amazing culture and welcoming teams
- Access to an award-winning training program
- Fast track career progression scheme
The potential is there for grafters to be promoted regularly through a steep career development plan.
APPLY BELOW TO FIND OUT MORE
RULE Recruitment is here to support you through the process, prepare you for interview and advise you on how to communicate your talents to perspective employers.
Realise your potential with RULE!

title: BI Analyst
description:
Apply now
BI Analyst (Junior/Graduate)
Location: Birmingham - (Fully Remote working role options)
Salary: £25,000
Benefits: Remote working, Bonus, Flexi working hours, 25 days Holliday + Public Holidays, good pension, bespoke career progression plans, lots of free technical training courses, and lots of other great benefits!
Buzz Words - Business Intelligence / BI / Data / SQL / ETL / Graduate / Junior / Remote working / Coding / Developer / BI Analyst / BI Developer / IT / Degree
Opportunity
An opportunity has come up for a Junior BI Analyst to work for a market-leading Financial services organisation right in the heart of Birmingham. With this opportunity, you will get a chance to work with a fantastic team working on some exciting Greenfield projects, while also working with or getting trained to work with data visualisation tools such as Power BI.
If progression is something you are after in a role then this opportunity and role will be the place for you! They offer free technical training of your choice whilst allowing cross over project-based work. So if you want to start learning different areas of data, you’ll get a chance to gain exposure to brand new technologies and truly decide which area you wish to pursue.
With Data Science, Machine Learning, Data Viz, Cloud Tech just to name a few of the many areas you can learn, this a great opportunity for Graduate or Junior Analyst to make a big step in their career.
Role and Tasks:
• Help design and develop automated solutions to assist the business in its operation, using Power BI, Excel and the Microsoft SQL Server 2016 suite of products
• Ongoing reconciliation and validation of account data and model result
• Analysing trends in the performance and behaviour of the Group’s loan assets based upon historical data
• Production of regular reporting which supports the financial month-end accounting process, regulatory reporting and capital analysis
Requirements
• Min 12 months experience using SQL Server, exposure to ETL tools would be beneficial
• Experience needs to be in a developer role (involving coding) not analytics/visualisations
• Independent/self-starter/positive/enthusiastic/desire to learn and develop
• Good numerical/IT degree
If you feel you have the required skills and experience to be considered for this opportunity and would like to hear more details, please forward an up-to-date version of your CV, and you will be contacted back within 24 hours!

title: Product Designer - UX / UI / Dashboards - Up to £60,000
description:
Apply now
The Company:
My client is a leading global industry research platform. They leverage proprietary knowledge search technology powered by the latest in machine learning, natural language processing, and data science to connect decision makers to globally distributed knowledge faster than ever before. Professionals at investment firms, consultancies, corporations and nonprofits rely on them to connect them seamlessly with knowledgeable domain experts who help enhance their thinking, inform critical decisions and propel their business forward. Founded in 2008, my client currently employs nearly 1,000 professionals in nine offices around the globe and regularly ranks as one of the fastest-growing companies in the world.
The role:
We're looking for a Product Designer to drive product-led innovation. You'll work on complex design projects across multiple product teams and shape user experience across the business. You'll join our rapidly-evolving, global technology function and take on challenging assignments that have the potential to transform the way the entire company operates. It's a great opportunity to bring to life human-centered design products - that meet both user needs and business goals - to a space ripe for disruption.
What you'll do:
Define the end-to-end user experience on various products, collaborating with our product managers, designers, and engineers to turn that vision into reality.
Lead design projects through the product development lifecycle, working closely with Product & Engineering as we understand problems and iterate through solutions.
Plan and execute user research, deploying all the tools in your arsenal to understand user motivations, habits, and workflows.
Distill your work into highly engaging and functional sketches, wireframes, user journeys, prototypes, and hi-fidelity designs - communicating and presenting these ideas to both technology and commercial stakeholders.
Champion user experience and advocate for design and user research best practice across the organisation, helping to build our design culture and systems.
Who you are:
Live and breathe UX and product design - are up-to-date with, and ideally driving forward, best-practices in the industry.
Excel using the tools of the trade (e.g., Zeplin, Sketch, InVision), particularly rapid prototyping technology.
Love tackling ambiguous design problems, combining both intuitive and analytical thinking, and have the grit to get to a desirable and viable solution.
Are a clear thinker and persuasive communicator with an ability to gain support for your ideas and engage with stakeholders across the company to gather feedback.
Have excellent organisational, time, communication, and project management skills.
Ideally Have working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and Javascript (preferred).
Have experience working with multidisciplinary teams e.g., Engineers, PMs, CP, etc (preferred).
This job ad was posted by Salt. To find out more about Salt's Privacy Policy and how your application is processed, please visit our website https://privacy-policy/.

title: Agile Business Analyst - Public Sector
advertiser: Anson McCade Ltd - IT and Finance Recruitment
description:
Apply now
Agile Business Analyst - Public Sector
Quick Summary:
Join an innovative and respected division of a consultancy group which is at the forefront of addressing the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms for our clients
You will work on projects and programmes that are making a difference within the public sector whether that is in the national security space or regional/local government agencies.
We are a firm that believe in developing and nurturing, allowing you to have 10 paid training days a year and funding with training/certs
Who are we?
We are a global leader in consulting, digital transformation and technology services, combining strategy, data science, technology and creative design with deep industry knowledge and insight to create the business models and digital solutions of the future
In this role you would be supporting and engaging with our Government clients to help propose solutions and then deliver these through a range of programmes including pure business change, system and digital integration.
The role
You will be expected to examine the client's issues, propose a range of possible solutions and guide them in selecting one which you may then help design, build and implement. The projects you will be working on are within the public sector and therefore you ideally need a current SC or DV Clearance.
As an Agile Business Analyst you will be at the heart of our delivery teams allowing clients to successfully transform. Through identifying and analysing problems and issue that may affect effective adoption of the service, you will be ensuring plans and objectives are achieved.
You'll play a key role support the process of taking government digital services through a structured engagement process to deliver their connection to the identity assurance service.
As this role is within a consultancy we are expected to be flexible with working away from home if the client site is not within commuting distance. When on client site you will have accommodation, food and travel expensed.
You will be awarded a generous salary and package including: private medical, 6% pension if you put in 4%, income protection, 25 days holiday.
Your background
Prior experience will include:
Experience working for a consultancy or onsite with a government/public sector client
Analytical mind and ability to clearly communicate with all levels in an organisation
Working in an agile environment using agile practices
Experience developing and delivering solutions
Strong presentation and articulation skills
Strategic thinking
Application of relevant tools and techniques - i.e: customer journey mapping, detailed operating model design, process mapping
If you are keen on hearing more about exploring this position please apply today.
Reference: AMC/EWA/BA/32/CP/1
Type: Permanent
Consultant: Emily Watkins
Salary: £40,000 - £48,000

title: Data Scientist
description:
Apply now

Data Scientist urgently required for a one of a kind Scottish Data Analytics business who offer extensive flexible working as they take over the US and European markets ensuring Data Protection is adhered to. This is the opportunity to get on-board with a company who are the only experts in their field - writing the rule book so to speak.

You:
Your will come from a strong academic background holding either a PhD or Masters in Statistics, Data Science or related subjects. Due to the sensitivity of the work you will be doing, meticulous attention to detail will be required as you help businesses protect vital personal information from being accessed and utilised. You will be a team player, an out of the box thinker with strong interpersonal skills as client facing work will be required.

What are the key responsibilities?
** Data Manipulation, Integration, Processing and Interrogation of very large data sets.
** Produce comprehensive reports of your findings.
** Liaise with clients (via telephone or video) and present your findings
** Suggest innovative ways in which clients can better protect their data privacy and security.
** Keep up to date with latest data legislation across different continents.

Experience & Knowledge
** Industry or academic experience working with large data sets.
** Expert knowledge in one or more data analysis packages (Python, R etc).
** Ideally be able to demonstrate ability to produce comprehensive statistical reports.
** Good interpersonal and communication skills
** Any experience or knowledge in data privacy and legislation would be beneficial but not essential.

This really is the opportunity to work with a business who are working on nothing but greenfield projects in a unique market where you will effectively be writing the rule book. You will have the freedom to use the tools you want and a clear path set out from day one for career progression.

If this position sounds of interest, please call Tom Edmondson at Cathcart Associates for more details.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Apply now
DATA SCIENTIST
MILTON KEYNES/LONDON
£50,000 - £65,000
THE COMPANY
This is an exciting opportunity to be a Data Scientist at a leading accreditation provider who offer a wide range of services both B2C and B2B.
THE ROLE
As a Data Scientist, you will be providing insight to key stakeholders and teams across the business. You will be responsible for the development of the analytics piece in the company, collaboratively working to work on multiple projects in a timely manner.
You will be doing this using your technically sound skills in SQL and Python or R, whilst it would also be good if you can visualise data using tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
More specifically you can expect to be doing the following;
Working on projects such as LTV, propensity modelling and monitoring digital funnels
Understanding website functionality
Scoping out requirements e.g. What can be achieved? How will it be achieved?
Working with extensive and disparate datasets to draw insights and actionable recommendations to senior teams
Using SQL and Python/R for Data Science techniques such as Machine Learning, recommender systems, time series forecasting, AB testing, clustering and segmentations
YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
The successful Data Scientist will have:
Strong coding skills using SQL and Python/R in a commercial environment
Experience building and adapting customer segmentations, propensity, machine learning models etc
Strong stakeholder engagement skills with the ability to translate data into effective insight
Educated to degree level in a STEM subject
Experience working large and disparate datasets
Experience creating dashboards and reports in Tableau
THE BENEFITS
The successful Data Scientist can expect to earn a salary between £50,000 - £65,000. Alongside this, you will receive a generous benefits package in a company with an excellent culture and opportunity to help build the team.
HOW TO APPLY
Please register your interest by sending you CV to Dylan Butcher via the apply link on this page.

title: Customer Data Analytics Manager
description:
Apply now
Success Appointments are looking for a Customer Data Analytics Manager to join a well-known British retailer. The company is revolutionising the way they work and are in the middle of their transformation to become a digital-first business. They’ve won numerous employment awards and offer their staff excellent learning and development opportunities. It’s a great time to join the business as they transform how they work and attract the best talent to drive it forward.
As a Customer Data Analytics Manager you will be responsible for analysing and producing insights on customer growth initiatives across the business. You'll be analysing a broad range of initiatives, with a particular emphasis on new digital and data driven initiatives which use state of the art technologies. You'll be the go-to analytical expert for these insights, using metrics such as customer engagement and profitability, and communicating your findings to key stakeholders. Joining a cross-functional team that pushes boundaries, you will have access to extensive data and analytical tools. This is a critical role for the business and your insights will shape the future of customer engagement and growth across the business.
Experience required:
- 5+ years' experience in analytics, preferably with experience in retail or customer data analytics.
- A strong technical skillset is essential. You must be an advanced user of SQL/PySpark and Python.
- Experience using Power BI or similar.
- Experience mining large and complex data sets.
- Experience using statistical and data science techniques to deliver business projects.
- Ability to deliver analytical insights and recommendations in a commercial and compelling manner.
This position offers a fixed salary of up to £55K depending on experience + bonus + excellent employee benefits.
If you have the relevant experience for this role, please send your CV to Olivia Constantinides, along with your salary expectations.
We regret that due to the volume of applications, only successful applicants will be contacted.

title: Lead Developer, Python, Data Scientist, AI, CNN, Computer Vision
description:
Apply now
Lead Developer, Python, Senior Data Scientist, AI, CNN, Computer Vision
The New Year brings new opportunities and if you are a Lead Developer / Senior Data Scientist with key skills in Computer Vision, AI, CNN (Convolutional Neural Networks) and Python, this opportunity is for you! My client, an exciting start-up software company, is urgently seeking a skilled and experienced Lead Developer / Senior Data Scientist to join their project team.
The successful candidate will join this company in its early stages, in order to provide day-to-day leadership/mentorship to other team members as well as produce clean, scalable code all focussed around Artificial Intelligence advancements.
The Company
Joining a start-up requires someone with flexibility, pragmatism and initiative, as well as a willingness to embrace problems to work to find solutions, but the work will be hugely rewarding, as you get to see each day, the impact that you’re having upon the product’s progress.
As well as working in an exciting and fast-paced environment with worldly applications, the successful candidate with benefit from flexible working including some possibility of remote working.
What’s Required?
To be successful in this position, the chosen Senior Data Scientist / Lead Developer will be required to have:
Sound experience developing in Python
Experience using either PyTorch or Tenorsflow for CNNs (Convolutional Neural Networks
A sound understanding of Computer/Machine Vision
Willingness to work with customers within the defence sector
Prior experience as a Lead Developer is highly advantageous as well as a MSc or PhD in Machine Learning, Computer Vision or a similar field.
Experience working and leading in an Agile team environment is also desirable.
What Next?
If you’re passionate about development and Data Science and the above role sounds like you, apply now for immediate consideration.
Lead Developer, Senior Data Scientist, Python, AI, CNN, Computer Vision, PyTorch, Tenorsflow, Machine Learning
Corriculo Ltd acts as an employment agency and an employment business.

title: Data Visualisation Analyst
description:
Apply Now
Data Visualisation Analyst
** Top Data Marketing Agency **
LOCATION -        Central London
SALARY -              £35k - £55k (depending on experience)
Investment in training, personal development and a wide variety of cutting edge data science projects to be part of – perhaps a little different to churning out reports for stakeholders who lack interest, engagement and appetite for anything innovative or new?
A familiar story methinks for a lot of data visualisation and reporting experts out there….but change is a foot, and one of our most successful data agency clients has built out a specialist team which is collaborative, involved and an integral part of bringing customer insights to life for clients who take data VERY seriously!
We are working very closely with a top Marketing Data Agency to find a highly skilled data visualisation specialist who enjoys bringing insights to life around customer behaviour and marketing activity, through engaging and visually impressive dashboard design.
You will work alongside another Senior level Data Visualisation Analyst and a wider team of reporting and data visualisation experts, building out dashboard and visualisation solutions for a variety of clients.
Technically you should have strong skills using Tableau OR Power BI (as they use both in house), as well as the ability to work in a fast-paced agency environment, often interacting with multiple client stakeholders – so strong communication skills are key in order to gather requirements, scoping out solutions from delivery all the way to the final wireframe build.
Core Responsibilities:
Devising, building, designing, implementing and maintaining reporting dashboards
Built, update and automate data flows
Provide documentation and training guides
Ability to interpret the data and bug fixing
EXPERIENCE REQUIRED
Educated to degree level, ideally in a numerate subject
Experience in bringing insights to life, derived through customer insight and marketing analysis, through building dashboards and designing data visualisation solutions
Strong experience of Tableau or Power BI for reporting, dashboarding and visualisation purposes
SQL programming skills; understanding of SQL queries and database joins
Understanding of ETL process
Ability to troubleshoot and solve numerical and technical problems
High attention to detail
Good communication skills, written, verbal, etc.
TO APPLY

For further information or to apply please contact:

Kate McDermott  - Managing Consultant @ Blue Pelican Marketing

Text me on
Share through your LI profile if you’re non-active and simply curious
You don’t have to have a CV to find a new job! We’re always keen to talk to good data experts.

title: Senior Media Effectiveness Analyst
description:
Apply now
Our client are a major full service Media Agency based in Central London. Considered one of the best agencies in town, they have a superb client base and reputation in the industry.
A new position with the Media Analytics team, the agency are looking to recruit a Senior Analyst to mentor and lead a small team of analysts. The role would ideally suit someone looking to make the step up into a manager role, or an individual looking to further develop their management experience.
A hands-on role, in addition to managing and coaching a small team, the successful applicant will be working across a broad portfolio of projects and clients across Insight (particularly MMM & econometric modelling), Customer Analytics and Digital (Attribution modelling, MTA, etc).
We are looking for someone with a media analysis background, likely gained within a media agency or media evaluation consultancy. You'll be an absolute whizz with Excel (pivot tables / vlookups / macros, VBA, etc) and be comfortable generating dashboards and delivering reports. You'll have experience using one of the main statistical analysis tools (EViews, QED, Stata, SPSS, etc), be familiar with SQL and ideally will have some exposure to data science tools such as Python or R.
Essential Requirements:
Media effectiveness / analytics background (likely 4 years plus), gained within a media agency, media evaluation consultancy or client side.
Expertise in econometric / MMM modelling to look at media performance across all media channels.
Attribution modelling experience - particularly Multi-Touch Attribution would be highly advantageous
Familiarity with statistical analysis software (Eviews / Stata / etc)
Well developed communication and relationship building skills
Data visualisation & dashboarding
Able to work well with other team members with strong interest in mentoring and leading others
Task focused; able to prioritise and manage multiple deadlines across a range of client requirements
Comfortable managing client relationships and explaining complex analytics to non-technical key stakeholders
This is a superb opportunity for a media analyst who is looking to develop their management experience and technical skills whilst working on major clients within a leading media agency 'name.'

title: Backend Developer - Remote UK
description:
Apply now
Job; Backend Developer - Remote UK
This company provides deep market intelligence on patients and their medicines. They capture, curate and structure unstructured insights on what people are saying and doing when they take their medicines in the community. Patient insights are captured through proprietary tech tools engaging with patients both directly and indirectly. Data is structured to their database of curated medicines which aligns to approved global medicines. Data insights are aggregated into patterns of behaviour and available by subscription to marketing leads in global pharmaceutical companies to spot opportunities or identify barriers by medicine, putting the patient voice into decision making.
As a Backend Developer in their development team, you will:
Develop their infrastructure, backend and API
Be involved in their whole development process, from design to implementation, testing and launch
Collaborate with NLP experts and Data scientists to integrate their models, and connect to third party data sources (e.g. Twitter, Reddit)
Handle non-functional aspects such as reliability, scalability, security
They are looking for an experienced Backend Software Engineer with expertise in:
Backend and API development, using Python, SQL databases, Azure cloud computing
Software development, with a record of developing and launching successful projects
Agile software development, continuous integration (CI/CD), test-driven development
Working as part of a remote or distributed development team
Other Stuff;
£’s; fully DoE approx. £80k (neg.) + benefits
Location; remote / home based (with very occasional (& fully expensed) travel to their Glasgow office when absolutely required)

title: Senior Pricing Analyst (Market Pricing)
description:
Apply now
Senior Pricing Analyst (Market Pricing)
Manchester
£40,000 to £60,000 + Benefits
Our client, a respected composite insurer, is currently looking for a Senior Pricing Analyst (Market Pricing).
The main purpose of the role is to assist the Pricing Manager in achieving their strategic objectives, providing risk pricing recommendations and insight, based on leading modelling and analytical work.
Due to the current situation, the position is completely home based.
Responsibilities
Maintain and develop best practice pricing models and price optimisation techniques.
Analyse, evaluate and assess new rating factors and develop pricing structures incorporating these.
Guide the business in determining pricing action required to achieve the business’ objectives.
Maintain an expert level of general technical knowledge of pricing and analysis tools available i.e. Radar, Emblem, SAS, SQL, etc.
Automate, streamline and document pricing processes, to make them as efficient as possible.
Line management responsibility.
Requirements
Graduate with a Degree (2:1 or above) in a numerate subject i.e. Mathematics, Physics, etc.
Excellent numerical, analytical and problem solving skills.
Must have price optimisation experience using Radar.
Must have Motor and/or Household Personal Lines insurance experience.
Experience of using Emblem or Radar or other data modelling tools, such as R, Python, SAS, and SQL.
An understanding, and experience of, statistical and mathematical techniques applicable in general insurance pricing, risk selection and analysis, and/or: a background in data science, with particular experience in machine learning, statistical analysis and predictive modelling on large datasets.
Strong communication skills.
Ideally, you will have experience of managing a small team of Analysts, although this is not essential.
Keywords: Pricing Analyst; Pricing Models; Price Optimisation; Personal Lines Insurance; Motor Insurance
Please note that due to a high volume of applications we receive daily, we are only able to contact applicants which have passed the initial CV screening stage. If you have not heard from us within 5 working days of your application, please assume that you have been unsuccessful.
We do not retain any personal information without your permission. Please refer to our data protection policy on our website for more information.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Apply now
DATA ENGINEER
A leading UK listed group within the FMCG space with an acclaimed technology function is now looking to hire a data engineer to join their team. Full time remote working is available & their head office is near Dunstable, should working within the office be more desirable. You will be working within one of the teams that is lead by their inspirational CTO.
Working within their technology team, the incoming data engineer will work to improve upon the existing infrastructural landscape used by their data science team. You will work with enormous volumes of data that are employed for user-facing applications. The projects you will focus on among others will include their data pipeline projects. In this capacity you will regularly liaise with diverse teams across the business to ensure collaborative working and the implementation of best-in-class and fit-for-purpose strategies. Your involvement and input as a data engineer will be to create a pipepline that will allow the business to make critical efficiency and process improvements using real-world data across a number of acreas Working with other technology team members you will turn theoretical data into actionable plans and play a leading role within this process.
You should have strong experience in the following areas:
Be an accomplished programmer in python
Have several years experience of having worked in software development
You should have experience in having working with PostreSQL
Able to develop and familiar with distributed systems
Ability work independently and autonomouslty - can-do attitude is paramount to be succesful
Be familiar with such tools as GIT/Puppet or relevant alternatives.
Strong programming/technology background with experience that would be beneficial to you coming in to this role
Willingness to collaborate, engage with wider teams across the business
Any experience having used open-source tools could be useful, but is not a deal breaker.
The business has a flexible working culture and is very much geared to helping employees thrive in a fast moving and cutting-edge technological environment.

title: Data Analytics Cloud Engineer, Data Engineer - £70K Package
description:
Apply now
Data Analytics Cloud Engineer, Data Engineer
Circa £70K + Excellent Package
Location: Maidenhead with flexible working options
An excellent opportunity has arisen with a financial services company going through an exciting period of change. The position of Analytics Cloud Engineer is to be responsible for build and release engineering of data analytics projects in cloud. To support production systems in cloud and assist in building Machine learning analytics platform in Azure. The successful candidate will be a committed and articulate individual, required to communicate and collaborate effectively with Data Analytics team members and build effective relationships within relevant areas of Technology Services and Data Services team.

Role of the Data Analytics Cloud Engineer
·To be responsible for build and release engineering of data analytics systems and machine learning models in cloud
·Work with data scientists and analytics developers to design and build secure and scalable machine learning platform in Azure.
·To serve as single point of support contact for the application services and deployed models in Azure and being a point of contact for any subsequent queries / issues.
·To liaise with Technology services team/ third parties and resolve production/ cloud environment issues
·To work with Data Analytics team and be responsible for build and release of application changes to cloud
·To build release automation scripts (Devops) for the application/ Machine learning models
·To build docker scripts/containers and manage container releases
·Optimising performance of deployed machine learning models/systems
·Create model monitoring, logging, and alerting for deployed models
·Develop and encourage the adoption of best practices for MLOps, including the development of an MLOps governance framework.
·Conduct internal knowledge sharing sessions to help upskill the wider team on MLOps tooling, usage and best practices

Technical - Required
·5 - 8 Years Software Development Experience
·Strong experience and understanding of software engineering practises, project life cycle and experience working in cloud production environments
·Strong background and proven track record working in Azure
·Experience using and configuring Azure PaaS services like Web Apps, API, SQL PaaS database , Storage Accounts and other Azure services
·Experience working in Azure Batch and distribution of load across multiple instances to improve performance
·Experience working with shared codebase: source control, GIT, source control tools, building continuous integration, Dev Ops pipelines
·Extensive experience working with Docker scripts, containers and deep knowledge of best practices relating to the deployment and security of containerised applications
·Experience in operationalising machine learning projects and deploying ML applications in various forms, including batch and real time inference.
·Experience designing machine learning systems that meet external audit requirements and/ or regulatory requirements.
·Experience setting up machine learning automation pipelines with CI/CD tooling
·Knowledge of Python and Python-based machine learning packages
·Understanding of data science / machine learning concepts, challenges and project lifecycle

Technical - Desirable
·Familiarity with parallel or distributed computing frameworks such as Spark is a plus
·Familiarity with Kubernetes is a plus
·Familiarity with tools such as MLflow, Kubeflow and DVC is a plus

title: Technical Pricing and Data Analyst London Market
description:
Apply on employer's website
The role
This is a newly formed position within the group structure, allowing for a sole point of contact regarding pricing model developments.
This design will allow for a more innovative approach to pricing models once the successful applicant is up to speed. In time, the role responsibilities could include project management, portfolio analytics and using external data for automation.
Key accountabilities
The underwriters remain accountable for having adequate technical pricing models in use for their lines of business. The Technical Pricing and Data Analyst will be responsible as the lead developer of pricing models across Wholesale including making appropriate recommendations and improvements to existing ones.
Ensure models are designed to add value to the underwriting process and are appropriate to be used pre-bind.
Ensure models are developed in line with relevant standards, such as MS3.
Design and build management information and KPI reports using relevant pricing model data.
As required, design and maintain databases to work behind pricing models for effective data capture.
Evaluate opportunities to use 3rd party data and advanced analytical techniques to enhance the technical pricing model solution.
Review rating matrices and underwriting pricing guidelines on selected product lines as requested by underwriters and management.
Support the Portfolio Management Lead and Data, Analytics and Insights Lead with ad-hoc analysis as required.
Work with other Support Units to include but not limited to: actuarial, underwriting operations and ITS.
Stay informed, and considers the implications, of best practice pricing techniques across the London Market.
Represent the wider team, as appropriate, providing accurate and timely management information to senior leadership, and meetings as the need arises.
Skills & experience
The successful candidate will:
Have experience in developing technical pricing models in various lines of business
Have demonstrable experience in influencing and engaging with stakeholders using effective communication and ensuring buy-in
Be able to clearly articulate complex strategies, techniques and ideas to senior leadership and underwriters across multiple product lines
Possess both strong analytical depth and the ability to independently problem solve and then put forward recommendations
Have an understanding of the Wholesale products, classes of business and operations of the speciality insurance market
Have a proven ability to successfully manage and deliver to agreed timelines projects and initiatives that require involvement from business leaders across the company
Possess a thorough working knowledge of the Microsoft office suite, with a focus on Excel/VBA and be comfortable with manipulating and analysing large, complex sets of data. Have Experience with database use (SQL/Access).
Data visualisation programmes and/or an interest in advanced analytics/data science would be desirable but not essential.
To review the full job specification, or to discuss the role in more detail please apply or contact:

title: Software Engineer Apprentice
description:
Apply on employer's website
As a Software Engineer Apprentice, you’ll work on an agile team with other passionate, driven and talented people to create innovative solutions for Publicis' clients. Their environment and culture fosters growth and presents exciting opportunities to hone your skills in business and problem-solving. You'll be responsible for software from idea to code to test to operations, whilst working towards your Level 4 Software Engineering qualification.
A typical day
Assist in the collection and documentation of user requirements as well as the development of user stories and estimates
Design, develop and unit test applications in accordance with established standards
Collaborate with experienced designers, strategists, client partners and clients on the product
Participate in peer reviews of solution designs and related code
Package and support the deployment of releases
Analyse and resolve technical and application problems
Adhere to high-quality development principles while delivering solutions on-time and on-budget
Prepare reports, manuals and other documentation on the status, operation and maintenance of software
You must have
Five GCSE grades C - A* (4-9) or equivalent, including English and Maths
Level 3 qualification (A level, BTEC or equivalent)
Three months' prior coding experience
Skills needed
Strong desire to learn the following:
Languages like Java, C#, JavaScript and HTML/CSS
Platforms including public and private clouds, AWS, Azure and Google Cloud
Patterns and frameworks such as DevOps, microservices, APIs, ReactJS, AngularJS, 12-Factor and more
Data platforms (NoSQL, graph, relational, etc.)
You'll also:
Have strong written and verbal communication
Always be learning, and have a passion for creating and constantly improvin
Be open-minded, inclusive and appreciative of the views and perspectives of others
Perks and benefits
Amazing location
Health cover
Multiverse Community Hub
Multiverse community
Pension
Social events
Volunteering
Training provided:
1. Training on the 18 month Standard Level 4 Software Developer (SWE4) apprenticeship.

2. Being a Multiverse apprentice means access to awesome social events, sports teams, insight/career days with other apprentices to grow your network, as well as your own personal Coach who will guide you through the qualification to help you achieve your full potential.

3. As part of your Multiverse apprenticeship, you will have access to our Future Leaders Foundation modules to help you develop the 6 key competencies: well-being, self-awareness, motivation, conscientiousness, effectiveness and grit.
Future prospects
After your Software Engineering apprenticeship, you can progress into a junior developer role (this includes web and app development). You'll have the skills to continue growing within a tech team, and have enough knowledge/experience to pick up new languages with ease. Software Engineering Level 4 will also provide a good foundation for transitioning into data science.

title: Senior Software Development Engineer
description:
Apply Now
Job Overview
We are looking for a talented and ambitious software engineer with a real passion for new technologies. Working alongside our in-house development team, you’ll use some of the latest tech available like React.js, ASP.Net Core, C#. As we increasingly move towards containers and services, you’ll also have the opportunity to work with Docker and cloud technologies. The successful candidate will join a newly created team which is improving the recruiter experience when using our applications.
The role will involve:
C# coding, testing, deployment, unit testing (tdd, bdd)
Pair programming, reviewing peer’s code, following tdd practises
Champion implementation of best practices (architecture, design principles)
Improve the build and deployment pipelines
Automate processes
Continue migrating our legacy code into micro services (APi driven approach)
Work alongside our data science, architect and product teams
Monitor existing applications through Datadog APM
Maintain legacy stacks and patch it up when required
Make a difference in the way we work, deliver and communicate
Actively participate in our agile ceremonies (stand up, sprint review/planning)
Communicate and share information to tech and non-tech savvy people
Share knowledge within your team and with other teams as well
Spend 10% of your time (half a day per week) in learning and development
Requirements:
Advanced knowledge of C#, ASP.NET, .Netcore
Experience with implementing micro-service architecture
Experience with cloud technologies, ideally AWS
Familiar with React.js as this is the language used for our SPA(s)
Good knowledge of software architecture, design patterns and standards
Design and build highly performant, robust and secure web applications
Good communication skills
A team player
Experienced with CI/CD pipelines
Familiar with test driven development approach
Driven to learn and to self-improve
Bonus points:
Experience with Docker containerisation
Familiar with observability & telemetry, ideally with Datadog
Familiar with agile methodologies (scrum, kanban, xp)
Benefits:
25 days holidays plus 8 days bank holidays, with the option to buy, carry over or sell up to 5 days a year
10% time spent in learning & development activities

title: Agile Business Analyst - Public Sector
advertiser: Anson McCade Ltd - IT and Finance Recruitment
description:
Apply now
Agile Business Analyst - Public Sector
Quick Summary:
Join an innovative and respected division of a consultancy group which is at the forefront of addressing the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms for our clients
You will work on projects and programmes that are making a difference within the public sector whether that is in the national security space or regional/local government agencies.
We are a firm that believe in developing and nurturing, allowing you to have 10 paid training days a year and funding with training/certs
Who are we?
We are a global leader in consulting, digital transformation and technology services, combining strategy, data science, technology and creative design with deep industry knowledge and insight to create the business models and digital solutions of the future
In this role you would be supporting and engaging with our Government clients to help propose solutions and then deliver these through a range of programmes including pure business change, system and digital integration.
The role
You will be expected to examine the client's issues, propose a range of possible solutions and guide them in selecting one which you may then help design, build and implement. The projects you will be working on are within the public sector and therefore you ideally need a current SC or DV Clearance.
As an Agile Business Analyst you will be at the heart of our delivery teams allowing clients to successfully transform. Through identifying and analysing problems and issue that may affect effective adoption of the service, you will be ensuring plans and objectives are achieved.
You'll play a key role support the process of taking government digital services through a structured engagement process to deliver their connection to the identity assurance service.
As this role is within a consultancy we are expected to be flexible with working away from home if the client site is not within commuting distance. When on client site you will have accommodation, food and travel expensed.
You will be awarded a generous salary and package including: private medical, 6% pension if you put in 4%, income protection, 25 days holiday.
Your background
Prior experience will include:
Experience working for a consultancy or onsite with a government/public sector client
Analytical mind and ability to clearly communicate with all levels in an organisation
Working in an agile environment using agile practices
Experience developing and delivering solutions
Strong presentation and articulation skills
Strategic thinking
Application of relevant tools and techniques - i.e: customer journey mapping, detailed operating model design, process mapping
If you are keen on hearing more about exploring this position please apply today.
Reference: AMC/EWA/BA/32/CP/1
Type: Permanent
Consultant: Emily Watkins
Salary: £40,000 - £48,000

title: Oracle DBA
description:
Apply now
Oracle DBA
Candidates can be based anywhere south of Manchester and must be happy to travel to Bridgend, South Wales once or twice a month to catch up with the team.
To £55K plus extensive benefits package.
Due to the highly secure nature of this work, candidates must hold current UK Security Clearance to DV Level.
Position summary:
Our client is looking for an Oracle DBA to join their busy team who are based in Bridgend, however candidates can be based anywhere south of Manchester as long as they are prepared to travel to Bridgend once or twice a month. If you have a sixth sense for data science, there is a digital revolution underway that needs the talents of people like you who are at home analysing, managing, designing and predicting complex datasets and breathing life into AI systems.
Job role responsibilities:
This Oracle DBA role is an exciting and diverse role with two main parts; predominantly you will be working with a high-profile secure client as an Applications DBA, providing support and working closely with the client. The second part of the role is working within the Shared Services Team, supporting a high-profile client base within various sectors such as Central Government, utilities & telecoms etc as more of a Production DBA. The role focuses on deploying, operating, and maintaining both internal and client databases from small development systems through to mission critical production systems.
The position sits within a team of specialist DBA's who work collaboratively across all technology groups and play a key part in business success. They work with and support clients 24x7, 365 meaning there are elements of out of hours working. The team provide out of hours cover on a rota basis and it expected that the successful candidate would join the rota following an initial onboarding with the team.
Essential experience required:
This is a specialist grade position requiring a solid understanding of the core elements of database administration such as backup and recovery, patching, monitoring, systems tuning and capacity management with a working knowledge of more advanced features such as RAC, ASM and dataguard replication.
You will have demonstrable experience supporting development through to production databases with exposure to a number of Oracle database versions from 11g to the most recent 19c. Fusion Middleware and/or eBusiness technology experience is desirable.
About the company:
Our client is a global Tier 1 company involved in many leading mission critical projects. They are highly regarded within the industry and are one of the largest independent technology & business services firms in the world.
They consider employees as highly valued members of the business and offer extensive progression opportunities for those wishing to move further in their career on a local, national or global scale.
Oracle DBA
Oracle DBA
