title: UI Lead Designer / UX Lead Designer
description:
Apply now
UI / UX Lead Designer, UL Lead, UX Lead, App Development, Application Development
UI Lead Designer, UX Lead Designer required to work for a fast-growing mobile technology company based in Central London. However, due to Covid-19, this can be based pretty much anywhere in the UK.
The Senior UI / UX Lead Designer will work with the UI / UX and Engineering team and Data Scientists to deliver best-in-class user experiences. You will also lead to App Development Strategy bringing your proven experience across to this organisation with high ambition.
The ideal candidate will be highly diligent and possess strong creative, technical and
problem-solving skills. This Lead role involves psychology, storytelling and strong app
development experience.
Areas of focus include content, controls, visual design, development, information architecture,
user research, branding and user journey flow implementation.
Responsibilities:
Consulting with stakeholders to understand their goals and explaining research results
Conducting usability testing
Creating wireframes, storyboards, sitemaps and screen flows
Creating specifications and liaising/briefing development teams
Creating product prototypes
Developing personas and usage scenarios
Analyzing user feedback and activity, and iterating to enhance the user experience
Conducting competitor and customer analysis
Working closely with UI / UX and development team through inception, specification, delivery
and post deployment feedback leading to iteration where needed
Fast paced and diligent delivery of designs and deployment
Working with Data Science to deliver insight driven recommendations
The ideal candidate must have an expert understanding of Human Centered Design, iOS,
Android, web technologies and wireframing tools. An expert grasp of design programs and tools
especially Figma is necessary.
This is a very fast paced environment and the Lead Designer must have the ability to
quickly adapt to new technologies and a willingness to keep their skills and industry knowledge
The Lead Designer works as part of a close team with other UI and UX designers, and
iOS and Android developers.
Must have a very good understanding of Social Media Platforms and native applications as well.
This is a great opportunity and salary is dependent upon experience. Apply now for more details.

title: Junior Software Developer
description:
Apply on employer's website
Personify XP are looking for an enthusiastic Junior Developer to join their growing technical delivery team. Your primary focus will be on frontend coding for website integrations, using their JavaScript SDK to deliver personalisation to their customer's website.
A typical day
Client-side UI scripting using JavaScript
Configuring tag management tools such as Google Tag Manager
Testing integrations
Debugging code errors
Assisting with application development in React/Node.js
Working with Git versioning tools
You must have
Five GCSE grades C - A* (4-9) or equivalent, including English and Maths
Level 3 qualification (A level, BTEC or equivalent)
Three months' prior coding experience
Skills needed
You have excellent written and verbal communication skills
You’re a logical problem solver with a keen eye for detail
You’ve started your journey learning to code. An ideal candidate will have at least 3 months worth of coding experience
You’ll have completed at least one personal project; ranging from a calculator app to a web app.
You’re curious, with a hunger for not just fixing problems but exploring why and how things happen
Enthusiastic, self-motivated and keen to achieve.
Perks and benefits
Flexible working hours
Multiverse community
Pension
Social events
Training provided
1. Training on the 18 month Standard Level 4 Software Developer (SWE4) apprenticeship.

2. Being a Multiverse apprentice means access to awesome social events, sports teams, insight/career days with other apprentices to grow your network, as well as your own personal Coach who will guide you through the qualification to help you achieve your full potential.

3. As part of your Multiverse apprenticeship, you will have access to our Future Leaders Foundation modules to help you develop the 6 key competencies: well-being, self-awareness, motivation, conscientiousness, effectiveness and grit.
Future prospects
After your Software Engineering apprenticeship, you can progress into a junior developer role (this includes web and app development). You'll have the skills to continue growing within a tech team, and have enough knowledge/experience to pick up new languages with ease. Software Engineering Level 4 will also provide a good foundation for transitioning into data science.

title: Pricing Data Scientist
description:
Apply now
Pricing Data Scientist
-Widely respected UK Insurance firm

You will work on interesting Machine Learning projects alongside a team of established Data Scientists.
You will be supported by a dedicated team of data engineers.
The company is fully committed to the applications of machine learning across all business areas

Our client is one of the largest, longest standing, and well-respected UK Insurance companies. Within finance, they are one of the UK’s Juggernauts, but despite this, they have managed to retain a professional and welcoming working culture. Their Data Science team is constantly growing and they will be investing heavily over the next 12 months. Because of their continued interest in the area, they have recently partnered with one of the UK’s leading Red Brick Universities for research and collaboration.

What you will be doing
This role will involve developing and implementing machine learning platforms in order to improve the realisation of benefits in the Pricing Department. You will be working closely with a team of experienced Data Scientists and work across different teams within the department. This is a fantastic opportunity if you have a curious nature and want to continue your personal development in machine learning.

What you’ll need to apply
• Good command of Python or R.
• Solid experience using SQL (particularly relational databases)
• Experience with Microsoft Azure.
• Machine learning experience in Linear Models and Tree Based Methods. Able to deploy this in a business environment.
• Being a willing and able communicator.

What you will get in return for your experience
The salary on this one is up to £60k (depending on experience). On top of the salary, the package includes 30(+2 optional buys) days holiday, private medical care, a very generous discount on all insurance offerings and partnerships, and the opportunity for a sizable bonus predicated on personal performance. The working environment has many testimonials which highlight that it is a wonderful place to work, and is head and shoulders above many insurance/finance companies. Their staff retention rate is a good indicator of this.

What’s Next?
Please get in touch with Adam with an up-to-date CV today. Don’t hesitate to email/call to discuss the finer details.

title: Senior Digital Media Insight Analyst
description:
Apply Now
Senior Digital Media Insight Analyst
** Digital Advertising Agency **
SALARY - £50k - £60k plus benefits
LOCATION - London
CLIENT & ROLE
The role sits within a team of data specialists, which is the UK data and insights function for a global automotive manufacturer. This is broken down into data strategy, BI and reporting, web analytics and data science. The agency are looking to make a huge step change through employing bleeding edge technology to improve their personalised approach to customer marketing, and this is where this role comes in.
We are looking for someone with strong experience in either Adobe Analytics (the tool they use in house) or Google Analytics, who has a problem solving approach to analysis. You will need to be proactive in your work, constantly identifying ways to improve the client's digital media campaign and website performance.
You will leverage your skills in digital analytics to track the performance of advertising and owned content for this global automotive client, making recommendations on media spend and improvements around customer experience.
You will therefore need to understand media performance and conversion funnels across different websites and apps, plus demonstrate the ability to turn these analyses into actionable recommendations for the client.
The team offer support with training, development and a keen interest in working with the latest tools such as Adobe Analytics, Looker, Facebook data and Google, all working on one of the world’s largest advertising accounts.
SKILLS REQUIRED
Educated to degree level in a numerate or marketing related subject
Strong experience in web / digital analytics measuring digital campaign performance and customer activities across websites; either as a sole focus or as a part of a wider digital marketing role
Proactive in identifying and providing actionable insights, making recommendations for improvements and commercial return
Enthusiastic, 'can-do’ attitude with solutions focused approach to work - can think beyond the brief and work in partnership with stakeholders
Advanced user of EITHER Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics for analysis
Skilled in data visualisation and story telling using tools such as Looker, Tableau, Power BI or Qlik
Experienced in coding with SQL for data manipulation and analysis

title: IT Director
description:
Apply now
IT Director

The role is working for a well establish and secure organsation that has a track record in providing an amazing service to its customers. They are a multi- site operation and are looking for a key person to transform the companies technology function

As the IT Director you will lead a full IT function encompassing development, infrastructure, support, project management and service delivery, whilst also managing the relationships with business stakeholders. A major part of the roles responsibilities will be defining and delivering the strategic technology roadmap, where you'll enjoy the autonomy and financial backing to introduce cutting-edge solutions. You will create a transformative digital strategy to deliver the aims of the Group Strategy.

Essential Keys Skills:

- Hands on strong technical aptitude across the IT stack, with deep experience of Microsoft a formality
- Experience of designing leading the implementation of a technology road map in an organisation of comparable size and complexity, including transitioning out of legacy to a resilient fully supported model, including selection of new technologies
- You’ll be a problem solver with strong organisational skills to coordinate stakeholders, prioritise how resources are used, and manage complex projects
- Experience of ITIL implementation is a key advantage
- 5+ years' experience managing a diverse IT team across several geographic sites, building a customer-focused IT culture, helping teams adopt new ways of working. Use the transition from legacy software and systems to upskill and develop the IT team whilst delivering efficiency
- An understanding of the impact of data science on IT architecture, extending to data warehouse, BI and associated coding

In Return they are offering

- Competitive basic salary
- Bonus Scheme
- Private Medical Insurance
- 33 days holiday inclusive of bank holidays
- Company contribution Pension scheme
- Share Incentive Plan
- Various other benefits to include cycle to work scheme

This role is a remote based role but does require travel to multiple sites around the UK

When submitting your application to Colossus Associates, please ensure you have your correct phone number and email address so we can contact you asap regarding your application. For confidentiality purposes, please remove any reference contact phone number's and email address details from your CV.

title: Senior BI Analyst
description:
Apply now
Our Client
Our client is growing and going from strength to strength, even during the current challenging climate. They have a brand to be admired and are now looking to take it to the next level by hiring a business intelligence analyst to support the delivery of data driven information to the marketing and management teams.
The Role
This role requires someone who has strong Business/Data Analysis skills, leaderships skills as well as excellent stakeholder management capabilities. The senior BI Analyst will be required to drive innovation using BI to generate incremental business benefits.
The role will be focused on improving conversion and customer value by analysing media spend to find optimisation opportunities. This role will involve working closely with external marketing agencies as well as the head of digital, head of brand marketing, CRM manager and the country managers.
Key Responsibilities and Skills will include:
Partner with a variety of business teams and external agencies to gather, document and maintain business requirements that will inform data modelling decisions
Report and present to management team findings of analytical studies in an informative and constructive manner to assist decision making related to marketing investment, product and CRM optimisation
Experience working across multiple territories with the ability to assimilate relevant cultural and regulatory differences
Compile data from various sources into a single, consumable, data set, including design and implementation of data models
With a core focus on creating financial modelling, working across multiple market and products. Advising on budget planning on a micro and macro level to delivering accurate revenue forecasts.
Analysing retention programs to optimize and drive performance and player value
Use quantitative analysis to analyse data and help drive business decisions while identifying cost saving opportunities
Utilize a hypothesis-driven problem-solving approach to design, construct, and rapidly test/iterate exploratory data-mining analyses to reveal insight
Interpret data into actionable insights which improve marketing strategy and clearly communicate recommendations to senior management
The ability to work with large, complex data sets across multiple platforms and design efficient processes to provide accurate and timely information is crucial
Experience in media mix modelling, understanding the impact of above the line/branding activity on acquisition and retention activity through digital channels
The Ideal Senior Business Intelligence Analyst should have:
Extensive experience in data science or related field
Proven experience working in marketing led high transaction volume organization with significant 7 figures annual marketing budgets spanning across multiple channels and products.
Experience working with MMM attribution modeling.
Experience with prediction models and quantitative analysis
Experience in financial planning and forecasting
Programming experience is beneficial as is previous exxperience working in a regulated market
Understanding of digital tracking, measurement, and reporting tools
Strong understanding of current online marketing concepts, strategy and best practice would be beneficial
The Benefits
A competitive salary, bonus, private healthcare, pension scheme and a truly dynamic working environment in which to grow and develop even further within this successful brand.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Apply now
Data Scientist
Data Scientist required for a fast growing and forward-thinking Consultancy as they continue to win new and interesting data projects.
Your new role …
You'll be joining a really talented team of Data Scientists, Engineers, Architects and a wider team of Product Mangers, Software Engineers and Consultants.
No need to be worried about this being another data science role with no interesting projects, or even worse no data! The team have plenty of work to be getting on with and as they are a Consultancy and trusted partner across a variety of industries, you will have the chance to be involved in an array of work. This includes the financial services sector looking at machine learning for crime detection and anti-money laundering to large scale NHS projects using your data skills for good.
You …
You'll be well versed as a Data Scientist, ideally having worked in a customer or business facing role. A huge part of this role will be talking to a selection of stakeholders from super technical to complete non-techies. You need to be able to explain your solutions to both seamlessly.
I won't patronise you here by saying you'll need experience of Python, SQL or R - you're a data scientist after all …
An appreciation of various cloud providers would be pretty beneficial though as they work in various environments depending on the customer with a recent push in GCP projects, but as you'd expect plenty of Azure and AWS work as well. A certification in one or more of these would be a bit of a cherry on top.
The company …
A boutique data consultancy within a larger organisation, delivering some impressive and complex projects in various sectors.
You will have the opportunity to progress your career with well defined bandings and regular feedback.
The Senior Management are still very hands on and not in a micro-management, can't let go sort of way, they are still very passionate about the success of the business.
The Small Print … (AKA salary & benefits)
You will be working remotely initially - obviously, but in the future, there is an expectation to be on client site up to 4 times a week, which can be UK wide. This is a Consulting gig, so you'll need to be comfortable with that.
In reality, they will try spread the work as locally as possible and there is a good chance a lot of customers will be happy with remote work going forward.
But you need to be prepared to travel as part of the role.
Salary wise, there is a wide range on offer as they have multiple roles, but to help you drum down a bit, somewhere between £45-80k + benefits.
Please do hit apply and contact Tom Edmondson at Cathcart Associates for a more detailed chat on the role, the company and what you are looking for.

title: Head of Data
description:
Apply now
HEAD OF DATA
£90,000-£150,000 + BENEFITS
OXFORDSHIRE

Are you looking to lead and direct the data function of a tech company who are re-inventing and modernising a traditional market? As the Head of Data, you will be building and leading your team of analysts to turn complex data into actionable business recommendations in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment. Alongside this, you will be responsible for mapping this companies' growth goals driven by a strong data vision, supporting through to execution.
THE COMPANY
As the Head of Data, you will be working closely with both C-suite and leadership teams to drive business and achieve goals. This company's structure means that your team is closely aligned with key stakeholders across marketing, product and commercial functions in order for you to identify excellent opportunities for improvement.
THE ROLE
As the Head of Data, you can expect to provide clear leadership, direction, coaching, mentoring and support to your team. Your leadership will help to grow projects such across multiple channels, both online and offline whilst establishing KPI's.
More specifically, as the Head of Analytics, you will be involved in the following:
Leading the team, working on projects with growth and commercial objectives
Working to develop a team that drives the company based on data-driven insights using your knowledge in forecasting, data science, ML and predictive modelling
Initially building reports and dashboards as one of the first key projects
Hiring, leading and developing a team of highly talented individuals
Workings hands-on, but with a focus on managing and developing the function
Executing and developing data strategy
YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
The successful Head of Data will have the following skills and experience:
Extensive experience in Data Analytics
Analytical team leadership experience, inclusive of recruitment, retention, performance management
Excellent ability to clearly communicate complex ideas
Willingness to initially work hands-on, leaning more towards a strategic role as the team develops
Excellent commercial knowledge with proven experience in increasing commercial uplift from data-driven insights
Excellent business judgement and strategic thinking, with the technical toolkit to enable delivery and strong experience in collaborating and co-ordinating across multiple business departments
Very strong SQL experience, inclusive of relational databases to understand and aid team members when required (knowledge around Python/R is also beneficial)
Knowledge of ML, predictive modelling and forecasting and it's uses is essential
Educated to degree level in mathematics, statistics or another quantitative field
BENEFITS
The successful Head of Data will receive a salary between £90,000 and £150,000. In addition to this, you will receive 25 days holiday + 8 days bank holiday (increasing after 5 years service), Life Insurance, Group Income Protection, Private medical, Statutory pension, Paid voluntary day, Access to the EAP - essentially free telephone counselling and a bike to work scheme.
HOW TO APPLY
Please register your interest by sending your CV to Dylan Butcher via the Apply link on this page.

title: Lead Developer
description:
Apply now
MFK Recruitment are proud to be partnered with a company in London who are a Software Development company, they specialise in Artificial General Intelligence (AGI), they are currently seeking a Lead Developer to join their team.
On behalf of our client, we are seeking a Lead Developer with a passion for both technology and the development of practical usable applications. Past development team (agile) leadership experience is required.
For the Lead Developer role, my client is interested in speaking to candidates who have key interests in Data Science, Computer Vision and Neural Networks. You do not necessarily need commercial experience in this area, however a passion to learn is important.
The novel enhanced CNN system will be a core component of a range of future products bridging the performance gap between existing CNN-based solutions and the future Spiking Neural Network (SNN) solutions being developed by their Research team. Enhanced CNNs will solve current customer problems in computer vision and object recognition and will, over time, incorporate further enhancements derived from our SNN and other neuroscience inspired research.
The Lead Developer will work on the development of a novel enhanced convolutional neural network (CNN), based on proprietary approach already developed by the company with the potential for wide application, but initially on a project for a defence industry partner.
Lead Developer Essentials:
A strong understanding or passion in the application of Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) to machine vision and image analysis.
Keen to learn or experience with using CNNs on large-scale datasets such as ImageNet.
Excellent Python development skills.
You must have worked with either Tensorflow or PyTorch.
Ability to develop using a rapid prototyping approach aimed at demonstrating capability and improved performance vs. competing CNN solutions.
Proven ability architecting and delivering high quality, practical and reliable software.
Experience translating advanced mathematics into efficient code.
Enthusiastic about working in a fast-paced engineering team.
No objection to working with defence sector customers.
Lead Developer Desirable:
Longer experience or background as a Full Stack Lead Developer.
Development team leadership experience, SCRUM or other agile/rapid development methodology experience.
Doctorate in computer vision / machine learning.
Strong academic background including postgraduate level qualifications in a scientific or technical discipline with some formal computer vision / machine learning content.
Experience working with academic and/or industrial researchers.

•    Machine learning experience in Linear Models and Tree Based Methods. Able to deploy this in a business environment.
•    Being a willing and able communicator.

What you will get in return for your experience
The salary on this one is up to £60k (depending on experience). On top of the salary, the package includes 30(+2 optional buys) days holiday, private medical care, a very generous discount on all insurance offerings and partnerships, and the opportunity for a sizable bonus predicated on personal performance. The working environment has many testimonials which highlight that it is a wonderful place to work, and is head and shoulders above many insurance/finance companies. Their staff retention rate is a good indicator of this.

What’s Next?
Please get in touch with Adam with an up-to-date CV today. Don’t hesitate to email/call to discuss the finer details.

title: JavaScript Developer
description:
Apply now
We are partnered with one of the UK's fastest growing education technology startups, and they are hiring for Full-Stack Java Script Developers.
They are an online learning platform that is making education fairer. Their mission is to provide all children whatever their background and wherever they are in the world with an affordable, high-quality education. To achieve their goal, they are combining exceptional teacher-made content with machine learning to keep students on their optimal learning paths. They are growing rapidly with hundreds of schools in the UK and abroad using the platform and thousands of independent subscribers.
The role: You will join the tech team at our offices in Soho, London. You will join a team that is growing rapidly over the next 12 months. You will shape and influence our technologies and have significant input into technological and commercial decision making. You will report directly to the CTO and you will work closely with the product team, providing a technical perspective to the development of new and existing features. The tech team moves fast, using Agile methodology to continuously add new features and deploy them down the CD pipeline.
Their Stack: The web app is entirely Javascript based, with a Node RESTful API communicating with a React frontend. The core storage technology is MySQL for live data, although Elasticsearch is used for R&D. Everything is hosted on VPSs in the cloud. Their machine learning algorithms are written in Python.
Required Skills:
* NodeJS (Express)
* React, JSX, CSS
* RESTful API design and interaction
* MySQL
* Working with relational data structures
* Git (Bitbucket), JIRA
Preferred Skills:
* Elasticsearch * Building and maintaining Jenkins pipelines
* Infrastructure architecture & networking
* DBA experience
* Interest in python for data science and machine learning
* TensorFlow or PyTorch
What they offer:
* Full set of equipment (MacBook etc)
* High degree of autonomy and opportunity to become an integral member of a fast growing start up;
* Huge learning opportunities from experienced developers as well as exposure to all business areas of a start up;
* Opportunity to learn new technologies, including machine learning;
* 28 days holiday + bank holidays.

title: Oracle DBA
description:
Apply Now
Oracle DBA

Fully remote

£45,000 - £55,000 plus extensive benefits

Are you an experienced Oracle DBA with current DV security clearance?
Are you looking for a fully remote role?
Candidates can be based anywhere south of Manchester and must be happy to travel to Bridgend, South Wales once or twice a month to catch up with the team.
Due to the highly secure nature of this work, candidates must hold current UK Security Clearance to DV Level.
Oracle DBA Role Summary:
Our client is looking for an Oracle DBA to join their busy team who are based in Bridgend, however candidates can be based anywhere south of Manchester as long as they are prepared to travel to Bridgend once or twice a month. If you have a sixth sense for data science, there is a digital revolution underway that needs the talents of people like you who are at home analysing, managing, designing and predicting complex datasets and breathing life into AI systems.
The Oracle DBA Responsibilities:
This Oracle DBA role is an exciting and diverse role with two main parts; predominantly you will be working with a high-profile secure client as an Applications DBA, providing support and working closely with the client. The second part of the role is working within the Shared Services Team, supporting a high-profile client base within various sectors such as Central Government, utilities & telecoms etc as more of a Production DBA. The role focuses on deploying, operating, and maintaining both internal and client databases from small development systems through to mission critical production systems.
The position sits within a team of specialist DBA's who work collaboratively across all technology groups and play a key part in business success. They work with and support clients 24x7, 365 meaning there are elements of out of hours working. The team provide out of hours cover on a rota basis and it expected that the successful candidate would join the rota following an initial onboarding with the team.
Oracle DBA – Knowledge Required:
This is a specialist grade position requiring a solid understanding of the core elements of database administration such as backup and recovery, patching, monitoring, systems tuning and capacity management with a working knowledge of more advanced features such as RAC, ASM and dataguard replication.
You will have demonstrable experience supporting development through to production databases with exposure to a number of Oracle database versions from 11g to the most recent 19c. Fusion Middleware and/or eBusiness technology experience is desirable.
About The Company:
Our client is a global Tier 1 company involved in many leading mission critical projects. They are highly regarded within the industry and are one of the largest independent technology & business services firms in the world.
They consider employees as highly valued members of the business and offer extensive progression opportunities for those wishing to move further in their career on a local, national or global scale.

title: Head of Analytics
description:
Apply now
The Company
My client is a privately held business who have experienced double-digit growth for over 10 years, including in 2020. They are a leading provider of information, applications, and systems development services to the energy industry. With customers in all the major commercial centres of Europe, providing services to trading desks, energy regulators, energy assets and overall stakeholders in the energy market. Their aim is to build long-term relationships with all their clients, with personal relationships achieved through working in partnership.

Insight is delivered through a range of online trading tools and consultancy by using and processing the data and knowledge gathered. Headquartered near Stockton in the north east of England, there are also have offices in London and the Netherlands.

The Role
As Head of Analytics you will be responsible for leading the work of a small and growing data science team who work on building models to forecast energy production and usage to provide price direction insight. The team work on a range of short, medium and long term models that are used in applications that support decisions made by energy producers, traders and brokers spread across Europe. The longer term models are used for project valuation and to inform future investment decisions. This work needs to be done to a demonstrable high level of forecast accuracy and as head of the team you take on a quality control role, implementing processes and procedures for everyone to follow in addition to leading on forecast methodology development and developing the team to maintain and innovate the models and forecasts.

The medium term strategy is to improve and expand the existing suite of forecasts for each region - ideally using scalable forecasts with high degree of automation in validation and correction The Head of Analytics will need to drive this programme aiming to reach a point where they are using a set of automated checks to constantly review and improve the accuracy of increasingly valuable and reliable forecasts.

In addition to leading the team you will have a personal projects to work on. Building models and forecasts from scalable algorithms that are accurate and able to be rolled out quickly into production.
The Person

Degree level qualification in a numerate discipline (Maths Engineering, Physics etc)
Previous commercial experience working on forecasting time series data. Building models that are delivering information out into a production environment
Able to work as a coach, leading and developing a team to produce highly accurate and scalable models that produce valuable insight for the customer.
Knowledge of Machine Learning and 1st Principal Learning as well as mathematical modelling and econometrics.
Ideally experience working with forecasting in the energy sector
Knowledge and use of coding languages used in modelling e.g. python.

With a package of up to £80,000 and an excellent benefits package this role will be part of the senior management team with potential to take on options.

Location is flexible but some attendance at one of the main office locations or our growing satellite locations will be required.

title: Graduate Analytics Positions
description:
Apply now
Specialists in sports betting analysis. Their clients rely on them to maximize their returns, requiring a clever, fast and well organised approach.
There are endless opportunities here that best suit talented individuals who want management to get out of their way while they make stuff happen - creatively and reliably. Such people are really valuable and can be kept busy, interested and rewarded.
These are permanent graduate level positions, based near Kings Cross, Central London
The Role:
Over the past 15 years the technology at the heart of our business has produced consistent and significant returns for our clients. We are a small but rapidly growing team of mathematicians, data scientists and software engineers constantly striving to refine our world class betting models while also researching and deploying new ones.
Our work bridges three domains, each challenging in its own right - betting and gambling, quantitative research and software development. The nature of our work and the relative immaturity of modern betting markets means opportunities to exploit are not in short supply.  But people with sufficient skill and versatility to attack these projects are hard to find!  So we are always looking for graduates or working practitioners in any technical discipline with an aptitude for analysing betting markets or for writing software to bet into those markets.  Our very best people combine those skills with the capacity to see projects through from start to finish, and much else besides.
As the company continues to expand, we are looking for energetic people with strong analytical skills to join our London office.

Due to rapid growth, we're on a big recruitment drive and have various positions including
Quantitative Analysis
Operations
Logistics
Research
Data Science
Programming

It should be noted that these roles tend to be quite fluid and depending on projects on - so you will need to be fairly versatile. That being said we will always endeavour to work with your skills and help you develop your strengths.


The ideal candidates' skills and experience:
STEM degree educated
Fast mental arithmetic and numeracy skills- must have Maths Alevel
Coding skills a strong bonus - Python / R / C++
Strong attention to detail
A focused and diligent work ethic under pressure
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and the ability to present data in a compelling manner.
Flexibility to work outside of the office, evenings, weekends, and holidays as required. We offer a lot of flexibility in the role regarding preferred working schedule
Strong communication and collaboration skills
Attention to detail and able to retain information
Positive ‘can do’ attitude, and ability to meet deadlines
Willingness to learn and adapt to new environments
Experience/ interest in betting is strong bonus
What are the perks of working here:
Strong starting salary - plus discretionary performance bonus

approx £20-24k for more entry level candidates, 30k+ for candidates with strong programming skills
As you develop, the sky is the limit salary wise
25 days holiday per annum + bank holiday
Private health insurance & pension plan
Flexible working
Complimentary gym membership after probation period

title: Senior Product Manager
description:

Here at reed.co.uk, we believe the world should Love Mondays.
Finding great candidates for a job can be challenging, and we’re looking for great people to help deliver customer-centric, market-leading and innovative product experiences. As the UK's most recognisable recruitment brand, our Product Management team is working at scale to enhance recruitment for thousands of customers.

As Senior Product Manager you'll have responsibility for leading a cross-functional team focused on expanding the B2B offering to better meet customer needs. You’ll be playing a key role in a B2B transformation, delivering an outstanding and comprehensive customer experience.

Working closely with the Head of Product - B2B Transformation you will co-create, own and lead an ambitious vision for Reed Online’s B2B offering, focusing on Performance proposition and capabilities
Define and set ambitious goals for the product team inspiring and motivating to deliver significant impact for customers

Credibly and confidently manage stakeholders and cross-functional teams to aid efficient delivery & communication
Work collaboratively with UX, data science & engineering to deliver exciting new features
Be involved in product discovery and delivery workstreams taking us closer to that vision
Your skills
You have a minimum of 5 years experience in online product management, partnering with engineers and designers, and leading product prioritisation and delivery of customer-facing functionality
You have shipped 2 or more complex and high impact products in a world-class product-led company, working with cross-functional teams
You are technically minded and have proven experience delivering search powered products
You have high attention to detail and won't compromise on precise and effective user-centric design to solve customer problems
You are comfortable challenging (or being challenged) on a numerical basis to ensure all decisions are grounded in data
You have a proven track record for leading through influence, guiding multiple teams with your product vision, and generating excitement for your work
An excellent track record of successful digital product management across B2B products, driving customer satisfaction and large scale growth within an Agile environment
Join REED - Improving Lives Through Work
Proud winners of:
#1 Recruitment Agency - Glassdoor Best Places To Work 2019 & 2020
Glassdoor Top CEOs 2019
The JobCrowd Top Companies For Graduates To Work For 2018/19
Our Values, Your Values; Our Future, Your Future
All job offers are subject to satisfactory references and compliance with vetting requirements applicable to the job role. REED is an equal opportunities employer. Software Developer required for a leading and rapidly growing technology organisation in Cheltenham. You will have a background as a Software Developer / UI Developer, within an Agile environment - and would ideally be familiar with large volume data and using cutting edge tech stack.
Looking for someone who's passionate in UI development to advance the company's business reporting tools. Ideally a mid-level to Senior - level developer who is experienced with bootstrap and JavaScript frameworks.

Top priorities for this organisation: Career Progression, Staff Engagement and A Passion for Cutting Edge Technology.

This is a great opportunity for an ambitious Software Developer to join an established and expanding global organisation. You will be supporting & enhancing both existing Software products, as well as developing new ones, in conjunction with software/web updates and product releases as well as advancing the company's business reporting tools.

This role would suit a motivated individual looking for a company in which they can develop whilst using the newest technologies. You'll be developing websites, business reporting tools, mobile platforms, document management solutions and software products for both UK and Global customers.

Full and ongoing certification and training support will be included as well as being allowed plenty of autonomy for on the job learning. You will also benefit from work alongside industry-leading technology professionals and working with the latest technologies, with access to technology events and conferences.

- Excellent communication skills

- Team Player

BENEFITS:
- 25 days holiday

- Highly skilled, personable agile team

title: Oracle DBA
description:
Apply now
Oracle DBA
Candidates can be based anywhere south of Manchester and must be happy to travel to Bridgend, South Wales once or twice a month to catch up with the team.
To £55K plus extensive benefits package.
Due to the highly secure nature of this work, candidates must hold current UK Security Clearance to DV Level.
Position summary:
Our client is looking for an Oracle DBA to join their busy team who are based in Bridgend, however candidates can be based anywhere south of Manchester as long as they are prepared to travel to Bridgend once or twice a month. If you have a sixth sense for data science, there is a digital revolution underway that needs the talents of people like you who are at home analysing, managing, designing and predicting complex datasets and breathing life into AI systems.
Job role responsibilities:
This Oracle DBA role is an exciting and diverse role with two main parts; predominantly you will be working with a high-profile secure client as an Applications DBA, providing support and working closely with the client. The second part of the role is working within the Shared Services Team, supporting a high-profile client base within various sectors such as Central Government, utilities & telecoms etc as more of a Production DBA. The role focuses on deploying, operating, and maintaining both internal and client databases from small development systems through to mission critical production systems.
The position sits within a team of specialist DBA's who work collaboratively across all technology groups and play a key part in business success. They work with and support clients 24x7, 365 meaning there are elements of out of hours working. The team provide out of hours cover on a rota basis and it expected that the successful candidate would join the rota following an initial onboarding with the team.
Essential experience required:
This is a specialist grade position requiring a solid understanding of the core elements of database administration such as backup and recovery, patching, monitoring, systems tuning and capacity management with a working knowledge of more advanced features such as RAC, ASM and dataguard replication.
You will have demonstrable experience supporting development through to production databases with exposure to a number of Oracle database versions from 11g to the most recent 19c. Fusion Middleware and/or eBusiness technology experience is desirable.
About the company:
Our client is a global Tier 1 company involved in many leading mission critical projects. They are highly regarded within the industry and are one of the largest independent technology & business services firms in the world.
They consider employees as highly valued members of the business and offer extensive progression opportunities for those wishing to move further in their career on a local, national or global scale.
Oracle DBA
Oracle DBA

title: CRM Consultant - Mobile Marketing
description:
Apply now
An exciting role has arisen within an expanding mobile marketing agency for a CRM Consultant.
This is a fantastic opportunity for an exceptional talent to accelerate their career working with global household names and start-ups across sectors including Publishing, Travel, Gambling and Social Networking delivering a range of services including, ASO, UA and post-acquisition messaging strategies.
The role would suit someone coming from a technical background in a file such as software engineering, design or data science and now looking to move into a mobile marketing environment.

The Role
With a focus on mobile marketing, the CRM team helps clients increase the retention and conversion of their app’s users through omni-channel campaigns (main channels used: app & browser push notifications, emails, inbox and in-app messages). As the messaging capabilities are essential to CRM success, the team helps supports clients in selecting, integrating and using the right CRM system for them (including liaising with the client Product & Development teams).
As this work heavily relies on CRM systems and their successful integration early on, the company aims to expand the technical support it offers its clients through the CRM team, and this position will be expected to provide technical & data analytics strength in addition to the normal CRM activities.
Core duties
Setting up or reviewing campaign mechanics across a range of CRM platforms
Implementing and testing push notifications, in-app messaging, inbox messages, browser push and email (amongst others!)
Conducting industry benchmarks and competitor analysis
Pulling data extracts from CRM platforms, analysing, correlating and refreshing reports
Advising clients on the technical specification required to support CRM campaigns & journeys
Assisting with testing of CRM implementations & messaging within client apps
Liaising with client and CRM provider’s technical teams
Writing creative briefs, liaising with creative teams (coordinators, designers, copywriters, translators)
Writing or reviewing copy

Ideal candidate
Degree with level 2.1 or above
Minimum 2 years’ experience within a digital marketing position
Knowledge of push notifications and / or email campaigns
Strong interest in data analytics, and experience reviewing data, inferring results and drawing accurate & statistically sound conclusions
Very strong communication skills
Perfect spoken and written English
Ability to focus on a task and get it done quickly with a high attention to detail
Ability to prioritise and organise your work to meet tight deadlines
Great work ethic and a desire to learn and progress
Due to the varied nature of the CRM clients, any of these would be a massive plus:
Knowledge of HTML for emails
Experience working with mobile apps
Statistical modelling experience
Experience with project management
The ability to write to an excellent level in a second language

If your application is successful, you will be contacted within two working days. We regret that due to the high volume of applications we receive we cannot provide feedback on individual CVs.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Apply now
Join a world-class engineering team, international client base (ML, AI tech).
AWS, IaC, Terraform, Kubernetes, Docker.
Training, career development, fantastic team working culture.

A cutting-edge analytics business using a combination of behavioural science and machine learning based in Bristol is looking for a DevOps Engineer to join their expanding team which stretches across to the US. Currently around 20 in Bristol including 8 developers they are looking for a talented DevOps Engineer for the Bristol office. Their AWS infrastructure is very much in place - this is a chance to grow it in Bristol, help drive their cloud platform as the company continues its success and growth.  Happy to accommodate 3 days remote working after Covid.

What experience you'll need

Previous experience in AWS based DevOps/Infrastructure.
Terraform.
Understanding or experience of Kubernetes.
Knowledge of Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery processes and improvements.
Configuration management, IaC principles.
You will be very self-motivated with attention to detail.
You must be able to communicate well with the extended engineering teams abroad.
Any experience with Python would be a bonus.
Passion for the latest trends in technologies and an interest in learning.
Ideally you will be able to help grow a team in the future.
Being proactive with networking events/meetups would be very helpful.
What you'll be doing

They’re looking for a DevOps Engineer to help drive their current cloud platform infrastructure design, build, scale-out and operationalisation. They are currently using AWS but are evolving towards a cloud provider agnostic solution. They have a service orientated architecture that covers many functional areas such as workflow, messaging and complex data science workloads. They use infrastructure s code throughout and security engineering is paramount, you must understand the core fundamentals. As they are continuously evolving how they design and build platform apps there will be opportunities to develop new skills and introduce new technologies to the team. On a weekly basis you will be working closes with the development team and the extended team abroad. The company have agile processes; the team operates like a start-up rather than a corporate engineering organisation.

What you'll get in return for your talents

You’ll be based in nice central Bristol offices (remote for now and part-remote in the future), with one of the most talented and skilled teams in the area. The business is at the real forefront of what they do and so you’ll never have a boring day. You’ll get to interact with clients working for huge multinational corporations. This is a business that’s always looking to be cutting edge in what they do so on top of the work-related R&D time you’ll have, you’ll also be allotted time for personal projects. In addition there's private medical cover, 6% pension, stock options, generous holidays and more.

What's next?

If you like the sound of this one and want to know more or apply then get in touch with Mike.

title: Population Health Consultant Lead
description:
Apply now
Job Title: Population Health Consultant Lead
Location: Homebased
Salary: £60,000 to £70,000 DOE
Job Type: Permanent
Job Reference: LH10016
Our client is a software house committed to providing clinical software solutions to the healthcare sector and they are seeking a permanent Population Health Consultant as part of the Population Health Analytics team. The role supports and guides customers implementing Population Analytics solutions into stakeholder organisations.
Experience
Experience of working within NHS IT / Analytics consultancy
At least 3 years’ experience of engaging with all level stakeholders across the health and care community such as medical directors, GP's, nurses, practice managers, health and care directors, public health, NHS and care managers as well as IT professionals and analysts
Good knowledge of the Health and Care domain including policy, data flows and reporting requirements
Experience of managing and delivering IT software product implementations within the NHS
Some knowledge of Primary care systems such as EMIS/TPP/Vision/Microtest
Some knowledge of Secondary care EPR systems
Good knowledge of NHS data sets and informatics currencies covering GP data sets, Acute data sets including SUS data, Community, Mental Health and Social Care
Knowledge of Information Governance rules and requirements within Health and Care
Experience of supporting and influencing organisations and stakeholders in the use and implementation of population analytics and or risk stratification within a health and care organisation
Experience of training and coaching end users in the use of software
Experience with supporting users integrate software use into business processes and projects
Experience with supporting users in using software to evaluate health and care programmes
Experience of working alongside a technical development team with the ability to interpret end user needs into a deliverable specification that development teams can deliver on
Experience (Desirable)

Previous experience of working within a health and care organisation
Experience of using Microsoft Power BI
Some experience of using SQL server or a good understanding of database technology
Some general knowledge in the use and application of statistics and data science
Experience of testing software
Some knowledge of agile development methodologies
Qualifications

A Bachelor’s Degree in related subject (desirable)
Key responsibilities:

Supporting the delivery and implementation of the Population Health product into health and care organisations
Engage with key stakeholders such as Medical professionals, NHS commissioners, Informatics leads, service managers and transformation leads across health and Care organisations
Train and coach end users in the use of the tool
Work with the population health development team and analysts to tailor the product and reporting to an organisation’s needs
Support, advise and influence stakeholder organisations with the use of population health analytics. Includes the integration of analytics for business as usual use, operational use, service redesign, business planning and change
Support customers in the realisation of benefits from use of population health analytics
Define population health analytics projects content and deliverables where required
Work with customers to create meaningful case studies which showcase examples of good practice in health and care organisations where Care Centric Population health has been implemented
Perform population health analytics software demonstrations to potential customers as required
Wilde Associates is working in the capacity of an Employment Business for this role

title: Commercial Finance Manager / FP&A Analyst SaaS London
description:
Apply now
Senior Commercial Finance Manager / Senior FP&A Analyst| SaaS Scale-Up | London

Harmonic are delighted to be working exclusively with an innovative SaaS scale-up in their search for a Senior Commercial Finance Manager/ Senior FP&A Analyst. The client have developed a hugely innovative (and user-friendly) SaaS product which is both B2B and B2C and has been making waves during Covid lockdown with high profile advertising campaigns promoting their services. Offering excellent career progression opportunities and direct management and mentoring from an elite Tech CFO, this is a fantastic time to join a business which is currently experiencing a significant period of growth.

With a predicted turnover of £30 million for the upcoming financial year and a healthy balance sheet (EBITDA stands at c. £6 million!), this role is pivotal in understanding and ultimately improving profitability. You will have full responsibility for the FP&A function and the opportunity to finance business partner directly with C-suite stakeholders, while your typical week will involve collaborating cross-departmentally (Marketing, Tech, Sales) to ensure finance provide data-driven insights to improve decision making and profitability. This role would suit an ambitious and individual with excellent influencing skills and strong financial modelling capability. You will thrive on being trusted to work autonomously in a fast-paced environment, but will also who places a strong importance on participating within a values-driven culture.

Reporting into an experienced and a highly-successful CFO with numerous exits under their belt, you can choose between a majority work-from-home arrangement or to be based from their excellent offices in Old Street. The business is filled with incredibly talented, ambitious people and has maintained a strong 'start-up' feel, in spite of being well-financed, where collaboration is encouraged. You will also benefit from the added cache of occupying a high-visibility role within a business which is a European leader in their specialism.

Responsibilities:
Full responsibility for the FP&A function
Creation and monitoring of an improved suite of KPIs and metrics
Production and review of the budgets and forecasts
Creation of insightful financial models for the Executive
Analysing and striving to improve profitability
Acting as a Finance Business Partner to various internal teams in order improve operational efficiency across the function

Requirements:
ACA, ACCA or CIMA qualified
Strong financial modelling skills
Substantial experience working within SAAS, subscription marketing/subscription services, online marketplaces or enterprise software
Exceptional finance business partnering skills
Advanced Excel
Commercially astute

Nice to have:
Fast-growth start-up or scale-up experience
Experience of business partnering directly with marketing teams or Business Intelligence/Data Science

Salary: £65,000- 80,000 + benefits (great holiday allowance and superb contributory pension)
Start date: ASAP
Location: Central London (with some remote working long term)

If this role is of interest, please apply online. Due to the high volume of applications we are receiving, if you have not heard back from us, please assume your application was unfortunately unsuccessful on this occasion.
Please feel free to share this with any friends or colleagues who may be interested.
Follow us on twitter: @HarmonicGroupHQ

title: Senior Data Strategist - CRM & Digital
description:
Apply Now
Senior Data Strategist – CRM & Digital
Small team, means visible and influential role – be recognised!
Independent agency network – lose the politics, gain the ownership!
Inspiring leader, join at time of growth and positive change!

SALARY -            £60k - £65k & benefits
LOCATION -        Remote to begin with, then Central London
THE OPPORTUNITY
Joining this successful independent agency group, led by a number if impressive senior leaders from big agency networks such as WPP, Omnicom and Publicis, you’ll find less politics, a slicker and more decisive culture as well as reams of opportunity to carve your own career path as this data function embarks on an ambitious journey of growth.
You will work in partnership with the Head of Data Strategy, to devise and deliver insight and data led solutions for end clients, around personalisation, CRM targeting, measurement and optimisation across multichannel marketing (including digital media).
Building out data roadmaps to optimise marketing effectiveness, test and learn frames works and conducting customer and marketing analysis to figure out how to improve personalisation and campaign ROI will all be part of your day to day, as well as building out reporting processes and developing campaign targeting plans. You will be an expert in measuring marketing activity and understanding that part data has to play in constantly improving return for clients.
You will be part of a small yet growing team, where the CDO has ambitious plans to step change the delivery of the entire data function, to bring it in line with modern data science approaches. So you have a rare opportunity to join at a time where these changes are beginning to happen, and growth is certainly yon the cards for this person.
And although this agency network can brag about some really big name clients they do business with, they are actually also really well embedded with the SME market, working in partnership with businesses that really need them, rely on them and are invested in their solutions.
THE PERSON
You will be the champion and expert for data insights informing business decisions across a range of clients within FMCG, Pharma, Government and Automotive industries, working closely with them optimise marketing performance and customer engagement through enhanced data strategies.
You should be a self-starter, full of enthusiasm and highly collaborative with the ability to share in the overall vision for the group – a chance to really shine and be a key influence in the direction data strategy takes as an offering.
Skills and experience required:
Educated to at least degree level ideally in a numerate subject; Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, Chemistry, Economics, Machine Learning, Computer Science etc.
A strong background in customer and marketing analytics, and using this to inform targeted marketing activity
Skilled in building out robust test and learn frameworks to measure marketing activity and media effectiveness
Passionate about the use of data for improved marketing performance and better customer understanding and engagement
Strong grounding in CRM is essential, as the bulk of the current work
comes through their CRM agency, where this role will initially sit
Strong understanding of digital marketing and how this plays into CRM and personalisation
Ideally experience of working in a media led environment, or at least understanding of how to drive and measure digital advertising activity

title: Data Scientist - Renewable Energy / Financial Services
description:
Apply now
Expanding financial service start-up specialising in Renewable Energy require a Data Scientist to support strategic analytics and decisioning in the UK energy markets and maintain competitive advantage. You will work on cutting-edge forecasts, tools and strategies, working with Senior Data Scientists, Developers and the Leadership team.
Client Details
Expanding financial service start-up specialising in Renewable Energy
Description
Expanding financial service start-up specialising in Renewable Energy require a Data Scientist to support strategic analytics and decisioning in the UK energy markets and maintain competitive advantage. You will work on cutting-edge forecasts, tools and strategies, working with Senior Data Scientists, Developers and the Leadership team.
Responsibilities:
Financial Analysts and Data Scientists constantly come up with new ideas and hypotheses that need to be investigated, tested and implemented. This newly created role requires a talented individual to join them and help turn ideas into tools that can aid strategic decisions and help optimise business processes.
What you will be doing:
Do the research. Read documents, reports, regulations, etc. Speak to industry experts, phone and email people to find answers.
Applying and developing the key experience and skills (identified below) in a live and collaborative environment
You will identify, extract, clean and analyse data to build strong foundations for tool development.
You will eventually turn your knowledge and the data into tools and services that can be used to directly aid trading decisions and back office applications.
Some tools are forecasts, some are unique presentations of live data and some tools are reports containing new insights for analysts and senior management
Eventually, you'll contribute with your own ideas.
Experience and Skills Required:
Great R, Julia or Python programming skills.
Experience with a database language, ideally SQL.
Experience using version control.
Good with numbers and strong analytical skills.
Experience working in a live production environment.
Experience working in the energy sector or in a financial services company.
Not afraid to dig deep into energy regulations, rules, research reports, publications, etc.
Great attention to detail and motivation required.
Not afraid to pick up the phone and ring people. And follow-up on people when they don't get back to you. You'll need initiative combined with excellent focus to deliver your goals.
You won't easily take no for an answer. You must be willing to persevere until you get the information you need.
A desire to understand everything to the smallest detail; and to understand the complete picture.
Excellent communication skills as you'll have to liaise regularly with colleagues in different areas in the company.
