title: Senior Digital Strategist
description:
Apply on employer's website
Senior Digital Strategist
Location: Home Based / Remote Working
Office based in Corby should you wish to be office based.
Salary: £60,000 - £70,000 per annum (depending on skills and knowledge)
Full Time
Permanent
Closing date: 8th February 2021



About us
CMI works with business and education to inspire people to unleash their potential and become skilled, confident and successful managers and leaders. In fact, CMI has more than 90,000 people training to be better leaders right now across our partnership network in the UK and internationally.
Backed by a unique Royal Charter, CMI is the only organisation able to award Chartered Manager status - the ultimate management accolade, which is proven to boost individuals’ career prospects, management capability and impact in the Workplace.
CMI’s thought leadership, research, events and online resources provide practical insight about critical issues for its 140,000 plus membership community and any professional looking to improve their results; create diverse high-performing teams and nurture the next generation of managers and leaders. #BetterManagers.
About the role
As CMI’s Senior Digital Strategist, you will have the unique responsibility to develop and deliver CMI’s digital-first strategy and roadmap, with the objective of growing CMI’s brand online and building deep stakeholder engagement. You will embed this digital-first engagement strategy throughout CMI, guiding operational teams to develop and build a "best in class" digital experience for the communities CMI serves.
This is a home based role however our office is based in Corby should you wish to be office based.
Key responsibilities
Be the voice of the consumer across all digital touchpoints and drive innovation, influencing the adoption and deployment of digital technology
Cultivate a holistic view and data science approach to analytics, working closely with directorates to drive a consistent approach and unlock future growth
Partner with CMI’s technology, product, policy, member and partner engagement teams to continually create and define digital best practices and to deepen the organisation's understanding of who our communities are, their wants/needs, and how they behave
Engaging and leading cross-functional teams to identify digital execution priorities to be included in the digital roadmap
Work with the Marketing team to influence the planning and direction of brand strategy and deliverables for CMI
Drive high priority, high impact projects
Who we are looking for
Extensive experience of working in digital brand strategy, and a proven track record of developing actionable strategies that drive growth and brand equity
Experience working with start-ups / scale-ups to build successful brands online in a fast-paced, collaborative environment
Firm grasp of end-to-end digital marketing strategies
Excellent communication skills with the ability to talk to and influence both technical and non-technical audiences.
Ability to translate data into meaningful and digestible insights
Ability to work at pace, multitask, work under pressure and meet deadlines
Ability to innovate and develop creative solutions to complex problems
Benefits overview and GDPR
Coming to work at CMI not only means joining a dynamic and ambitious organisation, it also means collaborating and sharing a passion for our mission. Our values are professional, passionate, progressive, and practical and we know the importance of fresh ideas and encourage new perspectives and diversity of thinking.
We are a not for profit, Sunday Times top 100 and IIP Platinum employer offering an engaging, flexible and collaborative culture with a wealth of opportunity for professional development. Not forgetting our dog friendly offices! Some of our competitive benefits include 32 1/2 days’ holiday, flexible working for all, CMI membership, healthcare cash plan and stakeholder pension scheme to name a few!
We reserve the right to close this vacancy earlier than advertised should we receive a high number of suitable applicants.
#jobs #recruiting #workfromhome #remoteworking #digitalstrategist #brand #engagement #digitalmarketing #start-ups

title: Cloud Engineer
description:
Apply now
Cloud Engineer, Azure, Abingdon, £60,000pa - £70,000pa plus benefits:
Our client is a rapidly expanding consultancy firm based in the heart of Oxfordshire. Due to natural growth, they are looking to appoint a talented Cloud Engineer who will build platforms that power both their client and internal projects. Working in their digital and technology teams, you'll design, deploy and monitor virtual infrastructure to solve complex data problems.
If you're a Cloud Engineer looking for a company who can offer clear progression, training, an amazing team, company culture and values, then look no further, this company really does have it all. The Cloud Engineer role:
The Cloud Engineer will build the platform that enables both their client facing and internal technology teams. You'll be responsible for ensuring that end users have an efficient and effective technology service built on a reliable and secure technology infrastructure.
Responsibilities will include:
Understanding the needs of their client facing technology teams to build virtualised infrastructure to support project delivery
Working with their clients to deploy projects into diverse technology environments while meeting scalability and reliability requirements
Developing tools to enhance technology deployment and scalability including CI/CD processes and containerisation
Implementing technology to support their internal projects and help build a DevOps culture
Resolving issues to mitigate immediate impact and drive long term improvement
Influencing teams around platform design best practices, automation and security principles
Acting as a SME during incident management or complex support issues
Working with cloud partners to build relationships and evaluate future technology for suitability
The role will require some travel with a combination of working from their office and remotely with some travel to client sites across the UK where necessary.
Interested, what you'll need:
The successful Cloud Engineer will be a high calibre individual, who possesses an exceptional level of personal drive and development. You will have an analytical mind but also have strong communication skills with a positive approach to working with people as this is key to working within this amazing culture. Ideally you will be degree educated (or equivalent) in an IT related subject. The following are all high up on the essentials:
Deep familiarity with cloud providers in particular Azure
Strong experience in designing virtualised infrastructure environments including compute, virtualisation, storage and security
Worked with engineering teams building technology products ideally including microservices
Automation of delivery through CI/CD processes
Experience of administrating Microsoft environments such as Windows Server and SQL Server
Experience of coaching and mentoring team members as well as sharing learnings more broadly across our business
Any of the following will enhance an application:
Relevant Azure or AWS certifications
Knowledge of python and related data science stacks
Worked with containerisation technologies to simplify deployment
Experience of distributed compute such as Spark or Hadoop and database/data warehouse services
Worked with agile frameworks and practices
Solicited technical requirements into an achievable plan to deliver
If you're a Cloud Engineer with Azure and AWS experience, you fancy working for a consultancy who is ripping up the rule book and taking their industry by storm, then please send MARS a copy of your CV.
MARS Recruitment is an equal opportunities employer and positively welcomes applications from suitably qualified applicants regardless of race, colour, sex, marital status, national origin, religion, age, disability, or any other protected status. Suitable candidates for the role will be contacted within 3 working days, unfortunately if you haven't heard back in this time your application has been unsuccessful at this time.
MARS Recruitment is a specialist Engineering & IT recruiter working in partnership with companies across the UK and offers services of both an Employment Business (for Temporary/Contract roles) and an Employment Agency (for Permanent roles).

title: Data Conversions Analyst
description:
Apply now
Founded in 1997, Reapit is the UK's largest provider of CRM solutions to the property industry, supplying both independent and multinational estate agencies with the most flexible software packages currently on the market. With offices in London, Milton Keynes, Solihull, Leeds and Edinburgh, we are a fast-evolving company looking for talented individuals who can join us on our journey to excellence. We also have offices in Melbourne and Sydney in Australia, looking after our Asian and Middle East clients.
We are proud to supply software solutions to thousands of estate agents across the UK, Australia and UAE, including Savills, Leaders Romans Group, Sherry FitzGerald, Marsh & Parsons, Strutt & Parker, Countrywide and Winkworth, enabling them deliver a world-class customer experience to their sales and lettings clients.
We are now looking for a Data Conversions Analyst to join the Data Migrations team within the Professional Services division in the Solihull office.
This is a data analysis role and will suit someone with a strong interest in data, excellent attention to detail and a passion for problem solving. Experience with databases and SQL is essential, along with proven ability in data analysis, data handling and data-based decision making.
The position can be offered as an entry level role to the right candidate who doesn't necessarily have all the skills and experience listed, but who can demonstrate the willingness and ability to develop into the role and grow with the business.
The Professional Services division is focused on delivery implementations of our software customised and configured to our clients’ requirements, and all of our targeting is based around scheduled delivery of work packages. As a result, familiarity with working in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented environment is essential, along with the ability to self-motivate and time manage.
The primary purpose of the Data Migrations team is to design, build, configure and implement conversions into our software using the existing tool-sets in accordance with their understanding of a client’s source data.
The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate the following skills and experience:
Solid understanding of core data science concepts (e.g. data vs. information, data exploration, statistical analysis, data typing) and estate agency terminology
Fluent ability in SQL (particularly MySQL and T-SQL dialects)
Excellent general IT skills, particularly Microsoft Excel and remote access tools
Proven track record of attentiveness to detail and meeting of quality standards
Proven track record of multi-tasking and time management to enable production of multiple deliverables
Ability to work under pressure and to specific deadlines
Ability to handle changes in requirements and scheduling in accordance with business needs.
MySQL and SQL Server RDBMS (desirable)
Unix and CMD shell (desirable)
Github (desirable)
Experience working in agile/waterfall project management environments (desirable)
Experience working with estate agents as end users (desirable)
We are looking for someone who:
Is confident, enthusiastic and personable
Has a can-do attitude and is willing to go the external mile to get the job done
Demonstrates attention to detail and is well organised
Is able to work to impeccable standards and work calmly under pressure to meet deadlines and expectations
Is a team player
Has integrity and persistence
Is proactive, forward thinking and innovative
Is approachable and friendly
Is results oriented with the ability to see the high-level picture
Core Competencies:
These core company competencies will be tested at interview in relation to the position and expected calibre of candidate. The successful candidate will be able to give relevant examples of how they have used these skills in a workplace environment.
Delivering results
Continuous improvement
Motivation
Flexibility
Strategic contribution & business awareness
Resilience and change management
This is an exciting and challenging time to join a growing forward-thinking business, and there is the opportunity to develop quickly both personally and professionally.

title: Account Manager - FinTech
advertiser: Give A Grad A Go Ltd
description:
Apply now
Looking for technology Account Management jobs and for Sales jobs in London and want to join a rapidly growing FinTech startup? Apply to this fantastic Account Manager job in London today!
Company profile
In this Sales Account Manager job in London, you will be joining a market-leading startup that helps several hundred innovative tech companies make the most of government R&D funding schemes. They are experts in the world of R&D tax credits, and over the course of the last 10 years, the company have raised over £120 million for over 600 companies - maintaining a 100% success rate across the board. They operate across various industries such as Financial Services, Pharmaceutical, Construction, Chemicals, Engineering, Food Technology, Construction, Data Science, Software and Electronics Heavy Industry and Automotive.
Job description
In this Account Management role, you’ll be working with some of their most important and interesting clients. You will be expected to quickly gain a deep understanding of the R&D funding schemes as well as the particulars the services on offer. Moreover, you'll be working to help define and enhance processes, and then execute them across your client base. Lastly, you’ll be tasked with finding new business opportunities within your client book, either through referrals or by expanding existing accounts. This is an incredibly consultative sales role as you'll be helping clients gain funding opportunities or funding product for cutting-edge tech companies.
Key responsibilities
In this Client Account Manager opportunity in London, your responsibilities will include:
Researching clients to understand their project and the funding options available to them
Client due diligence before calls
Making 20+ calls per a day
Facilitate meetings to ensure the client and delivery team get the information they need
Spend time catching up with your clients to make sure they feel cared for
Seek new business opportunities through client referrals to bolster our database
Propose a change to our delivery process to enhance our service
Scan team communications, see one of your client’s names pop up, and get involved
Work with the delivery team to collate the client info needed to complete a project
Facilitate debriefs with the delivery team to ensure expectations are clear in order to get projects over the line
Proactively fill in CRM and keep all deals up to date, and schedule activities for the week
Updating and changing company policies to speed up delivery process
Sharing a passion for technology and new areas of development that you encounter daily with the team, so that everyone is up-to-date with cutting edge tech
Job requirements
A university degree
Experience in a consultative sales-based role, Recruitment Consultant, Business Development Executive, SaaS Sales, Technical Sales Executive or Account Manager with full sales cycle experiences
Experience in handling multiple calls and inbound emails every day
CRM administration skills (Salesforce, Hubspot, Pipedrive)
Confident speaking about all things tech
An independent self-starter who loves finding new ways of engaging clients
Confidence working with minimal supervision
Excellent organisational skills - you must be able to efficiently work across multiple projects
Benefits of the job
A competitive starting salary of between £28,000- £32,000 depending on experience
Up to 6 weeks holiday each year
£2,000 yearly training budget
Weekly "lunch force" allowance
Season Ticket Loan
The chance to work with some of the coolest and most innovative technology startups around
Looking for graduate Account Manager or Business Development jobs in London and want to join an exciting FinTech startup? If you’re a proactive graduate with great communication skills, apply for this Account Manager tech startup job in London today!

title: Senior Analyst - Strategy & Analytics
description:
Apply now
QuantSpark is an innovative boutique strategic analytics consultancy based in London. Our hybrid team combines the best of strategy consulting, data analytics and product development to deliver creative and impactful solutions to public and private sector clients. We go beyond the remit of traditional strategy consultancies by deploying advanced data analytics and software engineering capabilities to build bespoke tools that deliver long-lasting value - the tools and solutions we create become embedded in our clients' daily operations. Our ever-growing client base consists of FTSE 100 retailers, prestigious Private Equity houses and governments.
As a Senior Analyst at QuantSpark, you will be joining a team of driven, entrepreneurial, and intellectually-curious analysts who are laser-focused on providing commercial impact. We're a small but super-effective team so in particular we look out for Analysts who have entrepreneurial flair and an ability to understand what's important for our clients.
Our work spans a broad range of clients from the private and public sectors including one of the UK's largest supermarkets, a leading mens fashion retailer, a strategic communications agency, Google, Young Enterprise, and the United Nations.
While our approach to supporting smarter decisions is industry-agnostic, most of our work involves analysing large datasets and complex systems within the context of optimising customer behaviour for retailers and portfolio companies owned by private equity funds. The breadth of the support we provide our clients covers strategic planning, sales, marketing, and their own product development. Some recent questions we've been asked to tackle include:
"We want to maximise gross profit within 18 months, should we double our online marketing spend to £10m in order to achieve this?"
"How can we understand customer missions at each of our nationwide stores and adjust store space accordingly?"
"Where will Universal Credit rollout happen over the next 12 months and how will that affect rental arrears?"
Requirements
We welcome applications from anyone with a track-record of super-powering decisions with data and an ambition to have practical impact. We're looking for people with a creative and robust approach to solving problems with experience of managing small teams of Analysts.
Some of our recent modelling and development work includes:
Analysing 1bn+ annual transactions to build a tool for a UK supermarket to help them decide how much space to allocate to their 1,500+ stores
Developing an ROI system to understand effectiveness of £5m+ of social media advertising campaigns
Building an automated marketing segmentation model to nudge millions of customers
Developing terrorist content algorithms to detect propaganda and work with internet platforms to tackle this content
Creating automated dashboards to help a private equity fund understand the performance of its B2C portfolio companies
Developing a location intelligence model to inform social impact communications campaigns
So who are we looking for? You will have a range of analytical, commercial, and interpersonal qualities including:
Analytical ability - bringing to bear brainpower to analyse complex scenarios
Attention to detail - demanding the very highest standards of quality
Technical creativity - applying intellectual dexterity to unusual problems
Grit - encouraging others through your "can-do" attitude
Desire to learn - striving to learn and to teach others
Communication - articulating yourself with precision and nous
Confidence - showing leadership with teams and with clients
Essential:
Experience of managing small teams of Analysts and Data Scientists
Experience in strategy consultancy, or in an in-house strategy / analytics position within industry such as a retailer
Demonstrable proficiency in SQL and one of R or Python
Strong MS Excel skills, with VBA being a plus
Experience configuring BI tools (and ETL processes in general)
Understanding machine learning approaches
Writing client deliverables such as reports and presentations
Unfortunately we are not able to sponsor visas to work in the UK at this moment.
Benefits
Social impact / pro bono data science and development projects
£40-55k salary (based on experience)
Monthly training & conference budget
25 days holiday, plus Bank Holidays
Pension contribution scheme
Cycle to work scheme
Top-notch kit with high-end Macs standard for everyone
Monthly socials and dinners

title: Data Quality Manager
description:
Apply now
Job Title: Data Quality Manager
Reporting To: Head of Data
Location: Wilmslow/Remote - Flexible Working 4 Days/Full-Time
Hours of Work: 09:00 - 17:30 or in line with business needs
Salary: £50-£60k
The Role
As we embark on the next phase of our data journey, we want to be less reactive to data quality issues and more proactive in effectively preventing the challenges that poor data quality can present. Critical to our growth ambition is good quality data, as such, an exciting opportunity has arisen across the Citation Group for a Data Quality Manager.
Accountable for data quality across the Citation Group, you will identify and implement metrics that give us a clear view of the quality of our data, and how and where we can improve it. You will need to build strong partnerships with all stakeholders across the Citation Group and build a data quality programme.
You will work in collaboration with stakeholders to build a data quality framework, enabling you to identify and allocate the appropriate resources and improve the skills, technology, and processes required to implement your data quality programme.
Great data quality is critical to our data science aspirations and is a fundamental building block across all areas of the Citation Group from campaigning through to service delivery.
You will be the data management expert, engaging with leadership and other key stakeholders to drive adoption of good data management practises across the Group
The Person
We are looking for someone who can roll their sleeves up and 'dig in' with the rest of the team. In addition, the successful candidate should have:
* Broad experience and a proven track record of managing data and processes with CRM technologies is essential
* Strong knowledge of Salesforce and how data is brought into Salesforce in terms of both business and technology processes, ensuring data quality best practises are adhered to
* Ability to maintain relationships with all data users, actively driving engagement, adoption and usage and providing processes, training and support to ensure data quality standards are maintained
* Implemented data quality frameworks that can measure the quality and accuracy of data throughout the business
* Experience of identifying and implementing tools that can monitor data quality and ensure focus is provided on areas critical to the business
* Extensive experience in managing critical issues and significant risks around data quality
Education & Experience:
* You will be the primary advocate for good data management, utilising great communications and persuasion skills across multiple stakeholders to ensure data quality standards are met
* Experience in defining and implementing a clear consistent approach to the management and tagging of metadata
* Experience in data quality monitoring such as the adherence to business rules, data profiling and issue resolution workflow
* Understanding and experience of data protection and the impacts this has on data quality
About Us
We are Citation. We are far from your average service provider. Our colleagues bring their brilliant selves to work every day and we create an environment where they can shine. We are a nice bunch. We don't do office politics or "that's not my job". We listen, support and take ownership.
We have been proudly delivering valuable HR and Health and Safety services to SME's across the UK for over 20 years. Passionate about service, we're on a mission to revolutionise our colleague's and client's experience by employing brilliant people who are experts at what they do and smile whilst they are doing it.
Working for Citation you will have access to 25 days holiday, plus your birthday off work, gym membership discount, healthcare, childcare vouchers, the opportunity to purchase extra leave, pension contributions and more.
It's a great place to work because of the people we employ. Fun and professional, we want likeminded individuals who love to love their job (no 'mood hoovers' here thanks!) and want the Company to succeed.
So, if our culture sounds like a good fit for you and you want to be part of our success story, then send us your details.
Please click 'Apply' to continue your application.

title: Head of Strategic Environment
description:
Apply on employer's website
Do you want to play a key leadership role in building a new senior team of strategy professionals at HM Land Registry? We are looking for a Head of Strategic Environment to join right at the start of this new chapter in HM Land Registry’s proud 150-year history underpinning the property market in England and Wales.

You will have direct influence on how HM Land Registry contributes to social, economic and environmental gain in private and public sector services and use your talent to help us achieve world leading status for the contribution we make to a healthy, successful and sustainable economy.

This is a rare opportunity to build a new way of responding to the broad and complex social, economic and policy environment that HM Land registry operates in, and be at the heart of what it means for a public body of critical, international importance to make the very best contribution it can to a healthy, sustainable property market and wider economy.

HM Land Registry are building a modern, dynamic and inclusive team of strategy professionals. We offer entirely flexible working practices and the role can be based at any HMLR office, with remote working and national travel as required.

Head of Strategic Environment Responsibilities:

You will be responsible for translating external factors including Government policy, economic market conditions, the intentions of our major stakeholders and the social and economic aims of the conveyancing and property industries into strategic intelligence. This intelligence will be used to inform organisational strategy development.

You will commission, combine and 'make strategic sense' of in-house analysis by others to support evidence-based recommendations by our most senior leaders. To be successful, it will be crucial that the strategy unit integrates with established functions within Land Registry that have deep and broad connections to the outside world. Examples of these include our Chief’s Office; new practices in data science, data management and data analysis; customer and market insight operational teams; legal conveyancing experts; risk and counter-fraud experts and new analytical teams in macro and micro economics and social/behavioural research.

You will build senior contacts with leaders of major functional areas of the organisation to support intelligence gathering and identify key external developments relevant to HM Land Registry at the strategic level; commissioning insight work from the Head of Strategic Influencing where necessary

You will work collaboratively with other leaders in the Unit and the Deputy Director to help inform the Board by collectively shaping thinking around strategic plans, hypothesising and shaping proposals from all available information to help realise the boards ambitions.

You will attend Board meetings, when required, to support the Deputy Director with the provision of expert opinion.

Head of Strategic Environment Requirements:

To be successful in this role you will have demonstrable strength in analytical thinking in large / complex ‘ecosystems’ and be capable of translating analytical insight into influential reports.

You will have previous experience of working with a range of information sources, backed by an knowledge of economic, business and government affairs and possess excellent relationship building skills to support intelligence and information gathering.

You will be able to manage multiple projects under tight deadline constraints.

You will be a good communicator, with strong presentation skills and the ability to contribute to executive-level discussion. Excellent written communication abilities are essential, including the ability to prepare briefs and submissions on a regular basis.

You will have demonstrable influencing skills at a senior level, providing a high level of personal impact, with the ability to bring groups of people from across the organisation together to work better together.

A great place to work:

HM Land Registry is a vibrant place to work with sport and social events and a variety of clubs. We offer flexible working to help you achieve a work-life balance that works for you and us.

Where difference is celebrated
We’re committed to fairness and equality for all, so you feel valued for who you are and what you do. Diversity fuels our innovation. Our shared values help us work together, to benefit the communities we serve.

Our employee diversity networks support our culture of inclusion and contribute to our diversity action plan.

Location: Birkenhead, North West, CH41 6DU : Croydon, London, CR0 2AQ : Coventry, West Midlands, CV1 3BH : Durham, North East, DH1 5TR : Weymouth, South West, DT4 9TT : Gloucester, South West, GL1 1DQ : Kingston upon Hull, Yorkshire and the Humber, HU2 8JN : Leicester, East Midlands, LE3 5DR : Nottingham, East Midlands, NG1 7AU : Peterborough, Eastern, PE1 1QF : Plymouth, South West, PL6 5WS : Preston, North West, PR4 1TE : Swansea, Wales, SA7 9FQ : Telford, West Midlands, TF3 4LR

Type: Full Time, Permanent

Salary: £64,416, (Croydon £68,660)

You may have experience of the following: Strategy Manager, Strategic Management, Public Sector, Civil Service, Central Government, etc.

Ref: 96747

title: Head of Technical Data Services
description:
Apply now
Head of Technical Data Services

JOB PROFILE

Purpose of the Job: This is the chance to become involved at the start of a new data programme within the UK, using your expertise to help deliver the company's ambitious data strategy. As part of the programme leadership team, you will play an instrumental role in the enablement of world-class data analytics and data science through a new cloud-based data-lake and virtual warehouse. The Head of Technical Data Services will work closely with the CDO (Chief Data Officer), Strategic Architect, Data Office and Data and BI specialists to bring data vision to life. You will be responsible for the management of a UK wide team and multiple systems providing various data services across the whole of UK to both internal and external customers. As well as managing existing data services you will be working with consultants and specialists to design, deploy and maintain a new, modern AWS data environment, utilising the latest technology and innovations. This is an exciting role for an experienced technical expert/manager who is looking for career progression working with latest technologies and modern data practises. This role reports into the newly appointed Chief Data Officer.

Key Accountabilities:
*You will primarily be responsible for the design, build, test and deployment of a new data services solution.
*You will play a pivotal role in developing the new AWS data lake to significantly enhance business insight and value.
*You will lead a newly formed data team comprising of members who are currently dispersed throughout the IT organisation.
*An important part of the role will be to build a cohesive, effective team to deliver on the technical work needed to fulfil the data strategy. This is a really exciting opportunity to demonstrate your impact in making a positive difference with full support from the organisation to hone your senior leadership skills.
*You will be responsible for ensuring that all delivery follows SDLC principles.
*You will ensure that all data services are running to the required availability and latency metrics
*You will be responsible for putting in-place the relevant IT Support models for all data-services
*You will ultimately be involved in the key escalation route for major service-affecting incidents
*Working with the programme leadership team you will be required to balance capacity between:

Outcome, Results and Key Performance Indicators:
*Successful movement of existing data professional teams into your team
*Continued delivery and support of services by those teams during transition
*Key milestones met for the data programme
*Successful ongoing support and maintenance of the data systems and the eco-system
*A happy community of data customers throughout the business and externally who trust you and the team to deliver fit-for-purpose products

Dimensions of Job:
*This role will work closely with AWS Gold Partner data consultants ensuring best practise is implemented, the role offers a great opportunity for the right candidate to develop their modern data management skills.
*This role requires a 'hands on' attitude to help guide and coach the team on new technologies and best practise
*Knowledge of Apache Spark, SQL and/or Python is required
*This role will manage teams that are based throughout the UK
*This role can be home or office based, supports flexible working. Some UK travel will be required as team members are based in Leeds, Midlands and London.
*Thought leadership to support the Data Driven Strategy
*This role will have several direct reports
*As part of the programme leadership team, the role will provide the technical skills, knowledge and expertise to deliver on time and to budget
*A great opportunity for a talented senior data engineer/manager seeking career advancement

Key Relationships:
*Chief Data Officer
*Data Governance Manager
*IT Director/s
*Product Owner/s
*Strategic Architect
*Agile IT teams consisting of Business Analyst, Engineers, Testers, Scrummasters, Architects

Knowledge and Skills:
*Excellent leadership skills essential, able to effectively manage the newly formed team to ensure engagement and productivity
*Experience in a similar industry facilities management services, construction or energy sector is preferred
*Widespread knowledge of data technologies including AWS services, Redshift, Glue, Cloudformation, IAM, Sage Maker, Athena, SAP technologies include Data Services and Microsoft Power BI preferred
*Data curation and modelling understood
*Good working knowledge of Apache Spark, Python and/or SQL is essential

Experience:
*Experience of working in a data team for a medium or large organisation
*Experience of Agile delivery methodology and how to best make use of teams to successfully deliver key data services to stakeholders preferred

Qualifications:
*Comfortable working within an Agile AWS environment utilising SAP data technology with any associated qualifications an advantage
*Ideally educated to Degree level or equivalent

Certes Computing (and all of its subsidiary companies) is committed to promoting equality and diversity in its business operations.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Apply on employer's website
Data Scientist
Full Time
Band 7
Salary £38,890 - £44,503 per annum pro rata
Do you want to help make a difference to community health services?
Are you keen to be part of a dynamic, friendly and ambitious team?
And work for an organisation recently rated as ‘Outstanding’?
We are seeking an enthusiastic and experienced Data Scientist to join our talented Service Redesign Team. Our team provides ad hoc trouble shooting support and leads the transformation of clinical pathways, processes and systems to improve the quality, efficiency and effectiveness of the health services we provide.
As a member of the Service Redesign team you will use data to deliver expert support and insights to solve complex problems, identify improvement opportunities and advance the use of data across the organisation in delivering effective and efficient healthcare services.
The ideal candidate will not only have extensive experience in the data science field but equally possess excellent non-technical skills and knowledge in particular the ability to think/work creatively and effectively communicate findings, identify innovative and imaginative solutions to problems and demonstrate sound business acumen. This role will require you to work both independently on projects with services or contribute to a wider programme of redesign work.
For an informal discussion on this post please contact Amy Edwards, Head of Service Redesign via email on .
Remote (Digital) Interview via Microsoft Teams
This post is subject to the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act 1974 (Exemptions) Order 1975 and as such it will be necessary for a submission for Disclosure of Barring Service to be made to check for any previous criminal convictions. Cambridgeshire Community Services NHS Trust is committed to the fair treatment of its staff, potential staff or users in line with its equal opportunities policy and policy statement on the recruitment of ex-offenders.
Successful applicants to posts at band 6 or above for which a DBS check is required, will be asked to pay for this as a condition of their job offer (£44 for an Enhanced Check or £27 for a Standard Check). This payment will be deducted from their first month’s salary unless a longer pay back period is agreed with the appointing manager.
This will not apply to successful applicants who are registered with the DBS Update Service and is in possession of the disclosure certificate, for whom an online status check will be undertaken.

title: Corporate Information Analyst
description:
Apply on employer's website
Working hours: 37.5 hours per week
The Business Intelligence Department has a number of new roles available for the right people to come and join our fantastic team. The additional roles demonstrate the recognition of the importance of developing data and information as a critical asset. We are also working on a Data Science strategy that sets out the Trust’s ambition for a data-driven organisation.
We are seeking to recruit a dynamic individual to become a Corporate Information Analyst within the team. This is an exciting time for the Trust with the implementation of a new EPR in 2021 (Cerner), and Power BI. Using this new software will allow for further automation of reports, and allow the team to focus on predictive modelling, improved data quality, monitor outcomes and support operational managers with performance decisions and pathway management.
We are looking to automate routine reports using Power BI and this role will work with stakeholders and other analysts to develop specifications and design new reports.
The Corporate Information Analyst will be expected to develop excellent working relationships with Business Intelligence colleagues, senior managers and clinicians, promoting the proactive use of information.
The role of the Corporate Information Analyst is not just about numbers; the successful candidate will be expected to provide interpretation of key indicators and translate data into clear messages to support decision making. Where data suggests that there is room for improvement the Corporate Information Analyst will be expected to present this information in a clear and unambiguous manner.
The role is based with the Business Intelligence team in Moston Lodge.
Candidates are expected to be educated to degree level (or equivalent) in a relevant field or have significant relevant experience. The candidate will also have to demonstrate experience in a similar role, ideally within a healthcare setting. You will be an experienced user of Excel, sql and Power BI. Experience in the use of R would be an advantage. You must be able to extract, interpret and present data in a clear and concise format, translating complex technical data into information. You will have excellent communication skills – both verbally and written and you must be an effective team player.
This is a challenging role and organisational expectations of this role are high, however for the right candidate this will prove to be an extremely rewarding and satisfying position and an excellent career move in a forward thinking Trust.
For further details / informal visits contact:
NameDenise WoodJob titleHead of Information & PerformanceEmail addressdenisewood@nhs.netTelephone number01244-365336

title: Data Engineering Manager
description:
Apply now
Data Engineering Manager
(Tech stack: Data Engineer Manager, ETL, Data Warehouse, Microsoft Azure, SQL, CI/CD, SaaS, Developer, Programmer, Engineer, Architect, Data Engineer Manager)
Born in 2012 in California, our client began development on an app and website that made finding and booking classes effortless for fitness goers across the state. The company is now changing how people live their lives, bringing together a community of enthusiasts, helping people find the activities that make their true selves come alive or supporting small businesses and studios across the entire globe. They believe that being active is the key to living a happy and healthy life. Our client is now active in over 15 countries and continues rapid growth on a yearly basis.
They are looking for Data Engineer Manager to provide the strategy on how data is held and managed across their platforms, back-office and integration systems. You will empower teams to deliver roadmaps and projects through efficient data and pipeline management, ETL and visualisations to produce BI that enables data-driven decisions.
The ideal Data Engineering Manager candidates should have ETL experience using cloud-based data warehousing technologies, ideally within Microsoft Azure. Knowledge of SQL, NoSQL & API based data pipelines with proven experience of delivering production data engineering solutions with quality at the forefront is required. CI/CD engineering practices including TDD, A/B Testing and Automation Testing is required. Experience with managing data in both bespoke data repositories and the data repositories of SaaS offerings i.e. Salesforce, NetSuite, HubSpot and Google Analytics is required.
This position comes with the following benefits:
Annual bonus.
Free medical, dental and vision coverage.
Flexible work hours.
£5,000 training allowance.
Healthy (and unhealthy) snacks.
Charitable giving programs.
Casual dress - fitness wear encouraged!
Team classes, events and happy hours.
There is no 'I' in team. By working with talented individuals and developing upon innovative ideas, the team continues to succeed and grow. They are a global movement with big plans for the future. It's an incredible opportunity so if you're interested, act and apply today!
Location: Nottingham / Remote
Salary: £75 - £85k + Bonus + Car + Benefits
Noir continues to be the leading Microsoft recruitment agency; we can help you make the right career decisions!

title: Data Engineering Manager
description:
Apply now
DATA ENGINEERING MANAGER
CENTRAL LONDON CURRENTLY FLEXIBLE / REMOTE / HOME WORKING
UP TO £105,000 + BENEFITS
Harnham is working with a successful Fintech who have a Data Engineering squad that needs managing. They have completed an AWS migration and are now looking to make the platform streaming ready.
THE COMPANY:
This company have become one of Harnham's biggest partners having scaled out their Analytics team. We helped build their Data Engineering squad which comprises of 6 perms and 3 contractors. This team now needs managing by a hands on Tech Lead who has implemented streaming technologies within a cloud environment. You will be supporting the launch of two new products in the credit card space hence why the updates to the platform are needed.
THE ROLE:
Leading a team of 9; running code reviews, architectural designs, and technological decisions
Feedback to the C-suite to give updates on projects and having to explain how resources are being managed
Driving best coding practices, leading from the front when coding and reviewing CI/CD
Introducing Kafka as the streaming technology on top of their AWS platform
YOUR SKILLS & EXPERIENCES:
An understanding of AWS and most of its components
Good Scala programming skills within Spark
Previously introduced streaming techs ideally Kafka
Ideally managed a small team and run code reviews
HOW TO APPLY:
Please register your interest by sending you CV to Henry Rodrigues via the apply link on this page. (The Company have outlined a fully remote interview process and have a remote on-boarding policy in place).

title: Data Engineering Manager
description:
Apply now
Data Engineering Manager - Scala
Fintech
London
£105,000

As the Data Engineering Manager, you will be looking after a team of 10 strong Scala Data Engineers for this Fintech. You will be managing greenfield projects to facilitate new product launches.

THE COMPANY:
This company has gone through a period of hyper-growth over the last 3 years. They specialise in the credit card space and have launched multiple successful products and are now one of the most trusted brands out there. They have several big data teams looking after their client's data for the advanced analytics team to gather insights on. They have established a robust AWS architecture that allows the business to store and stream big data coming in from all types of sources.
THE ROLE:
As a Data Engineering Manager, you will be expected to be hands-on with Spark/Scala, Kafka. You will be part of the design team to enhance their AWS platform, introducing technologies like Kubernetes, Docker, Jenkins to ensure pipelines are deployed effectively. Your main task will be to manage the team of Scala Engineers and run code reviews. You will be providing direction to the wider team, managing stakeholders, and reporting back to the C-suite.
YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
The ideal Data Engineering Manager will have:
Expert Scala coding, as well as quality coding practices
Led designs, launched greenfield platforms, and managed code reviews
Experience leading Data Engineering squads
Strong AWS knowledge, knowing which components are best to use
HOW TO APPLY:
Please register your interest by sending your CV via the Apply link on this page.

title: Data Engineering Lead
description:
Apply now
Data Engineering Lead (Python & PHP) - Partially hands-off
London based PropTech company
Remote or London based - Permanent


This is a great opportunity for a Senior/Lead Data engineer with a software engineering background to join a dynamic start up focusing on data and complex web products, working with up-to-date tech stack and architecture.
You will work together with the team to deliver big data products and help to establish structure and workflow to the developers. You will also be responsible for the product’s architecture and future development.

This role is a hands-on position whilst leading a small team made up of senior/mid backend developers and data engineers.

What do you need?
Experience leading projects & small teams
Experience being involved with architectural decisions
Proven experience in planning and implementing big data products & complex logic
Proven experience on delivering production ready big data products
At least 3 years of experience working with data like (data engineering, unstructured data, processing etc)
At least 2 years working with Python in software engineering or data engineering capacity
Experience working with PHP & Laravel would be advantageous
At least 2 years working with MySQL & Elasticsearch
At least 1 year team lead experience
What do you get?
Salary from £60k to £70k
25 days annual leave + 1 extra for your birthday + bank holidays
Pension
Remote working if desired + more!

title: Data Engineering Manager
description:
Apply now
Role: Data Engineering Manager
Salary: £50,000
Location: Redhill
Start Date: ASAP
One of the UK's leading insurance companies is looking a Data Engineering manager to join their team. This is a great role for the right candidate as you will be planning /delivering on projects, managing a team, liaising with senior stakeholders and you will play a key role in implementing new data management tools.
Key skill/Experience:
Knowledge & experience using SAS
Solid skills using SQL
Experience with planning and managing projects
Knowledge of Cloud platforms (Azure)
Self-starter
Knowledge of Hadoop would be beneficial
Experience managing a team
If this role matches your skillset do not hesitate to submit you CV

title: Director of Data Engineering
description:
Apply now
DIRECTOR OF DATA ENGINEERING
£150,000 - £170,000 + PACKAGE
LONDON OR BIRMINGHAM
THE COMPANY:
An opportunity for a Director/Head of Data Engineering to join a well-established, large corporation in the telecoms space where they are building a brand-new Data Engineering team and launching an exciting new migration project. You will oversee a team of highly skilled Data Engineers and work closely with the Data Science team.
THE ROLE:
Building out and on-boarding a large team of skilled Data Engineers.
Guiding a migration project of Data from the business's legacy Data Platform into a GCP platform.
Owning the strategy and shaping the vision for the Data Engineering team.
Implement cutting edge Data & Analytics.
YOUR SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:
A core background in Data/Software Engineering.
Knowledge and understanding of working in a cloud environment (AWS, GCP)
Experience working in an Agile environment.
Previous experience building out and managing scalable teams.
THE BENEFITS:
This role offers a competitive salary between £150,000 - £170,000 + extensive benefits + bonus.
HOW TO APPLY:
Please register your interest by sending your CV to Holly Neeves via the Apply link on this page.

title: Data Engineering Tech Lead
description:
Apply now
The role involves technical leadership and accountability for the delivery of technical solutions to implement the company's data strategy, including new data services to process data at scale, both in batch and real-time pipelines, to support a wide range of data-driven projects and support our transformation into an AI-ready organisation.

* Technical Leadership
oAlign the business strategy with the technical strategy for your product team
oBe accountable for the architecture of data platform, data services and products and ensure that it is aligned with the broader technology strategy
oTo coach & mentor your data engineers, encouraging best practices, standards and continuous improvement of practices & processes

*Line Management
oSupport, coach and develop high performing engineers through regular 1:1s, setting & tracking objectives, managing performance and supporting the development of individual team members
oBe responsible for the overall engagement of your data engineers, ensuring that each individual is aware of the strategy and goals
oEnsure that your team is resourced appropriately and be accountable for recruitment of engineers within your team, preparing job descriptions, conducting telephone & face to face interviews and onboarding new hires

*Data Engineering
oLeverage your experience and skills to assist your team in establishing the best architecture for our Snowflake-based, from ingestion of new feeds, to the transformation and delivery of data products to business stakeholders, as well as the delivery of data processing pipelines and services for other products to consume in our real-time data platform.
oLiaise with tech leads from all product teams to standardise our data engineering tech stack, establishing best practices and developing generic software components that can be adopted in multiple projects
oLiaise with Data Science and Business Intelligence leads to identify requirements and develop the necessary data solutions to deliver against those requirements
oExtreme programming practices - notably pair programming and test-driven development
oBuild, support and maintain automated, fault-tolerant, scalable products and solutions that are continuously delivered into our production environment
oBe technically curious, tackling problems without giving up, and producing solutions that less-experienced engineers can use, maintain, and learn from
oHave a sense of being part of a larger whole with a desire to establish best practices & standards and to continuously improve the discipline of product engineering

*Essential Skills:
oComfortable with using a variety of frameworks, languages & tools and able to pick up new skills when the need arises
oGood experience in Java 8+ with Maven & Spring, JUnit
oExperience with Python and familiarity with machine learning - desirable
oRelational databases such as SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Amazon RDS. Experience with Snowflake a plus.
oExperience batch processing frameworks, preferably familiarity with DBT, Apache Airflow/Spring DataFlow, Metaflow, or similar
oExperience with message brokers and stream processing technologies (Kinesis, Kafka, Flink)
oAWS, Jenkins, Docker & Kubernetes, ElasticSearch & Kibana, Grafana & Prometheus
oReading & Writing Code, Debugging & Troubleshooting, IDE & OS Basics, Test Driven Development, Pair Programming, Clean Code & Refactoring, Version Control, CI / CD, Algorithms & Data Structures, DI/ IoC, Mocks & Stubs, Alerting & Monitoring, Functional & Non-Functional Testing, SOLID Principles, Containerisation & Networking Basics, Solution Architecture

You will have line management responsibilities of 5-8 data engineers and will influence how the data engineering technology budget is spent.

This Data Engineering Tech Lead role is based in Uxbridge (remote working) and pays c£75-85K base + £6.7K Car Allowance, 15% bonus + bens.

description:

*Continuous Integration with Jenkins
*Test-Driven Development and XP

This role involves close collaboration with data scientists, data analysts and product engineers.

This Data Engineer position is based in Uxbridge but can be remote working and is paying c£50-65K + 10% bonus + Bens, depending on relevant experience.

title: Data Science Director
description:
Apply Now
Data Science Director
SALARY - £75k - £95k plus excellent benefits
LOCATION - Remote, then Central London
TEAM
Having built most of the existing Marketing Sciences function, we can vouch for the exceptional quality of talent this agency has managed to attract; not just because of the complexity of data science projects on offer, but also because of the vision of their Marketing Sciences Director. He is passionate about training and development and has built a strong culture of collaboration and innovation. Every single person we’ve placed, LOVES their job and more importantly, LOVES their team! The work life balance is excellent and there is an adult working environment where you are trusted to deliver and given the freedom to manage your own time.
ROLE
In this role, you will not only manage a team of Data Scientists, but you can also apply your advanced analytical skills across a variety of cutting edge data science projects including heat mapping, digital automation and attribution, NLP, machine learning, whilst working closely with the Head of Data Science to develop the offering and capabilities within the team.
You will work closely with huge, often, global brands to shape analytical roadmaps, scoping data science and insights projects, leading your team to delivery as well as getting your hands dirty with high level, complex analytics yourself.
We want Hackers, Data Scientist leaders who can add value through bleeding edge techniques and methodologies, all whilst applying an acute commercial and strategic lens. I’m afraid to say experience with predictive modelling and segmentation builds is not enough here, we need people who have something a little different about their background. You will possibly have a data engineering edge to your experience, will be highly proficient in cloud based technologies, maybe you’ve used some special analytical techniques such as gravity modelling or catchment analysis, even worked with geospatial data….we want to hear from you!
Advanced programming skills in Python are required, as well as an all round problem solving approach.

You will work closely with the Head of Data Science contributing to pitches and presenting simple and compelling solutions to complex client problems. You should be highly skilled in the latest data science techniques in order to inspire and lead your team on a daily basis, QA-ing work and leading on the best methodologies and approaches to take.
Skills and experience required:
Educated to degree level in a numerate subject; Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, Chemistry, Economics, Machine Learning, Computer Science etc.
A background in data science; (possibly) data engineering, (definitely) machine learning and AI, ideally within a marketing environment
Strong programming experience with either Python AND SQL as a minimum
Ability to gather and scope requirements for a variety of analytical projects
Ability to engage with senior level client stakeholders and operate at a senior level on projects
TO APPLY

For further information or to apply please contact:

Kate McDermott - Managing Consultant @ Blue Pelican Marketing
Share through your LI profile if you’re non-active and simply curious
You don’t have to have a CV to find a new job! We’re always keen to talk to good data experts.

For more vacancies which may suit your needs, please visit us at www.bluepelican.com

description:

Data Engineer (Azure) | Nottingham | Software Company | £65k
My clients demand for Data is relentless. As an innovator and major disruptor within their industry, it is absolutely key that their solutions are well engineered, robust and highly secure. I am therefore on the lookout for a cracking Data Engineer to join them within their Data Engineering effort; ultimately ensuring that the right data is delivered to the right people at the right time.
They are without a doubt one of the most exciting, highly data-driven tech firms in the Midlands right now and an enviable company to work for. They have built an established team full of some of the most talented developers, testers and data scientists in the local market and offer an intellectually challenging, technically stimulating and fun environment to work in. You will be confident working with different teams throughout the business and comfortable dealing with a variety of stakeholders. You'll be comfortable with Azure Data Bricks/Factory and data warehousing.
You will be passionate about new data trends and upcoming innovations in cloud, storage and data engineering. I want to see an Engineer who isn't phased by new challenges, but instead thrives from devising smart solutions to novel problems. I want somebody who isn't thinking traditionally and is obsessed with the latest going ons in the Data industry!
As a business, my client have cross-functional teams with very little hierarchy and you will find yourself working in a highly motivated, technically forward team, with a bunch of like-minded and extremely capable and likeable colleagues. The team are very close-knit and know how to have laugh.. whilst getting the job done. Everyone shares a real passion for developing industry leading software!
Salary is flexible up to £65k depending on your experience and you'll also receive a bonus, Pension scheme, generous holiday allowance, non-corporate environment, travel loans and many more. They're a company which is growing at the moment and are looking for the right people with the right attitudes.
If you're interested in the position then please get in touch for more information.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Apply now
We are looking to recruit a Senior Data Engineer.
Location: London Bridge
Salary: £72,550 per annum
Contract type: Full time, permanent
Job reference: REC02063
At the Hyde Group, we see a future that creates a great home for everyone. We are a leading provider of affordable homes. We are doers - professional, ambitious and open. Together, our values reflect an organisation built on a culture of achievement.
As a Senior Data Engineer, you will be responsible for continuously developing new and improved data engineering capabilities. You will take a lead in developing and maintaining data pipelines between systems of record, the data integration platform and the data lake using best practises and within a dataops methodology.
The Senior Data Engineer will ensure a consistency in the approach to maintaining and building all data flows across the organisations data management platform, and that the data is well curated for varying levels of analytics use cases.
Duties of a Senior Data Engineer:
Sole Senior Data Engineer for the engineering team and responsible for operating inside the agreed dataops process.
Work with the Lead and Senior Engineers to leverage data for use in a cross section of analytics use cases, from descriptive to prescriptive analytics.
Own and extend the data pipelines through the collection, storage, processing, and transformation of large data-sets.
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional/non-functional business requirements.
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Ensure that the infrastructure required for optimal integration, extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources is built and maintained.
Collaborate and support the Senior Engineer to define the business's data requirements, which will ensure that the collected data is of a high quality and optimal for use across the business.
Design, develop and maintain solutions to keep data separated and secure across on premise and cloud-based infrastructure and software.
Collaborate with the senior analytics and data team colleagues through the Senior Engineer to analyse and understand data sources, participate in design, and provide insights and guidance on database technology and data modelling best practices.
Design, and develop algorithms for real-time data processing within the business and create the frameworks that enable quick and efficient data acquisition.
Keep track of industry best practices and trends and apply knowledge in order to take advantage of process and system improvement opportunities.
Ensure that Data Governance procedure are well defined and applied through the data engineering team.
Ensure that all development occurs within a CICD approach.
Essential Experience:
The successful candidate will have the following system skills: Confluent, Kafka, Redshift & Clojure.
Candidates must be able to commute to the London Bridge office 2-3 days per week when we reopen.
Guidant is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

title: Head of platform / Head of IT
description:
Apply now
I am looking for a platform manager/DevOps manager/engineering manager for a really existing business based in Manchester. This is a business at the forefront of new technology and is really making huge strides in bio-medicine.
This is a super exciting time to be joining this business, coming away from a recent venture backed investment round and moving into another round of investment in the next 12-18 months!
Please note - Candidates MUST have pharma/biotech/bio-medicine/clinical discovery industry experience to be considered for this role.
I am looking for an exceptional individual to head up the platform development and become a key figure in the businesses growth.
Core stack: Google Cloud Platform, Kubernetes, Docker, Helm, Terraform, Elasticsearch, Python, JavaScript. Also Java, Go, Neo4J
Key responsibilities:
Be responsible for the long-term vision of the infrastructure.
Be engaged in the day to day operations of the platform and work closely with the product manager to ensure customer and user requirements are actualised within the platform.
Lead a talented team of data scientists, back-and front-end engineers to build and maintain a data platform, API and web application, as well as facilitating the provision of data for our professional services work.
Be engaged in continuous infrastructure analysis, optimization and consolidation, following the addition of new features.
Supervise and be engaged in the implementation of CI/CD pipelines for multiple systems across our platform.
Be engaged in automated infrastructure provisioning and post provisioning automation using Terraform.
Be engaged in data engineering practices, continuously optimizing our data pipelines and data warehousing practices.
Oversee and be engaged in efficient development operations that balance service reliability and delivery speeds.
Be a driver of DevOps culture, setting best practices across the company.
Key skills and experience:
Proven track record of at least 7 years professional software delivery with extensive knowledge of software development lifecycle, having built and maintained complex pipelines in various enterprise-level CI and CD software.
Extensive experience with Linux, Python, Java, and Bash.
Experience with Google Cloud Platform and overseeing operations of a cloud computing platform.
Supervising and training junior members of staff, setting best practices, fostering a healthy workplace environment and culture.
Working with the senior management team to continue the company's growth.
Other experience required:
Experience with container and container orchestration technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes, Helm, Terraform, Garden and having designed and implemented Kubernetes-native applications.
Experience with maintaining database and data warehouse technologies. Extensive knowledge of data engineering, such as setting up data pipelines in GCP Dataflow/Dataproc and working with data warehouses such as BigQuery. Familiarity with beam jobs.
Highly skilled in Infrastructure as Code practices, including infrastructure testing and immutable infrastructure.
Serious about automation, building single sources of truth and removing single points of failure.
An eye for up-and-coming technologies and best practices.
Background or strong interest in biological sciences. Knowledge of BioData problems pharmaceutical and biomedical research companies face.
Benefits
Mature platform and technology set-up with a highly competent technical team in place
Fully remote, with the ability to work from home according to your schedule
Share options and competitive salary
Highly motivating work, with the ability to help world leading pharmaceutical and biomedical research companies developing the innovations and treatments of the future.
Be a key figurehead in a venture backed company with an accelerating growth rate and global traction.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Apply now
Senior Data Engineer (AWS)
Cambridge, Cambridgeshire
£60,000-£80,000 per annum
TEC Partners are recruiting exclusively for a Senior Data Engineer to join a well-known tech company based in Cambridge, who are currently going through a large recruitment drive, with over 200 hires planned for this year.
You will be tasked with building a Cloud-based Data and Analytics Platform, able to receive, interpret and feed data back to consumers in real-time. Helping to improve overall customer experience, along with delivering valuable data insights and dashboards. This data is critical to the product teams, so that they can understand what the customers want and where both their enjoyment and pain points are.
You will be working in an exciting and vibrant environment, where you will be engaged in architectural designs, cutting edge technologies, testing and profiling, evaluating software solutions and programming.
How you can contribute:
* Provide technical leadership to drive data products and insight strategy, advocating the effective use of data technologies
* Set the vision for the team and lead the execution of projects, aligning with studio priorities to meet deadlines with clear deliverables
* Ensure reliability and security, liaising with the security team to implement policies through code
* Mentor, lead and manage members of the Data Engineering team; set a quality bar, inspire innovation & creativity and make the vision a reality
* Work with external development teams (2nd, 3rd or contractual) to successfully launch new technical products that provide advanced data science and analytical capabilities
* Build and maintain data pipelines to process diverse data sets at scale and with low latency
* Design, develop, test, launch and manage software packages to support use of data and advanced analytics
* Maintain and extend data and analytics environments to provide additional tools and capabilities
* Develop near real-time and batch-based data processing frameworks
* Push evolution in how we think about analytics, data science and business intelligence that will make them a leader in this space
* Ensure platform availability expectations are met, manage capacity planning and team SLAs
* Participate in all aspects of agile software development and software lifecycle, including high level design, architecture definition, implementation, testing, deployment
* Create software and tooling necessary for build and deployment pipeline automation
* Mentor and couch the other team members
What we need:
* Strong knowledge and experience in AWS Services
* Expert knowledge and experience with big data ecosystems and infrastructure (i.e. Hadoop, Mapreduce, Vertica, Snowflake, etc.)
* Proven history of adopting production related processes, deployment pipelines and reviews
* Expert in Agile, proven experience working with Product Owners to expand user stories into engineering tasks, ensuring development is focused and impactful
* Significant experience in launching new data products that were successful not least due to contributions from Analytics, Data Science and Data Engineering teams, with measurable return
* Experience deploying applications on Kubernetes Clusters
* Deep understanding of design patterns and good code practices
* History of working with senior management on long-term strategic planning and budgetary processes
* Understanding of current & future business needs relative to the gaming and technology industry
* Thorough knowledge of analytics, technology, trends and competitors
* Experience in building strong relationships within a company and empowering your team to do the same
* Proven capabilities as a vision-holder for engineering
Company Benefits:
- Flexible Working
- Bonus Scheme
- Private Health Care
- Gym Membership
- Generous Pension Contributions
- Life Insurance
- Free Cycle Repair
- Income Protection
- Dental Plan
- Free Fruit and Drinks
- Subsidised Canteen
If this sounds like you, then please contact Harry Calvert at TEC Partners and apply below now!

Strong analytical skills, with the ability to adopt a logical approach to solving problems

This is a fantastic opportunity for four Data Engineers to join an award-winning company, where you will work in an innovative and dynamic environment and play a vital part in the company’s transformational journey. For your hard work you will be rewarded with a generous benefits package:
Competitive Salary

title: Data Scientist
description:
Apply Now

Data Scientist
SALARY -                    £35k - £55k (depending on experience) plus excellent benefits
LOCATION -               Remote, then Central London
TEAM
Having built most of the existing Marketing Sciences function, we can vouch for the exceptional quality of talent this marketing agency has managed to attract; not just because of the complexity of data science projects on offer, but also because of the vision of their Marketing Sciences Director. He is extremely energetic and passionate about training and development, and has built a strong culture of collaboration and innovation off the back of this. Every person we’ve placed into the team in the last 2 years, LOVES their job and more importantly, LOVES their team! The work life balance is excellent and there is an adult working environment where you are trusted to deliver and given the freedom to manage your own time.
ROLE
In this role you will apply your data science skills across a variety of cutting edge projects including building recommendation engines, NLP, AI and computer vision, using both supervised and unsupervised machine learning methods.
You will face into (often) global brands to deliver to data science solutions and productionise models, helping the clients better understand their customers and influence their behaviour though advanced analytical techniques.
We want Hackers, Data Scientist leaders who can add value through bleeding edge techniques and methodologies, all whilst applying an acute commercial and strategic lens. I’m afraid to say experience with predictive modelling and segmentation builds is not enough here, we need people who have something a little different about their background. You will possibly have a data engineering edge to your experience, will be highly proficient in cloud based technologies, maybe you’ve used some special analytical techniques such as gravity modelling or catchment analysis, even worked with geospatial data….we want to hear from you!
Advanced programming skills in Python are required, as well as an all-round problem solving approach.

WHATS IN IT FOR ME?

Exceptionally high level of talent – so peer learning is a reality, you will be inspired by your team, not just senior leaders. Although they are pretty awesome too and lead from the front with clear vision, strategy and commitment to genuinely disrupting what a ling standing approach to analytics from marketing agencies alike. Their approach to date has generated incredible clients and a thirst for more and more advanced data science projects – so the best is yet to come and you could be part of that journey. With their rapid growth, there is huge opportunity for promotion and growth, whilst also being able to apply your creativity in solution and product design.
Skills and experience required:
Educated to degree level in a numerate subject; Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, Chemistry, Economics, Machine Learning, Computer Science etc.
A background in data science; (possibly) data engineering, (definitely) machine learning and AI, ideally within a marketing environment
Strong programming experience with either Python AND SQL as a minimum
Intellectual curiosity and a problem solving approach
Ability to engage with senior level client stakeholders to identify and deliver to project briefs
TO APPLY

For further information or to apply please contact:

Kate McDermott  - Managing Consultant @ Blue Pelican Marketing

Share through your LI profile if you’re non-active and simply curious

title: MI/Data Business Analyst
description:
Apply now
My client, a Bank who serves over 200,000 customers across its savings, specialist finance and retail arms, is looking for a MI/Business Analyst to lead their data transformation and support internal customers with the data and insights that underpin their top level of financial product innovation and pace.
The successful MI/Business Analyst will:
Work with the business units to develop a data model, identify improvements and implement and deploy robust, scalable tools
Document and teach best practises for data usage and interpretation
Develop an advanced, automated reporting suite to effect business change
Become an acknowledged expert on the companies' data
Successful candidates will likely:
Have previous experience in a similar role
Have experience with SQL and Power BI
Understand how to work with different stakeholders to deliver on data and insight requests
Be experts in data modelling and data engineering, including modern data schema design and establishment of standard business taxonomies
Be experienced with documentation and specification writing
Some nice-to-haves:
Experience with Azure or other cloud computing software (highly desirable)
Familiarity with core banking - savings, lending and credit products and platforms
Experience of varied software development methodologies, including Agile
Please apply now if you would like to be considered!
Keywords: Management Intelligence, Business Intelligence, SQL, Power BI, Data Visualisation, Analytics, Data Modelling, Reporting, Cloud Computing, Azure, Finance, Banking
Eames Consulting is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

title: Big Data Engineer
description:
Apply now
A permanent opportunity has arisen for a Big Data Engineer to join an organisation as they grow their Data function. You will be joining a fairly new department that has seen excellent growth and are continuing to do so through 2021.
They’re looking for an experienced Data Engineer with a deep understanding and interest of everything data with good software engineering skills. You will be creating data solutions to scale their data on a wide range of projects to support their continued growth.
You will also work with the business to create highly scalable data solutions and pipelines, create workflows to ingest data into their Data Warehouse/Data Lake and consult the business on ways to improve how they’re using their data to improve reliability and quality.

Data Engineering experience with AWS using Athena/Redshift
Knowledge of both relational and non-relational database systems and concepts
Strong ETL experience with AWS Glue, EMR / Spark
Coding experience in Python, Java, Spark-SQL or R
Data modelling experience to visualise data requirements to aid technical design.
The salary for this position is dependent on the individual, as is the remote working arrangements (which is discussed at offer stage). You will also receive a comprehensive benefits package which include shares, pension, life insurance, holidays and more.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:

Senior Data Scientist
