TEAM
Having built most of the existing Marketing Sciences function, we can vouch for the exceptional quality of talent this marketing agency has managed to attract; not just because of the complexity of data science projects on offer, but also because of the vision of their Marketing Sciences Director. He is extremely energetic and passionate about training and development, and has built a strong culture of collaboration and innovation off the back of this. Every person we’ve placed into the team in the last 2 years, LOVES their job and more importantly, LOVES their team! The work life balance is excellent and there is an adult working environment where you are trusted to deliver and given the freedom to manage your own time.
ROLE
In this role you will apply your advanced analytical skills across a variety of cutting edge data science projects including building recommendation engines, NLP, machine learning, AI and computer vision, using both supervised and unsupervised machine learning methods.
You will face into (often) global brands to deliver to data science solutions and productionise models, helping the clients better understand their customers and influence their behaviour though advanced analytical techniques.
We want Hackers, Data Scientist leaders who can add value through bleeding edge techniques and methodologies, all whilst applying an acute commercial and strategic lens. I’m afraid to say experience with predictive modelling and segmentation builds is not enough here, we need people who have something a little different about their background. You will possibly have a data engineering edge to your experience, will be highly proficient in cloud based technologies, maybe you’ve used some special analytical techniques such as gravity modelling or catchment analysis, even worked with geospatial data….we want to hear from you!
Advanced programming skills in Python are required, as well as an all-round problem solving approach.

WHATS IN IT FOR ME?

Exceptionally high level of talent – so peer learning is a reality, you will be inspired by your team, not just senior leaders. Although they are pretty awesome too and lead from the front with clear vision, strategy and commitment to genuinely disrupting what a ling standing approach to analytics from marketing agencies alike. Their approach to date has generated incredible clients and a thirst for more and more advanced data science projects – so the best is yet to come and you could be part of that journey. With their rapid growth, there is huge opportunity for promotion and growth into management, whilst also being able to apply your creativity in solution and product design.
Skills and experience required:
Educated to degree level in a numerate subject; Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, Chemistry, Economics, Machine Learning, Computer Science etc.
A background in data science; (possibly) data engineering, (definitely) machine learning and AI, ideally within a marketing environment
Strong programming experience with either Python AND SQL as a minimum
Ability to gather and scope requirements for a variety of analytical projects
Ability to engage with senior level client stakeholders to identify and deliver to project briefs

Our client is an EMEA leader in decision-making AI products for the Enterprise, with headquarters in London, and offices in Paris, Tunis, Lagos, Dubai and Cape Town. With expertise in both machine intelligence research and practical business deployments, the Company provides a competitive advantage to its partners in an AI-first world. You will also provide pre-sales support to their prospective and returning customers. You will be mobilized to present the Company in Events and Conferences. ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES/ACCOUNTABILITIES

Determine operational feasibility by evaluating analysis, problem definition, requirements, solution development and proposed solutions

Assist with the improvement of the company’s algorithms and approaches. On this note, the company encourages thinking outside the box and to challenge the status quo
REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor's degree and/or Postgraduate qualification in Mathematics or Computer Science
Ability and interest in translating business requirements into technological visions, and reimagining data-processing technologies
Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams and management to collect requirements, identify tasks, provide estimates and meet production deadlines
Detective-level attention to detail and self-discipline
Client facing experience with broad cross-industry knowledge
Good knowledge and experience of Python (or Golang)

Comprehensive experience in Software Development

Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English; French would be a plus.
Preferred:
Understanding of more advanced Machine Learning concepts such as Deep Learning
Familiarity with DevOps and CI/CD concepts
Experience working with Cloud Environments (e.g., GCP, AWS)

title: Cloud Data Developer
description:
Apply now
At Cabot, we pride ourselves on being the best at what we do and we recognise that it’s the people that make the difference to any organisation. So, are you ready for a new challenge?! As we are on the lookout for ­­a Data Engineer to join our Data Engineering department in our dynamic Worthing office.
Not heard of us? Here’s our story:
Cabot Credit Management is a market leader in credit management services. We are an award winning, Investors in People Gold accredited organisation and we are passionate about the ethical treatment of our customers and employees. Our mission is to create pathways to economic freedom and our vision is to make credit accessible by partnering with our consumers to restore their financial health.
Things you should know:
We require a developer in our Data Engineering team to help build new data processes and applications, manage data through the business, develop complex ETL routines, interpret and manipulate data to make it useful across the Cabot Group of businesses. The role will also entail the building and administration of new and existing reports (preferably in Power BI) & analytical datasets for use by key stakeholders in the business.
In the role, you will be using a combination of Power BI, Excel, SQL Server, SSRS and SSIS and Azure as your main tools. You will work with large, complex data sets and will be required to build up your knowledge of the data as well as gaining a good understanding of how the business areas function.
Some of the key responsibilities include:
Building & Maintaining the ETL processes in Azure & on premise.
Assisting the rest of the team with building their understanding of these new processes
Work with customers & project teams to define requirements for new analytical data stores and processes.
Identifying areas for improvement or gaps in existing processes and leading the development of new data capture and processes.
Validating data before use in reporting or analytics and ensuring the integrity of all data used within the reporting suite.
Troubleshoot and investigate anomalies.
Working with the other teams and businesses within the Cabot group to deliver objectives and ensure delivery on time and to a high standard.
Updating your sprint items to ensure the accurate documentation of progress on solutions.
The fun facts:
Not only are we offering a competitive salary of £30-40k and a fantastic bonus scheme, you will also be entitled to loads of great benefits such as gym membership subsidy, discount and cash back on hundreds of high-street shops, healthcare cash back plan, travel insurance, pension, 23 days holiday, plus much, much more.
Things we need from you:
The most important part for any applicant is that they have the technical skills and the mindset to look beyond the obvious, own their own work and work independently. Key needs are strong SQL, Power BI & Azure data processing, investigative skills, some level of design capability, the desire to understand what people need and the ability to deliver it. A can do attitude is a must.
Other key requirements include:
Demonstratable experience in using Azure Portal to build & manage resources such as Azure databases, Data Factories and Pipelines to move, transform and analyse data from on-premise data to the cloud.
Good knowledge of T-SQL, SQL Server, SSIS and SSRS
Power BI (preferable)
Working knowledge of object-oriented languages (preferable)
Experience of turning customer needs and concepts into automated MI processes or reports
Experience of automating reports, including data extraction, transformation/manipulation, summarisation and delivery.
Logical troubleshooting expertise
SQL Performance Tuning
What happens next?
If this sounds like you and if you would like to join our rapidly expanding company that offers excellent career progression, then we would love to hear from you! We are looking for people to interview via video and join us asap.
Diversity and inclusion are very important to us at Cabot and we value a multitude of diverse talent within our business. We want everyone to be themselves at work and encourage a culture that includes everyone. Our policies ensure that every candidate and employee are treated fairly and with equal opportunities.

title: Enterprise Data Engineer
description:
Apply on employer's website
Enterprise Data Engineer
SALARY Circa £42,000
Location: Lincoln/Huntingdon/Flexible working
Employment type Permanent
Hours 37 hours per week
Do you have prior experience of Data Engineering, dimensional modelling?
Do you have experience of working within an Agile environment or are keen to work in one?
Do you like to always explore, learn, challenge yourself and are a good team player?
If you can answer yes to the above we have an exciting opportunity for you with our expanding team!
Team overview
The Data and Digital Services team will transform the way data and digital services are provided in Anglian Water, moving from an order-taker service to a trusted, informed partner. The data service will go beyond the traditional data warehouse to provide a modern business intelligence capability that supports distributed (crowd-sourced) reporting and analytics, allowing business SMEs and data and analytics SMEs to work hand in hand to deliver insight to drive business performance. The team will keep the BI service in step with emerging technologies and practices to ensure their activities continue to align to externally recognised best practices.
What will my role involve?
The Enterprise Data Engineer is a T-shaped professional (also referred to as a generalised specialist) with identifiable core skills yet with an ability to work across multiple disciplines (both technical and non-technical) as required.
The Enterprise Data Engineer whilst having core skills to enable them to deliver data and analytical solutions on our analytics and BIG data platform, you will also act as a technical expert in all aspects of delivery and provide leadership and guidance to small project teams/resources in a collaborative way.
You will be expected to work in Agile/Scrum environment in a squad model consisting of various other developers. You may be expected to work as lead on the squad and/or fulfil other roles within the squad.
The Enterprise Data Engineer will have the core skills to be able to carry out following activities
Actively contribute to work estimation
Adopt and embed agile development and continuous improvement into team ways of working
Support the on boarding of new team members & coach other Data Engineers
Actively contribute to drafting and updating our service policies, procedures, work instructions and guidance notes.
As a BI Solution Architect/Dimensional Modeller, design robust, secure and supportable corporate data solutions to meet business requirements following dimensional modelling methodology, considering privacy by design and self-service capabilities by default.
As an ETL Developer, develop, test and/or quality assure extracts of data from corporate systems into the Data Lake
As a Semantic Layer Developer, develop, test and/or quality assure semantic models

Experience in delivering end to end BI solution from requirements, design to delivery
Experience of working within an Agile/Scrum environment
Experience/understanding of Product lifecycle management
Knowledge of Azure DevOps or similar tools
As a valued employee, you'll be entitled to:
Personal private health care
26 days annual leave - rising with length of service
Flexible working
Pension scheme - Anglian Water double-matches your contributions up to 6%
Bonus scheme
Flexible benefits to support your wellbeing and lifestyle.

Our OT team is currently undergoing a transformation which will enhance the services it delivers and ensure they are best positioned to play a proactive and value orientated role across our business. Our goal is to exceed customer expectations whilst embracing new technology to drive digital transformation; better connecting our customers, people, assets and information

The company is currently able to offer a remote interview and onboarding process as well as fulltime work from home; following social distancing measures you'll join colleagues in the Canary Wharf office with some continued flexibility going forward.

There's perks such as the latest MacBook Pro, licenses to any software you want to use, training and personal improvement budget and when you are in the office, fresh fruit daily, breakfast, snacks, in-house bar open on Fridays and an annual company retreat.

*Strong data engineering experience using Python
*Good knowledge of ETL and Data APIs
*Experience with Cloud technologies, Google Cloud Platform GCP preferred but AWS also considered
*Good knowledge of relational and non-relational databases e.g. SQL, PostgreSQL, MySQL
*Understanding of how to best organise and model data for storage, retrieval and analysis
*Experience of working with software development teams
*Excellent communication and collaboration skills

As a Data Engineer you will earn a competitive salary (to £85k) plus benefits including an annual bonus, generous holiday allowance, private medical insurance and subsidised gym membership.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Apply now
SENIOR DATA ENGINEER

A leading General Insurance company based in the City of London is looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join their Actuarial Department and manage junior Data Engineers.
You will lead the build and enhancement of data driven products that support the provision of data analytics and insight in respect of pricing, risk selection, portfolio management and reserving of insurance products.

PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES:

Data Infrastructure

- To be responsible for setting the direction of the development and maintenance of the Actuarial data architecture
- To oversee the development of new and existing data models
- To oversee the investigation and lead resolution of emerging issues
- To ensure all Actuarial data systems and models are documented in line with departmental standards

Data Ingestion

- To lead the investigation of opportunities to extract data from non-standard sources (e.g. external, unstructured) as required to enhance pricing and portfolio management decisions for the business
- To integrate new data sources into the data library including structuring and validation.

Data Visualisation

- To oversee the development of data visualisations and dashboards ensuring they meet business requirements and user needs.

Development and Best Practices

- Identify opportunities to use data science/engineering techniques to extract value from internal/external data assets in order to enrich analytical capabilities
- Lead the definition of data engineering best practice and standards and ensure consistency of delivery across the team

Other

- Mentoring and coaching other members of the team
- Recommend ways to improve data efficiency and reliability
- To investigate new tools that would help store, structure and analyse data.
- Actively share knowledge and best practices with the wider Actuarial team and other data-focussed functions
- Increase the degree of automation within data systems and tools

REQUIREMENTS:

- Experience working within Insurance company with exposure to actuarial data.
- Knowledge of MI Systems and BI software (e.g. SQL Server, SSIS, Alteryx, Power BI etc.)
- Proven experience of designing, implementing and optimising database structures
- Excellent knowledge of SQL (or other similar languages), Visual Studio, R, Python etc.
- Experience with cloud technologies (Azure preferably)
- Ability to mentor and manage junior team members
- Ability to write deliverables and reports in a clear and appropriate way and be able to communicate them
- Relevant, numerate degree with a good overall grade.

Experience in both Python and Django/Flask
Experience writing automated tests/TDD

Experience with CI/CD

Based locally to Newcastle upon Tyne and commutable from surrounding areas including Sunderland, Durham and Northumberland and surrounding areas.
Genuine market leading organisation, they pride themselves on innovation and good customer experience. With sustained successes and a growing business model it is a good time to join.

Data engineering including integration, configuration and deployment of software applications
Project engineering on a wide variety of electrical and power system automation projects
Control and direct all phases of a project from conceptual design, to detailed engineering specification and full functional testing
Communicate with sub-contractors regularly
Prepare and present comprehensive and high-quality project documentation
System testing not limited to commissioning, factory and site acceptance
Provide after-sales and on-site support
Profile
The successful Project Systems Engineer will come from within industry - which may be substations, smart grid solutions, power distribution, electricity transmission etc. The successful candidate will bring:
Minimum 2/3 years engineering experience
IT/Software/SCADA/HMI's knowledge
Automation exp
LV/MV/HV knowledge
Project life-cycle management
Customer/sub con communication exp and stakeholder management
Job Offer
Competitive Salary up to £45,000 DOE of successful Project Systems Engineer
Newcastle upon Tyne location with good transport links to surrounding areas via car or locally for public transport
Flexible / Dynamic Working available

title: Senior Data Analyst - Oxford
advertiser: Give A Grad A Go Ltd
description:

Great opportunities for progression

title: Enterprise Architect (Data)
description:
Apply now
Enterprise Architect
Salary: £90,000 - £105,000
Location: Hertfordshire / London (80% remote)
Benefits: Bonus, Share Scheme, 25 days holiday
Are you an Enterprise Architect with well-defined Data experience?
Want to own the Data Architecture domain within a 200 million user business?
Keen to work for a company on a mission to become the world's leading data-driven company in their sector?
Interested in working within a highly collaborative business and team?
Want an environment that allows you to push the boundaries without corporate politics that slow you down?
Company:
This client is an ecommerce giant and one of the largest of their kind in the world with over 9,000 employees. They have systems that are used by over 200 million people a year and been making significant investments into Data & Analytics platforms. Their aim is to become the leading data-driven business within their niche.
Role:
Work closely with various functions including; data engineering, enterprise integration, data management, data analytics and data science
Take responsibility for shaping and managing future technology architecture with a primary focus on enterprise Data / Big Data & Integration domains.
Act as the Integration & Data expert within the Enterprise Architecture function leading on initiatives such as Real-Time & batch integration methods/services & API practices, data lakes & data warehousing/BI, data quality and management etc.
Develop and maintain alignment with enterprise architecture principles, standards, patterns
Contribute to the development of the technology strategy and architectural policy within assigned domains and company wide
Build and eventually maintain capability and technology roadmaps that define how Integration and Data platforms are kept relevant and deliver optimal value for the client
Requirements:
Extensive enterprise architecture skills, particularly in aligning strategic business requirements and the IT architectures & roadmaps needed to deliver against them
Expertise in data & integration architecture including topics such as service-orientation, APIs, event-driven architectures, batch data integration, data lakes, 'data fabric’, data warehousing, data management etc.
Familiarity with patterns, practices and frameworks of Enterprise Architecture.
Strong knowledge of big data platforms - namely Hadoop, Cloudera & Informatica, through to emerging areas such as real-time data streaming and ingestion via Spark and Kafka.
Experience in presenting high-level technical architecture and strategy to both and IT and business audience.

title: Data Engineer - up to £90k
description:
Apply now
Caspian one is working an emerging FinTech, who are currently expanding exceptionally and heavily backed by Tier 1 Banks and Financial institutions. Great learning opportunity to work with Investment banking, hedge Fund, as well Tech giant staff. Due to it's innovative product, but expanding quickly they are looking for a balance in people who can drive future proof architecture and structure. They are now looking for a Data Engineer to join our Data Engineering and Analytics team.
The role will be responsible for expanding and optimising our data pipelines with the intent of enabling cross functional teams to make data driven decisions. The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimising data systems and building them from the ground up.
Responsibilities:
Create and maintain data pipelines
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet product and business requirements.
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimising data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources (MongoDb, MySQL, Spanner, etc).
Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics.
Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
Requirements:
We are looking for a candidate with 5+ years of experience in a Data Engineer role, who has attained an degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field.
Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, complex query authoring (SQL) as well as a solid familiarity with a variety of SQL databases (Postgres, MySQL)
Good experience with No-SQL databases: Mongo, Cassandra
Experience building and optimizing big data' data pipelines, architectures and data sets and associated tooling: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, etc.
Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable big data' data stores/warehouses.
Experience with AWS cloud services: EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift

title: Data Analyst
description:
Apply now
Tableau, SQL, Data Analyst
Data Analyst
My client, an industry leading Professional Services company, is looking for a Data Analyst with strong Tableau and SQL skills to join their growing team.
You will be responsible for supporting the Insight Manager and Data Engineers with delivery of actionable insight on the back of Data Analysis you conduct. You would be involved in the optimisation, development & implementation of databases, data analytics, but will not get involved in the ETL / Data Engineering side - that is for another team. Your role will be to make sense of that data and tell a story to a Data Led organisation to help them improve how they operate across multiple areas of the organisation.
This is a role that requires great communication skills to engage with the business and stakeholders, in addition to strong Technical skills.
Because of the various databases, you would need to have strong SQL skills to interrogate the database
This will be put to the test during the interview process.
Whilst they also use Alteryx, the greater flexibility or SQL will be utilised more in future, so Alteryx is only a nice to have.
The first 6 months will be spent sorting out their current Tableau dashboards in operation (there are many that overlap, and are difficult to maintain, so must be streamlined to increase impact).
The key thing with this role is that you need Dashboarding skills, but also the ability to tell a story using data, and demonstrate actioned insight you have offered previous places of work.
It is critical that you have demonstrable examples of your Tableau dashboards to share in interview - either a portfolio or screenshots, as the design and presentation of data is very important in this position.
Whilst you would obviously be working from home in the short term, longer term they would like you to still interact personally with the stakeholders in the business, and so would need to be in around 3 days a week in the office - based in Central London, so remote workers are not encouraged to apply.
If you are keen to work in a stable and secure organisation that has some great data to work with then please get in touch ASAP with your CV and portfolio (for your dashboards).
Many thanks
Boston Hale
Tableau, SQL, Data Analyst

title: Data Scientist - BI / Python / Maths or Stats / Machine Learning / London Team
description:
Apply now
My client is a world leading Data science Consultancy - they have new requirement for a Data Scientist .
You will be working with the leading Location Intelligence team across the world, responsible for delivering advanced spatial analysis and insight to major organisations across a range of sectors and countries. We provide consultancy, cutting edge software and the latest data to help our clients optimise their location strategies across both the physical and digital landscape. Projects typically last between a week and 6 months, ranging from performance analysis, customer insight, defining network strategies, BI & visualisation and advanced predictive modelling.
We are looking for a data scientist with up to 5 years’ experience, to work within our Location Intelligence technical team. It is a dynamic and sociable team that are looking for a self-motivated person with a willingness to learn new skills and who is comfortable receiving a high level of responsibility from day one. Within the wider Location Intelligence team, we work with companies from a broad range of sectors, both within the UK and internationally, including retail, leisure, grocery, automotive and the public sector.
We are looking for a problem solver, who can come up with creative solutions to our clients’ problems and help to drive innovation and efficiency within the team.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE
Taking on deep-dive analysis of data and generate new business insights with the development of predictive models
Helping to create and deliver a wide range of bespoke projects and tools using a variety of different environments, languages and techniques
Developing our analytical capabilities, researching related technologies and approaches, enabling other areas of the group
Playing a part in owning and maintaining the underlying processes and infrastructure we are building to support the day-to-day work
CORE SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE REQUIRED
A degree in a numerate discipline and strong understanding of statistics
Familiar with programming languages (e.g. R, Python) and experience with, learning to write and maintain programming code and database scripts
Knowledge and experience building spatial and non-spatial predictive models in real-world applications.
Can demonstrate skills in algorithm development, data manipulation and visualisation
Familiar with analytics and business intelligence platforms (e.g. Alteryx, Tableau, Power BI, QlikView/Sense)
You are a self-starter, creative and willing to challenge the status quo
Demonstrate an intellectual curiosity and passion for learning data science, exploring the fields of data engineering and machine learning

description:

My client offers an excellent flexible working policy including working from home. As a Senior Business Intelligence Developer, you will be building dataflows into a data lake & data warehouse from a wide range of sources as well as helping to steer the development of efficient data structures that will enable sophisticated analysis and data science
Experience required:
Work with ETL tools such as SQL, SSIS, AWS, Snowflake, etc.
Microsoft BI stack, including SSIS, SQL Server and Power BI

Experience with visualisation development using tools like Power BI is a must

- Build containers for data model endpoints
- Ensure that appropriate data quality, integrity and alerting is built into all solutions while building containers for data model endpoints
- Work with an AWS-based BI stack, including Lambda, Redshift, Snowflake etc as well as the Microsoft BI Stack
- Work in an Agile Kanban environment & assist with managing the DevOps processes for Data, and any tooling that guides the processes
- Contribute to the architecture of the data warehouse and data lake
My client is offering a starting salary of between £55,000 - £75,000 + Benefits including home working.

Remote

HOW TO APPLY

Please note that our client is currently running a fully remote interview process and able to on-board and hire remotely as well. This role is intended to be home working for the duration of the pandemic.

title: Technical Data Analyst Python BI
description:
Apply now
Technical Data Analyst (Python BI Monday.com). Are you a tech savvy business focussed Data Analyst with Python coding skills seeking a challenging role where you can work with a great deal of autonomy? You could be joining a global games software house and progressing your career in a diverse team environment.

As a Technical Data Analyst you will take ownership of internal software production data analysis; you'll partner with stakeholders to define their requirements and then build the tools to extract the data required and present it a digestible format. You'll create predictive models around estimations, valuations and other performance criteria, working with data coming from the Amazon Redshift Data Warehouse to analyse and report on inter-dependencies between agile delivery projects. You will create dashboards and alerts to identify bottlenecks and software to automate the presentation of delivery performance data via tools such as SharePoint, Intranet and Monday.com.

In this Technical Data Analyst role you'll be collaborating with senior stakeholders and proactively analysing data to answer the queries, developing statistical models to gain insights into trends and patterns.

Driven by technology this company can offer a remote interview / onboarding process and work from home during the current social distancing measures; thereafter you'll be based in awesome offices in Central London with a wide range of facilities and some flexibility to work from home for part of the week.

Requirements:
*Strong data engineering / analysis experience
*Strong Python coding ability
*Good knowledge of SQL and BI tools such as Tableau
*Experience of building big data models, scenario analysis and sensitivity analysis
*Strong analysis and problem solving skills with meticulous attention to detail
*Excellent written and verbal communication skills, collaborative

As a Technical Data Analyst you will earn a competitive salary (to £65k) plus bonus and benefits.

Apply now or call to find out more about this Technical Data Analyst opportunity.

title: Junior Model Engineer
description:
Apply now
QuantSpark is an innovative boutique strategic analytics consultancy based in London. Our hybrid team combines the best of strategy consulting, data analytics and product development to deliver creative and impactful solutions to public and private sector clients. We go beyond the remit of traditional strategy consultancies by deploying advanced data analytics and software engineering capabilities to build bespoke tools that deliver long-lasting value - the tools and solutions we create become embedded in our clients' daily operations. Our ever-growing client base consists of FTSE 100 retailers, prestigious Private Equity houses and governments.
Some of our recent modelling and development work includes:
Analysing 1bn+ annual transactions to build a tool for a UK supermarket to help them decide how much space to allocate to their 1,500+ stores
Developing an ROI system to understand effectiveness of £5m+ of social media advertising campaigns
Building an automated marketing segmentation model to nudge millions of customers
Developing terrorist content algorithms to detect propaganda and work with internet platforms to tackle this content
Creating automated dashboards to help a private equity fund understand the performance of its B2C portfolio companies
Developing a location intelligence model to inform social impact communications campaigns
As a Model Engineer at QuantSpark, you will utilise data science and software development to ideate, implement and improve complex models of extensive commercial data. Our small team of Model Engineers work in close collaboration with Analysts and Software Developers to create world-leading bespoke tools to super-charge our client's predictive capabilities. The ideal candidate will have a background in a quantitative or technical discipline and will have experience in using programming languages to work with large data sets.
Requirements
Essential:
Demonstrable proficiency in Python or a similar programming language
Bachelors degree in a quantitative subject or equivalent qualification/relevant work experience
Experience manipulating and analysing large datasets using packages such as pandas, numpy and scipy (or similar packages in other languages)
Familiarity with data engineering processes and concepts with background in writing SQL
Prior collaboration with analysts and developers in an Agile team
Some competence with Linux based operating systems with a knowledge of Bash
Beneficial to have:
Experience in implementing machine learning methods
Involvement in developing and optimising bespoke algorithms in commercial settings
Exposure to working with clients within a consultancy or strategy / analytics position
Understanding of modern web applications and their architectures
Benefits
Social impact / pro bono data science and development projects
£40-55k salary (based on experience)
Monthly training & conference budget
25 days holiday, plus Bank Holidays
Pension contribution scheme
Cycle to work scheme

title: Software Engineer
description:
Apply now
bigspark, a boutique consultancy with a focus on exciting technologies including Apache Spark, Apache Kafka and working on projects within Machine Learning, Data Engineering and Streaming are looking for software engineers to join the team with skills in either Java, Scala, Python.
We provide the backbone for modern analytics to our clients through our expertise in DevOps, distributed computing, machine learning and adoption of proven open source projects. bigspark specialise in backend development, infrastructure automation and performance engineering for data workloads at scale.
Typical duties:
Interacting with senior stakeholders and program management to understand client requirements
Solution Design - Using predefined architectural components to agree an acceptable design
Lead the delivery of software development on client site, often managing team members across the globe with varying skill levels
Warranty support post-delivery (normally 1-2 months)
Skills, experience and qualifications:
Educated to at least BSc (Hons) level - preferably in Computer Science, Mathematics or Physics
At least 2 years in a commercial software environment
Big data stack experience - Hadoop, Spark, Hive/Impala, Kafka
Proficiency in object-oriented programming languages (C#, Java, Python, Scala).
Experience with database integrations (SQL/NoSQL) and processing data at scale
Understanding of source control management e.g. GitHub
Experience in use of CI tools (Jenkins) or an understanding of their role
Flexible in learning and working with new technologies
For Streaming Engineers we would also expect:
Deep knowledge of Apache Kafka
Knowledge of Streamsets Data Collector, Transformer and Control Hub or equivalent tooling (e.g. Apache NiFi)
For Machine Learning Engineers we would also expect:
Proficiency in Machine Learning Frameworks
Spark ML including both batch and structured streaming
Python ML e.g. scikitlearn, shap, lightGBM/XGBoost and underlying mathematical theories
In return you will receive:
Top end equipment - MacBook pro, 21 inch LED screen
Certified training: 1) 2 mandatory certifications in the first 6 months and 2) Elective tracks of training thereafter in preferred topics
Competitive salary and benefits
Exposure to cutting edge technologies and open source projects

COVID-19 considerations:
Fully remote, anticipate time on client site when offices reopen
Sounds interesting? Click APPLY to send your CV for immediate consideration.
Candidates with previous experience and job titles including; .NET Developer, SQL Engineer, SQL Developer, Junior Software Engineer, Junior Developer, Senior Software Developer, Senior Software Engineer, C#, VB, ASP, Software Development, Software Engineering, sql, python, java, scala, kafka, hadoop, apache, Python Applications Developer, Python Developer, Software Engineering, Python Software Developer, Javascript, Applications Developer, Django Engineer, Python Engineer, Software Engineer, Senior Developer, Lead Developer may also be considered for this role.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Apply on employer's website
Enterprise Data Engineer
SALARY £42,000
Location: Lincoln/Huntingdon/Flexible working
Employment type Permanent
Hours 37 hours per week
Do you have prior experience of Data Engineering, dimensional modelling?
Do you have experience of working within an Agile environment or are keen to work in one?
Do you like to always explore, learn, challenge yourself and are a good team player?
If you can answer yes to the above we have an exciting opportunity for you with our expanding team!
Team overview
The Data and Digital Services team will transform the way data and digital services are provided in Anglian Water, moving from an order-taker service to a trusted, informed partner. The data service will go beyond the traditional data warehouse to provide a modern business intelligence capability that supports distributed (crowd-sourced) reporting and analytics, allowing business SMEs and data and analytics SMEs to work hand in hand to deliver insight to drive business performance. The team will keep the BI service in step with emerging technologies and practices to ensure their activities continue to align to externally recognised best practices.
What will my role involve?
The Enterprise Data Engineer is a T-shaped professional (also referred to as a generalised specialist) with identifiable core skills yet with an ability to work across multiple disciplines (both technical and non-technical) as required.
The Enterprise Data Engineer whilst having core skills to enable them to deliver data and analytical solutions on our analytics and BIG data platform, you will also act as a technical expert in all aspects of delivery and provide leadership and guidance to small project teams/resources in a collaborative way.
You will be expected to work in Agile/Scrum environment in a squad model consisting of various other developers. You may be expected to work as lead on the squad and/or fulfil other roles within the squad.
The Enterprise Data Engineer will have the core skills to be able to carry out following activities
Actively contribute to work estimation
Adopt and embed agile development and continuous improvement into team ways of working
Support the on boarding of new team members & coach other Data Engineers
Actively contribute to drafting and updating our service policies, procedures, work instructions and guidance notes.
As a BI Solution Architect/Dimensional Modeller, design robust, secure and supportable corporate data solutions to meet business requirements following dimensional modelling methodology, considering privacy by design and self-service capabilities by default.
As an ETL Developer, develop, test and/or quality assure extracts of data from corporate systems into the Data Lake
As a Semantic Layer Developer, develop, test and/or quality assure semantic models
As a Report Developer, develop, test and/or quality assure reports, visualisations and dashboards, producing lo-fi and hi-fi wireframes and capturing purpose.
As a Test Automation Specialist, responsible for building new automated test frameworks, for developing test harnesses for each component and be responsible for raising the overall test coverage across the project. would work with each squad to ensure the culture of automated testing is embraced and that any technical challenges are resolved. These processes are essential to building robust delivery pipelines if the solution is to adopt modern DevOps processes.
What does it take to be a Data Engineer?
Previous experience in data engineering ideally using Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Spark, Python, SQL, Cosmos DB, Microsoft Azure Analysis services, PowerBI
Dimensional and relational data modelling
Experience in delivering end to end BI solution from requirements, design to delivery
Experience of working within an Agile/Scrum environment
Experience/understanding of Product lifecycle management
Knowledge of Azure DevOps or similar tools
As a valued employee, you'll be entitled to:
Personal private health care
26 days annual leave - rising with length of service
Flexible working
Pension scheme - Anglian Water double-matches your contributions up to 6%
Bonus scheme
Flexible benefits to support your wellbeing and lifestyle.
As our region flourishes it is our priority to support our economy, customers and communities; driving sustainable growth and building resilience across our services. We recently announced plans to invest £6.5 billion to protect our regions water supplies over the coming years.
Our OT team is currently undergoing a transformation which will enhance the services it delivers and ensure they are best positioned to play a proactive and value orientated role across our business. Our goal is to exceed customer expectations whilst embracing new technology to drive digital transformation; better connecting our customers, people, assets and information
Closing Date: 18 February
Interviews: 24 & 25th February

title: Data Engineer
description:
Apply now
DATA ENGINEER
An award-winning technology company is looking for a Data Engineer to join their fast-paced, exciting organisation. The job is remote with the occasional day spent in the Gloucester office. Their breakthrough technology offers an innovative platform for customers.
ABOUT THE ROLE
As a Data Engineer, you will help design, document, build, maintain, and improve the next generation of data lead technology solutions. With a sound knowledge of Data Engineering, you will be creating and utilising the latest and best technologies to provide an optimum service for customers and be a key contributor to the technology roadmap.
BENEFITS
With the success of their innovative solution, they are looking to expand globally. Don’t miss out on being a part of a fast-moving tech environment and flourish in this start-up business. You’ll have a great work-life balance with 28 days holiday (plus bank holidays)!
RESPONSIBILITIES
As a Data Engineer your key duties will include:
Guiding the data architecture strategy; identifying and implementing opportunities to better link various data sources, with suppliers and partners, with the UK and abroad
Collaborating with teams to build integrations ensuring multiple systems can interface seamlessly
Preparing and implementing plans for ETL (extract, transform, and load) procedures and architectures
Developing and maintaining dashboards and reports to provide performance insights
Developing data models to enable end users to effectively analyse data
Monitoring and tuning data loads and queries to ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness
Analysing large databases and implementing appropriate optimisation
Taking a brief and turning it into a technical plan and functional specification
Demonstrating your code and solutions work with 'show and tells’ and documented repeatable tests
Working with the development team to maintain and improve the CI/CD pipeline
Contributing to the future technology road map with new ideas, tools and techniques
Maintaining the core AWS service and applying best practices
REQUIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
To be considered for the role of Data Engineer, you must have:
Experience managing a data warehouse and directing the improvement of data management and expansion across multiple geographic zones
Experience of Agile development, CI/CD pipeline, DevOps, Git and version control best practices
Proficiency in SQL including a solid understanding of how to optimise query performance
Python coding skills including knowledge of Jupyter notebooks and AWS SageMaker
Experience developing APIs and managing environments including:
SQL databases: MySQL, Athena, MSSQL, PostgreSQL
Data Lake storage solutions: S3, AWS Glue, Athena
AWS data solutions: Glue, Athena, Redshift, QuickSight, Lambda, EC2, RDS
NEXT STEPS
If you’re interested in becoming a Data Engineer, apply today with your current CV. Our team will review your application to see if it’s a match and get in touch to learn more about you. If you aren't contacted within 7 days, please assume your application was not selected.
Why wait? Don’t miss out!

title: C# Application Developer
description:
Apply now
Incredibly diverse project base working with household names.
Outstanding team culture, small team with lots of progression.
Full remote for good!

We’re helping a data-led marketing agency who work with some seriously impressive brands to find an Application Developer to join their delivery team. This role is fully remote though their HQ is in Scotland, and they also have an office in Bristol should you want to be surrounded by a team. Boasting some huge household names as part of their client base, this role sits in a small but growing team alongside a talented bunch of Data Engineering, Tech Support and Project Delivery specialists. If you’re a developer with a passion for data, I want to hear from you!

What skills you’ll need

Commercial C# experience and understanding of the wider MS stack. Any knowledge of Python would be useful.
Knowledge of at least one cloud platform, preferably Azure/AWS but open to Google too.
Preference for back-end development, appreciation for the importance of data.
Ability to test your own work.
Significant awareness of SQL.
Experience with Git/TFS source control and Agile.
Solid communication skills, comfortable being in a client-facing environment.
What you’ll be doing

This role sits in the business’ delivery team. You’d be working alongside their Senior App Developer to create a variety of applications which support the delivery of solutions to an impressive client base of household names. The role leans much more to the back-end with most projects being cloud-based on AWS, though they’re happy to cross-train from a different platform if needed. The business is data-led in their approach so lots of the project work will be centred on data development, involved in high-level data pipelines and insight. Being an agency-style environment you could be working on several projects concurrently so you’ll need to bring an adaptable mindset that will allow you to jump between different tech and styles of development on a regular basis. The client base is spread across various industries including POS, Print, Automotive, TV and more. There is ambitious growth plans in place so you could certainly look to progress into a more senior role quite quickly.

What you’ll get in return for your talents

On top of a competitive salary and rapid scope for progression, this role offers 100% remote working with an occasional trip to the office, and if you’d prefer to be in an office you can work out of either of their Edinburgh or Bristol offices! They work with a global client base of seriously impressive household brands which will only support you to become more versatile as a Developer moving forward. Diverse team, multiple opportunities for R&D, constant variety and change. What’s not to love!

What's next?

Like the sound of this one? Drop Joe a message now to find out more!

title: Head of / Director of Digital Analytics
description:
Apply now
Director of Digital Analytics – London
We are proud to be partnering with a global digital agency whose comprehensive, multi-channel service offering places them in a unique position in the market. The agency are fast-growing, with ambitious plans. They have an innovative and unique way of working, which keeps every day fresh and exciting.
As Director of Digital Analytics you will be leading innovative strategies and solutions for a variety of high profile, globally recognised brands. As part of the Data Solutions leadership team you will play a pivotal role in driving performance on a variety of projects, along with leading and developing the team.
The Digital Analytics team have a focus across measurement and effectiveness , providing in-depth analysis and innovative techniques for the collection of data and ways to understand the customer.
You would act as the lead within the Digital Analytics team with peers across Data Visualisation, Adtech, Ad Ops, Data Engineering and Data Science.
The team are currently working remotely due to COVID. Moving forward, this role will be office based, offering flexibility with days working from home etc.

Owning and managing client relationships providing quality data and analytics strategies
Expand and develop the agency’s analytics proposition by spotting opportunities within existing projects/clients
Manage all aspects of team performance including P&L responsibility
Nurturing and developing junior talent within the team
Work collaboratively with the wider analytics team to ensure data solutions remains at the heart of the agency’s offering

Strong knowledge and experience within a digitally focused setting
Advanced knowledge of Google Analytics (360 and ideally GA 4) – this is essential, the successful candidate will be a GA whizz!! Including GTM.
Advanced customer GA implementation across website and app
Expert on data collection techniques and audience data/insight
Advanced marketing effectiveness analytics and attribution models / metrics
Knowledge of Google Cloud Platform and SQL with BigQuery would be particularly advantageous.
Python or R experience would be advantageous but not essential
Firebase experience would be desirable but not essential
Understanding of HTML, CSS and JavaScript
If you are interested in this opportunity, please get in touch with Sophie on or email

title: Data and Analytics Delivery Manager
advertiser: Anson McCade Ltd - IT and Finance Recruitment
description:
Apply now
Data and Analytics Delivery Manager

Join one of the world's most recognised professional services firms working on an interesting variety of transformational client projects
As a firm we strongly believe in developing talent through meaningful and challenging opportunities
You'll get a fantastic package including a strong pension, £6,000 cash fund, a bonus, healthcare and more

title: Business Intelligence Developer BI Developer
description:
Apply now
Business Intelligence Developer (BI Developer)
Remote
Up to £55,000 + bonus + benefits
If you are looking for a role with a thriving tech company - one of the world's largest within their niche - as their first BI Developer in the UK, prior to a migration to AWS…
…which is not for the faint-hearted…
...then keep reading.
You will be working with teams internationally on their SQL Server data warehouse, whilst working with the wider business to develop Power BI dashboards to improve efficiency and the delivery of their tech product. In addition to this, they are about to start an exciting cloud migration across to AWS. This role will be a remote role, with occasional travel into their offices.
THE ROLE - BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE DEVELOPER (BI DEVELOPER):
* Becoming the fourth hire within a rapidly-growing BI team, working alongside strong Data Science & Data Engineering teams, and central to the business' plan for 2021 and beyond;
* Working on a brand-wide cloud migration to AWS
* Working on SSIS data integration, as well as data visualisation
* Responding to a variety of ad-hoc BI requests from different functions of the business.
YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
To qualify for this Business Intelligence Developer (BI Developer) role, you must have:
* Extensive experience of data integration using SSIS, as well as reporting using SSRS
* Experience developing data visualisations using Power BI (Tableau or Qlikview will also suffice)
* Strong stakeholder management skills, with a personable, communicative manner, and a desire to work in a tight-knit team.
HOW TO APPLY:
To apply, please do so via this site. For more information, reach out to Femi Akintoye at Oscar Technology.
KEYWORDS:
Business Intelligence, BI, Tableau, Qlikview, Power BI, AWS, GCP, Azure, SQL Server, SSMS, SQL, SSIS, SSRS, T-SQL

description:
Apply now
SENIOR DATA ENGINEER (PYTHON)
£75,000-£85,000 + BENEFITS
LONDON
Are you a Senior Data Engineer wanting to work in a data led company? Want to work on a Python and big data engineering team? This Data Engineer position offers the opportunity to work on cutting edge big data projects across technologies such as AWS, SQL and Spark.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Apply now
Data Engineer

Data Engineer required for a fast growing and forward-thinking Consultancy as they continue to win new and interesting data projects.

Your new role …
You'll be joining a really talented team of Data Engineers, Scientists, Architects and a wider team of Product Mangers, Software Engineers and Consultants.
No need to be worried about this being another Data Engineering role with no interesting projects, or even worse no data! The team have plenty of work to be getting on with and as they are a Consultancy and trusted partner across a variety of industries, you will have the chance to be involved in an array of work.

You …
You'll be well versed as a Data Engineer, ideally having worked in a customer or business facing role before. A huge part of this role will be talking to a selection of stakeholders from super technical to complete non-techies. You need to be able to explain your solutions to both seamlessly.
I won't patronise you here by saying you'll need experience of Python or SQL- you're a data engineer after all …
An appreciation of various cloud providers would be pretty beneficial though as they work in various environments depending on the customer with a recent push in GCP projects, but as you'd expect plenty of Azure and AWS work as well. A certification in one or more of these would be a bit of a cherry on top.

The company …
A boutique data consultancy within a larger organisation, delivering some impressive and complex projects in various sectors.
You will have the opportunity to progress your career with well defined bandings and regular feedback.
The Senior Management are still very hands on and not in a micro-management, can't let go sort of way, they are still very passionate about the success of the business.

The Small Print … (AKA salary & benefits)
You will be working remotely initially - obviously, but in the future, there is an expectation to be on client site up to 4 times a week, which can be UK wide. This is a Consulting gig, so you'll need to be comfortable with that.
In reality, they will try spread the work as locally as possible and there is a good chance a lot of customers will be happy with remote work going forward.
But you need to be prepared to travel as part of the role.

Salary wise, there is a wide range on offer as they have multiple roles, but to help you drum down a bit, somewhere between £45-80k + benefits.

Please do hit apply and contact Tom Edmondson at Cathcart Associates for a more detailed chat on the role, the company and what you are looking for.

title: Data Warehouse Engineer
description:
Apply now
About the job
'To turn loyalty on its head by rewarding consumers in a way they actually value’
Airtime Rewardsis the first retail rewards programme to seamlessly link transactional data, brands and mobile networks revolutionising loyalty for our shared customers.
Cutting-edge transactional technology. Simple, powerful rewards.
Utilising real-time purchase data and our cutting-edge AI and machine learning transactional technology, our 1m + members earn rewards when shopping with some of the UK’s biggest retailers, using rewards to reduce their mobile bills, and offering retailers a totally new way to reward and incentivise their customers.
Created by the team behind the innovative rewards platforms such as Orange Wednesdays, have since 2016 secured £1m in investment, won awards, been named as a Tech Track tech "one to watch company" and most importantly are hugely proud to be working with some fantastic retail partners including: Waitrose, Missguided, Papa Johns, Wilko, Primark, Boots, Argos, Holland & Barrett, Caffe Nero, and many more.
The Team
We’re a driven agile team with a big vision. We encourage our team members to be themselves - no smokescreens, no masks, no costumes (except when planned), and definitely no pretence.
Individualism is the cornerstone of our culture, we want everyone to be able to contribute new ideas and work together to make something genuinely ground-breaking. Difference makes us different, and we’re proud of that.
If you’re passionate about start-ups, delivering results and dedicated to go the extra mile for our rapidly growing membership, come and join us on our journey.
The Role: Data Warehouse Developer
We are looking for an experienced Data Warehouse Developer Engineer to join our newly formed Data Engineering team and you will have the opportunity to help shape this function working with the management team.
We are looking for someone to build scalable, reliable and secure cloud data warehouse solutions and data integration and processing pipelines and you will need to have experience with a range of technologies to do this.
Data Analytics forms a key part of our strategy this year. Ideally you will be familiar with AWS and you will use various methods and services available to transform raw data into a single customer view. Overall, you’ll strive for efficiency by aligning data systems with business goals.
We are at the early stages of our journey and, as our new Data Warehouse Developer, you will have a lot of opportunity to influence the technical and strategic direction of the team. You will also have the opportunity to take ownership of parts of the existing platform and new greenfield development. This is a position that would suit someone who has got some experience industry and exposure to a number of technologies in the field but is now looking to kick their career into the next phase.
To succeed in this Data Engineering position, you should have strong analytical skills and the ability to combine data from different sources. If you are detail-oriented, with excellent organizational skills and experience in this field, we’d like to hear from you.
Responsibilities:
Develop, maintain and improve our cloud data platform and help plan, design, monitor, communicate and execute data projects
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using a range of technologies and environments (SQL, ETL tools, Kafka, Spark, Scala, AWS)
Prepare data for prescriptive and predictive modelling
Build algorithms and prototypes
Explore ways to enhance data quality and reliability
Identify opportunities for data acquisition
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Work with business and technical stakeholders to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs
Ensure data is reliably stored and secured
Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our data product
Look for opportunities to tactically build solutions that deliver real value, while balancing the opportunities to implement longer term strategic solutions
Strong liaisons with the internal Tech teams
Requirements:
Demonstrable experience of working with and designing a cloud-based analytical platform including best practices around data ingestion (batch and streaming ETL/ELT) and turning data science/machine learning algorithms into production-grade products
Solid knowledge of data modelling and structures, and experience with data laking and warehousing tools and techniques (BigQuery, Spanner, Snowflake, Redshift etc.)
Strong software development skills (particularly in Python) - object oriented and/or functional design, coding, and testing patterns, the relevant DevOps principles, and the ability to document in a clean manner
Solid hands-on experience with SQL, ETL/ELT tooling, Kafka, Spark, Python, Scala, ELK
Exposure to retail and online/digital commerce use-cases is a plus
Could you be interested in joining us on our journey?
Get in touch today with our Talent Partners MRJ Recruitment and talk to Jody and/or Ben.

title: Data Architect
description:
Apply now
Role: Data Architect
Location: Remote but with some travel to Manchester
The Dining Club Group is a highly successful technology-focused business which offers huge opportunities to learn new skills in a supportive and creative environment, and to make a significant contribution to shaping its future. The Dining Club Group is collectively the largest dining club in the world, with over four million members and over 10,000 participating restaurants across our three brands. We are proud to say that our members currently spend in excess of £600M annually in our restaurants; ensuring that our dining co-operative proposition remains strong.
Our dining memberships offer a distinctive and versatile incentive to increase customer acquisition, reduce churn and reward employees. Happy clients of The Dining Club Group include Barclays, The Telegraph, Sage, Thomas Cook and Three.
The Data Architect will play a pivotal role in shaping and guiding data capabilities within DCG. Driving transformation of our data capability is at the heart of our business strategy, as such we have huge plans to expand and improve our capability in this area. As the Data Architect you will be in key to the success of project, laying the foundations and implementing a data solution that allows the business to achieve its ambitious goals.
We are looking for someone who will be able to work with other parts of the business, particularly the data and insights team not only shaping requirements and designing solutions but also making recommendations based on emerging technology and trends.
This role is very much hands on, we are looking for someone to design the successful architecture but then to implement and deliver this solution to the business. Using your knowledge of data engineering you will own the solution design and then build this from the ground up. This is very much a blank canvass role as currently only some of the essential building blocks are in place.
This is a role where you will be able to see the full lifecycle and own the entire project, you will really be able to see the system take shape and a be a key factor in the delivery of an industry leading solution.
For this role we do not need experience with particular systems, but it would certainly be helpful if you had experience in the following.
Cloud Data Architecture - AWS
Snowflake
Salesforce / CRM
ETL
SQL Server / MySQL / NoSQL
The Dining Club Group are developing a great culture and are looking for a team player who is not afraid to roll their sleeves up and dive into the problem headfirst, as such this position would be very rewarding, and you would really see the fruits of your work. They are very collaborative and enthusiastic about what they do.
This is a key hire for them in their drive to be an analytical and insight driven technology business. The Dining Club Group have big plans and aspirations and this role will allow them to achieve some of these goals.

title: Data Engineer Snowflake
description:
Apply now
Data Engineer (Snowflake)
Do you have experience of Snowflake and are now looking to specialise? Do you want to work for a solutions provider with a healthy pipeline of Snowflake projects? Are you looking for a role with genuine scope for progression and a great work-life balance?
A Data & Analytics house based in central London is actively seeking a Data Engineer with experience of working with Snowflake to join a team responsible for a number of business-critical projects dealing with a range of technical solutions.
You'll be joining a company full of like-minded professionals, people that retain that human touch lost in most larger consultancies. It's also a company that is always looking to adapt to take advantage of emerging tech, it means they can provide better solutions to their clients and it keeps their consultants at the top of their game.
If you think you're the right fit for our client, please get in touch to find out more.
Role Summary:
As a Data Engineer, you will:
Design, Build, and maintain production-grade data pipelines
Play a key role on projects from a data engineering perspective, working with Architects and clients to model the data landscape, obtain data extracts and define secure data exchange approaches
Plan and execute secure, good practice data integration strategies and approaches
Work with Data Analysts, Data Scientists, and Product Engineers to build APIs and pipelines that serve up real-time analytics and predictive models to the Snowflake service.
Help define best practices for data movement which Engineers will use when designing and implementing pipelines.
Our Ideal Candidate will have:
Experience on client-facing projects, including working in close-knit teams
Experience of working with Snowflake
Experience building pipelines to move large-scale data.
Fluidity with at least one modern scripting language (Python being the preference)
Experience with a compiled programming language, preferably something that runs on the JVM (Scala being a preference).
Experience working with SQL and relational data. Specifically, an ability to identify and tune problematic queries.
Hands-on experience with MPP databases such as Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery, Vertica, etc.
Hands-on experience with tools used for low-latency event-based pipelines, such as Kafka, Flume, Kinesis, Fluentd, etc.
Familiarity with orchestration frameworks (Preference for Airflow).
Familiarity with streaming/micro-batch compute frameworks (we use Spark and are interested in Storm).
A solid understanding of AWS Roles and Policies, as well as secret management
Above all else, you thrive in a dynamic environment. That means being flexible and willing to jump in and do whatever it takes to be successful.
Additional nice to haves:
A familiarity with business intelligence tools such as Power BI, Tableau and QlikView
Some other technologies we use that we'd expect this person to be familiar with (or willing to learn): Git, SVN, Docker, AWS EMR, and AWS Lambda.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Apply now
Senior Software Engineer - Cardiff

Tech Stack - Python, AWS, MongoDB, ElasticSearch

£40,000 - £50,000 depending on experience

Are you an ambitious and driven Software Engineer who would relish working for a market leading AI company based in the heart of Cardiff?

Do you solid Micro-Services Architecture experience?

Do you want to work with a team of very bright and focussed Engineers who are advocates of using the right tools for the right job and always strive to stay on top of the latest developments in the industry?

The Company

They are spearheading the digital transformation of staffing by providing unique, AI-driven market intelligence to our users. They have a team of 30 based and based in great offices in Central Cardiff and are in hyper growth phase. The demand for what they do has never been stronger and then will continue to grow throughout 2021. This all makes this a very exciting place to work right now!

The Role

Given their ambitious growth plans, they are now looking for a Senior Software Engineer to help accelerate their product roadmap implementation.

You will be working on building our A.I. driven platform that provides our website and 3 rd party clients with accurate and relevant market intelligence.

Responsibilities will include:
* Contribute to the development of features from definition to deployment. These features may cover things such as:
* Data mining
* Data enrichment
* Data engineering
* Internal and external client APIs
* Building reports and monitoring
* Be a pro-active contributor on product features, technical design sessions, planning, bug washing, etc with an opportunity to lead on features with experience.
* Writing high quality software
* Deploying, running and supporting the services you build
* There is also an opportunity to contribute to and work on associated features as wanted/needed such as our A.I. and UEX. They use a cutting-edge, cloud-focused tech stack, including (but certainly not limited to): Python 3.x, Serverless, AWS (e.g. EC2, Lambda, SQS/SNS, Fargate, Aurora), PosgresSQL, MongoDB, ElasticSearch & Terraform.

You must be able to work independently and be self-motivated, whilst also being able to work effectively in cross-functional teams. They are committed to innovation here and strongly encourage it with events and tools such as Hackathons, meetups, E-Learning, Learning lunches and Lightning Round Talks.

What skills will you need
* Python 3.x or another high-level programming language (C# or Java)
* Micro-services architectures experience
* Both NoSQL (MongoDB, ElasticSearch) and SQL
* Hands-on experience with AWS or other Cloud Services infrastructure
* Source control software e.g. git
* BDD/TDD
* Agile methodologies – Scrum/Kanban You will also be highly ambitious and driven to match the companies' culture and have a true first for self-development along the way.

If this sounds like you, please click the apply button and send me your CV and i will call you tell you more about the role and company.

title: Head of Software Engineering - Remote

This company provides deep market intelligence on patients and their medicines. title: C# Application Developer
description:
Apply now
Incredibly diverse project base working with household names.
Outstanding team culture, small team with lots of progression.
Full remote for good!

We’re helping a data-led marketing agency who work with some seriously impressive brands to find an Application Developer to join their delivery team. This role is fully remote though their HQ is in Scotland, and they also have an office in Bristol should you want to be surrounded by a team. Boasting some huge household names as part of their client base, this role sits in a small but growing team alongside a talented bunch of Data Engineering, Tech Support and Project Delivery specialists. If you’re a developer with a passion for data, I want to hear from you!

What skills you’ll need

Commercial C# experience and understanding of the wider MS stack. Any knowledge of Python would be useful.
Knowledge of at least one cloud platform, preferably Azure/AWS but open to Google too.
Preference for back-end development, appreciation for the importance of data.
Ability to test your own work.
Significant awareness of SQL.
Experience with Git/TFS source control and Agile.
Solid communication skills, comfortable being in a client-facing environment.
What you’ll be doing

This role sits in the business’ delivery team. You’d be working alongside their Senior App Developer to create a variety of applications which support the delivery of solutions to an impressive client base of household names. The role leans much more to the back-end with most projects being cloud-based on AWS, though they’re happy to cross-train from a different platform if needed. The business is data-led in their approach so lots of the project work will be centred on data development, involved in high-level data pipelines and insight. Being an agency-style environment you could be working on several projects concurrently so you’ll need to bring an adaptable mindset that will allow you to jump between different tech and styles of development on a regular basis. The client base is spread across various industries including POS, Print, Automotive, TV and more. There is ambitious growth plans in place so you could certainly look to progress into a more senior role quite quickly.

What you’ll get in return for your talents

On top of a competitive salary and rapid scope for progression, this role offers 100% remote working with an occasional trip to the office, and if you’d prefer to be in an office you can work out of either of their Edinburgh or Bristol offices! They work with a global client base of seriously impressive household brands which will only support you to become more versatile as a Developer moving forward. Diverse team, multiple opportunities for R&D, constant variety and change. What’s not to love!

What's next?

Like the sound of this one? Drop Joe a message now to find out more!

title: Data Scientist - BI / Python / Maths or Stats / Machine Learning 35-50k ML!
description:

My client is a world leading Data science Consultancy - they have new requirement for a Data Scientist .
You will be working with the leading Location Intelligence team across the world, responsible for delivering advanced spatial analysis and insight to major organisations across a range of sectors and countries. We provide consultancy, cutting edge software and the latest data to help our clients optimise their location strategies across both the physical and digital landscape. Projects typically last between a week and 6 months, ranging from performance analysis, customer insight, defining network strategies, BI & visualisation and advanced predictive modelling.

Within the wider Location Intelligence team, we work with companies from a broad range of sectors, both within the UK and internationally, including retail, leisure, grocery, automotive and the public sector.
