title: Marketing Solutions Senior IT Project Manager £55K plus bens
description:
Apply now
This global, media tech consultancy specialise in designing and delivering digital marketing solutions to a predominantly blue chip client base. They are looking to recruit a Senior PM to manage one of their client's implementation of large scale real-time marketing solutions, software development (web & app), Marketing Automation software implementation and Cloud based Data Lake and SCV Database solutions.
As an experienced PM you will manage several projects on an end to basis, and be the conduit between client and company. Utilising a cluster of internal technical units, you will co-ordinate and manage the delivery and roll out of said solutions, monitoring and feeding back to stakeholder groups. Consequently you will be a first class communicator and be able to translate client requirements into IT tech speak and vice versa.
This is an exciting role as the consultancy consider themselves to be cutting edge and you will continue to grow your technical knowledge accordingly. Location requirements will vary between Central London and the SE but will include WFH for the majority of time.
YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
You’ll develop full-scale project plans and associated communications documents and effectively communicate project expectations to team members and stakeholders in a timely and clear fashion.
As project manager, you’ll assume management responsibility for more junior members of staff. We want you to coach, mentor, motivate and supervise project team members and contractors and influence them to take positive action and accountability for their assigned work.
You’ll be a key lynchpin with other departments to facilitate relationships and deliver on projects that span several areas of the business.
You’ll take total technical ownership of assigned client systems and you will provide technical solutions and estimates for the full range of proposed projects.
You’ll draft and submit budget proposals and recommend subsequent budget changes where necessary. You’ll continuously monitor progress in terms of the status of the plan and the budget and report back to senior management and the client via weekly or other progress reporting and by organising and managing status meetings.
You’ll manage expectations of clients and project stakeholders/sponsors at multi-levels including C/board level take ownership for driving delivery through, be client facing and build a level of respect with your clients.
You’ll define project scope, goals and deliverables and take commercial responsibility for assigned projects to ensure profitability
You define and work to statements of work and terms of reference.
Work with the existing policies and procedures, aligning to the company way of working, offering and proposing improvements where they can help.
You’ll conduct project retrospectives and create a recommendations report in order to identify successful and unsuccessful project elements and from this, develop best practices and tools for project execution and management.
Lead & coordinate the development/service delivery team
REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
You’ll have significant experience as a project manager and have experience within all aspects of process development and execution - we’re particularly keen to see experience of delivering digital solutions through full-cycle web builds, ETL process experience, Marketing Sciences (Analytics) and QA processes.
You’ll be a team leader and manager - with experience of growing and developing a team and helping get the best out of your colleagues.
You’ll have some understanding of some or all of internet apps, architectures, OS’, functionality, intra/extranet, client server architectures, data engineering, reporting & analytics.
Experience in delivering marketing solutions to clients with knowledge and understanding of both the marketing technologies (Salesforce / Adobe / Acoustic) and client challenges in the marketing arena.
You will have a good understanding of data security issues

title: Data Scientist
description:
Apply now
Data Scientist - Greenfield Computer Vision Project
A Data Scientist with strong Computer Vision skills is required by an analytics company headquartered in the North West to help them with a greenfield project.
Your new role …
As the sole expert on Computer Vision you will help the team design the solutions and promote best practice across the small, but talented data team.
They are still at the research and development phase just now but have big plans for introducing a range of services to their client base, which will be underpinned by the technology you build.
From an experience point of view, there are a few off the shelf packages that will likely fit the brief, but the implementation of these and how to best go about it, they do not have the skills in house.
That is where you come in.
You …
You will likely come from a fairly academic background where you have solved Computer Vision problems, or you are maybe doing it commercially at the moment.

You'll be confident when it comes to C++, the current team do not have experience here and with the plans going forward to include an embedded element, this will be quite important.
On top of that, you'll be confident with Python, R or similar.
At the moment they are hosted in GCP but this knowledge isn't required, just an appreciation of cloud deployment and data engineering would be good.
You'll be happy working in a small team where your voice will really be heard, working under a really strong Head of Data.
Your new company …
A forward-thinking analytics company that have been really successful in a couple of areas over the years, but never ones to sit still have made a few acquisitions to allow them to continue their growth.
Data is at the core of the business, with buy in from the Senior Management so this role gives you a unique chance to take something from inception all the way through to completion.
Based in the North of Manchester, easily accessible by road and with on-site parking they are in a good spot for anyone based around Greater Manchester really.
The package …
Very much up for negotiation, but likely to be up to around £55k with flexible working post covid and a grown up environment around things like hours etc.
If you are a Computer Vision expert and looking for your next role, click apply and contact Jordan at Cathcart Technology for more information.

title: Data Engineer / Python Developer
description:
Apply now
Data Engineer / Python Developer (Python ETL API Google Cloud) Independent research consultancy is seeking an accomplished Data Engineer as they navigate a period of rapid growth.

The company specialises in providing real-time, in-depth information on global energy markets. They combine extensive data models with a core market platform to support their network of high-level industry contacts.

This Data Engineer position is a fantastic opportunity to showcase your skills in a highly-impactful position. You'll join the talented Data Team who are responsible for supporting the infrastructure and strategic projects which are integral to optimising the data content and capabilities of the company.

As a Data Engineer you'll take ownership of building and maintaining the ETL pipelines in Python, working closely with Data Analysts and other technical analysts to ensure the availability of core platforms and the performance and operations of the data infrastructure, data products and APIs.

You'll play a key role in shaping and driving forward the future of data at the company, helping to design and implement new solutions for use by the data team, in conjunction with supportive a range of strategic, company-level data initiatives.

Your personal and professional development will be a priority, as not only will you have the latest tech to work on (including your own MacBook Pro), you'll have access to licences of any software you want to use, plus training and a training and personal improvement budget.

*Please note: this company is able to conduct an entirely remote interview process during the current social distancing measures as well as 100% work from home. You'll join the Canary Wharf offices in due course with some continued flexible work opportunities.*

Requirements:

*You have good knowledge of ETL and Data APIs
*You have e Good knowledge of relational and non-relational databases e.g. SQL, PostgreSQL, MySQL

*You have experience of working with software development teams

As a Data Engineer you'll earn a highly competitive salary (to £85k) plus a comprehensive benefits package including an annual bonus, generous holiday allowance, private medical insurance and subsidised gym membership.

If you are interested in this Data Engineer / Python Developer (Python ETL API Google Cloud) opportunity, apply now or get in touch today to find out more.

title: Chinese-Mandarin speaking Data Engineer
description:

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Apply on employer's website
We have an exciting position available for a Senior Data Engineer to join our team based at our HQ in Southampton, however all our people, where they can, are currently working from home and we recognise the future need to be flexible; as such we are open to applications that can deliver work remotely where appropriate. You will join us on a full time, permanent basis and in return, you will receive a competitive salary of £53,754 - £63,240 per annum.
Ordnance Survey (OS) provides national mapping services for Great Britain and is a world-leading provider of geospatial solutions. OS location data and expertise has helped governments make smarter decisions, businesses gain valuable data insight, and everyone experience the world outside for over 225 years.
We offer fantastic benefits in return for joining us as our Senior Data Engineer:
- Competitive salary plus performance-related bonus
- Competitive pension
- 37 hour working week (with flexible working options)
- 25 days annual leave (30 days after five years), bank holidays, and an extra 3 over Christmas
- Plus, a suite of excellent additional benefits
About the role:
Joining our Data Engineering team, our Senior Data Engineer will provide leadership and expertise in developing new techniques, tools and pipelines. You will transform and manipulate geospatial data into forms suitable for visualisation, analysis and further development with your Agile team.
Providing insight and experience to inform data-driven decision-making, your focus will be on building, maintaining and troubleshooting data processing systems to meet business requirements; with an emphasis on security, reliability, fault-tolerance, scalability, fidelity, and efficiency.
Researching and utilising cutting-edge big data and machine learning technologies to automate and simplify processes, is all part of the role. You’ll be a key team member in one of our development teams, with the primary focus of your day-to-day activities being data manipulation and delivering data pipelines to aid development.
What we’re looking for in our ideal Senior Data Engineer:
- A degree-level qualification in a quantitative discipline or significant experience in a relevant field, such as statistical modelling or mathematics
- Experience in Microsoft Azure Cloud Services (or similar)
- Working knowledge of Databricks and Spark
- Relevant programming language(s) and databases
- Geospatial data processing and analysis techniques
- Influencing key business and technical stakeholders, with strong presentation and consultancy skills
- Providing technical coaching and mentoring
Our growing Technology and Design team plays a key role in ensuring OS is at the cutting edge of geospatial capability and is looking for people to join them. Its mission is to work across the business to provide customer centric design and technology services.
If you would like to be part of this, click apply now to be considered as our Senior Data Engineer, we’d love to hear from you!
Closing date: Sunday 28th February 2021

title: Backend Software Engineer Node.js/AWS/Agile
description:
Apply now
Backend Software Engineer (Node.js/AWS/Agile) - London
£60k + flexi/remote working
My client, an award-winning Publishing House is looking to hire four experienced Backend Software Engineers (Node.js) to join an agile development team that is helping evolve their core Digital News products.
The role:
They are looking for engineers to help work on improving their digital presence, from enhancing the reader experience through to improving the editorial workflow. Their main strategic projects at the moment include evolving their digital platforms to support the next generation of news, and improving their sites to reflect each brand’s individuality.
They are looking for people who care deeply about the code they write while at the same time are able to bridge the gap between the technical and the business areas of the company effectively.
They want people who look further than the technical aspects of the work and care deeply about the human aspect of their products. You will be responsible for designing, testing and implementing improvements to their news products, and the work you do here will ultimately be consumed by millions of people.
Tech Stack
The main products use a Java-based CMS, running in Tomcat and hosted in AWS. This is used for both content creation and delivering the presentation layer for their websites. The trend in recent years has been away from a Java monolith towards Node.js based systems and microservices. Theu are currently planning a more extensive re-platform which will accelerate this trend towards cloud native event-driven architectures. If you’re enthusiastic and have some experience in working with such technologies, and know or are willing to learn about developing systems at their considerable scale then we want to hear from you.
Their preferred way to run application code has become to run it either in a Docker container running in ECS or in a Lambda function. They extensively leverage other AWS services including RDS, CloudFront, DynamoDB, CloudFormation, CloudWatch and so on. They are strong believers in DevOps principles and infrastructure as code, and they are continuously trying to improve in that direction.
The current frontend is primarily built in vanilla JS within an ES module structure, Sass for CSS and Pug templates for producing HTML. As with the backend stack they are looking to re-architect and modernise the frontend presentation layer
Your experience
The ideal candidate for this position will:
Be experienced in Node.js development with an interest in working across the stack.
Be experienced in building cloud native systems in AWS.
Have a strong understanding of HTTP, caching and how the web works.
Have experience with backend build systems and with automated testing.
Work collaboratively within an agile web development team, be self-directed and be happy to work on their own initiative.
Any of the following would also be useful but not mandatory:
Knowledge of GraphQL.
Experience with React / full stack development.
Experience with Infrastructure as Code.
Involvement with high traffic systems.
Experience in Java application development.
Experience configuring CI/CD pipelines.
Experience with Data Engineering.
Important Information: We endeavour to process your personal data in a fair and transparent manner. In applying for this role, Additional Resources will be acting in your best interest and may contact you in relation to the role, either by email, phone or text message. For more information see our Privacy Policy on our website. It is important you are aware of your individual rights and the provisions the company has put in place to protect your data. If you would like further information on the policy or GDPR please contact us.
Additional Resources Ltd is an Employment Business and an Employment Agency as defined within The Conduct of Employment Agencies & Employment Businesses Regulations 2003

title: Head of Software Engineering - Remote
description:

This company provides deep market intelligence on patients and their medicines. title: Senior Data Platform Engineer
description:
Apply on employer's website
The team at N Brown are seeking a Senior Data Platform Engineer to join their team.  Working here you’ll explore everything the world of digital retail has to offer — asking questions, trying new things and chasing new opportunities. Combine this curiosity with the freedom to make your own decisions, take charge of projects and work flexibly, and you’ve got the perfect place to show your skills and learn new ones. It’s fast and furious here at times, but this just means something new and exciting is always on the way. So, if you collaborate, think on your feet, embrace innovation and love rising to a challenge, your work with us will have a serious impact on the business, your career and our customers’ lives.

As Senior Data Platform Engineer here at N Brown you will receive a competitive salary of up to £60,000 per annum (DOE) plus pension scheme, life assurance, 24 days holiday plus bank holidays, in addition to taking advantage of a holiday purchase scheme! You will benefit from our flexible working hours and fantastic location based in the heart of the northern quarter, Manchester. You will receive fantastic employee discount on our products, a discounted share purchase scheme and access to our Employee Assistance Programme and much more!

As a Senior Data Platform Engineer you will:

- Work in a cross-functional Agile team, orchestrating automated pipelines using (big) data tools/architecture and seeing changes through into production.
- Work within a cloud-based environment and therefore experience in this area is ideal.
- Create robust and automated pipelines to ingest and process structured and unstructured data from source systems into analytical platforms using batch and streaming mechanisms leveraging cloud-native toolset.
- Implement custom applications using tools such as Kinesis, Lambda and other AWS tools as required to address streaming use cases.
- Engineer and support data structures including but not limited to SQL and NoSQL database.
- Deliver data that is reliable, trustworthy and highly available developing into a data engineering superstar, confident that with each release that the codebase will perform up to the highest quality standards.
- Focus on security and performance. You will not be afraid to challenge ideas and opinions to avoid pitfalls and inefficient solutions.

We are looking for a Senior Data Platform Engineer who is familiar with the following technologies:

Cloud fundamentals – preferably several of the following on AWS: S3, IAM, EC2, Cloudwatch etc, EMR, Glue, DynamoDB, Athena, Lake Formation, Redshift, Sagemaker, Lambda. Plus some of the following: Teradata EDW (not essential), Airflow, PowerBI or similar visualisation tools, Test Driven Development (TDD), Version control systems (preferably Git), Experience of centralising data within a service oriented architecture, Grafana or similar monitoring / alerting tools.

If this sounds like the role for you and you would like to join the team at N Brown click apply now.

The job title of ‘Senior’ relates simply to the level of experience and has no relevance to age. You are encouraged to apply for any opportunities that you feel to be suitable, irrespective of age or level of experience.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
Apply on employer's website
Data is at the heart of everything N Brown does and the Data Division works across the business to find ways to turn data-derived insights into positive outcomes for people shopping with us.  Our mission is to find customers who are perfect for our brands, uncover the products and propositions which are perfect for them and ultimately make our customers look and feel amazing!  The N Brown Data Science team is one of the best in the country and we are building modern infrastructure to support the work of Data Science and Analytics in all of our departments.  At this time we are looking to expand by bringing in an experienced Machine Learning Engineer to help us succeed.

Working at N Brown you’ll explore everything the world of digital retail has to offer by asking questions, trying new things and chasing opportunities. Combine this curiosity with the freedom to make your own choices, take charge of projects and work flexibly, and you’ve got the perfect place to showcase your skills and learn new ones.

Along with a salary of £50,000-£55,000 per annum, you will also receivie a range of benefits including a company pension with up to 6% N Brown contribution, Life Assurance and Private Medical Insurance, Annual bonus scheme, Incredible colleague discount across all our N Brown Group brands (Simply Be, Jacamo, JD Williams, Fashion World, Marisota, Ambrose Wilson to name but a few), Local restaurant discounts across Manchester’s Northern Quarter, 24 days annual leave (plus 8 bank holidays) with the option to buy an additional 10 over the year, Flexible working, as well as staggered start times, we know these are different times and have embraced them to ensure our staff are supported.

As a Machine Learning Engineer you will:

- Be a technical expert within the Data Science team, designing, building and deploying ML products which help N Brown to delight our customers.
- Lead technically across Data Science projects, encouraging efficient machine learning development and paving the way to production. You will lead Peer Review discussions and be the gatekeeper of good code.
- Be a key member of the team responsible for developing, testing and monitoring our Data Science products, ensuring durability, availability and reproducibility. You will build frameworks which enable rapid deployment, producing value quickly from Data Science.
- Set and maintain software development standards (in SQL and Python) across the team.
- Maintain and troubleshoot the Data Science team’s working environment (Athena, S3, SageMaker, IAM) rapidly responding to problems in order to ensure the team have the tools to do their job.
- Be a key contributor in the planning and direction of Data Science projects.
- Collaborate with teams across IT and beyond to maintain our data sources and provide the best results for our customers. You will be highly aligned with Data Engineering squads, trained in their best practices.
- Drive innovation in the Data Science team, ensuring we are prepared for the future and taking advantage of cutting-edge techniques and technologies.

What you’ll need to succeed as a Machine Learning Engineer at N Brown:

- Excellent Python and SQL skills.
- Excellent communication skills.
- Good commercial grounding in applying ML models and experience of what it takes to deploy models efficiently.
- Hands-on experience with databases, containerisation, and cloud environments such as AWS or GCP.
- Practical knowledge of handling varied types of data, and experience in using it to produce value for the business.
- Knowledge of workflow orchestration tools such as Airflow.
- A solid understanding of the software development life cycle and the product end-to-end, including deployment.

A digital retailer will be fast-paced at times, but this just means something new and exciting is always on the way. So, if you can collaborate, think on your feet, embrace innovation and love working together for a common goal, you could have a serious impact on the business, your career and our customers’ lives.

We’re looking for a Machine Learning Engineer with a passion for what they do, pride in the brand they work for and the the curiosity to uncover new and exciting insights. If you feel your experience and attitude match what we’re looking for then we’d love to hear from you.

title: Python Engineer
description:
Apply now
My client is looking to recruit an experienced Python Engineer with a strong interest in Data Science to join their expanding Data Science team. They are an award-winning company with an industry leading product and offer a great opportunity to develop you are career within a friendly and suppurative environment.
You will be working a variety of projects that include Artificial Intelligence (AI) products that help their customers operative more efficiently. The successful applicant will get to make a significant contribution and the opportunity to work on several Data Science and machine learning projects with global reach for a number of our high-profile customers. We are looking for someone who is a skilled engineer who is experienced in python and search methodologies.
You will have a good understanding of Search Science and the algorithms and methods that make search effective. You will be able to identify opportunities to improve search quality - from including relevance engineering, machine learning, natural language processing and more. Devising evaluation methodologies to measure search quality and developing experiments to validate them. You will be well versed in Search-at-Scale with a deep understanding of Elasticsearch query DSL and performance tuning for real-time applications at global scale. Skills in data exploration including Kibana would be useful.
In this role you will also be building fast, flexible API’s and data processing to support them. The API’s you design will be used by a variety of internal users and external customers. This will require building libraries, services and tools that help the speed of delivery to these users.
Responsibilities:
Designing and building new areas of functionality driven by data science based on both client and internal requirements.
Expanding and optimizing data and data pipeline architecture as well as optimizing how data flows through the system.
Improving existing data flows and services.
Ensuring your code is written and maintained to a high standard.
Providing input to the software and system architecture and contributing toward their development.
Working closely with and training other members of the team.
Producing documentation, estimates, design and functional specifications for use by internal teams.
Working within the Data Science team and working closely with the Product Lead, Data Engineering Lead and Data Science team members.
Fixing internal and client-submitted defects.
Key skills & experience:
Minimum 3 years Python software development experience in data science or machine learning.
Passionate about Python, SQL and Git - delivering tested, reliable, and maintainable software.
Experience of developing and implementing RESTful API’s and microservices
Enjoy focusing on backend engineering problems, including contributing to projects such as building web APIs, data processing pipelines, and project tooling.
Active interest not only in how our software is built, but also understanding who it’s being built for and why they need our help.
Committed to writing elegant, clean, performant code behind that other developers love to work with.
Solid understanding of cybersecurity.
Experience with ElasticSearch and preferably AWS.
Comfortable using Git alongside a Docker or Docker Compose based development environment.
Creation and maintenance of automated tests.
Superb soft skills, social intelligence and empathy are critical to align with the Data Science team’s positive 'can-do’ culture.
You will have experience of, or are excited to learn about, other technologies such as Django, Flask, Apache Spark (PySpark), Apache Kafka, AWS, Terraform, Docker, and Kubernetes.
Build and automate Extract, Transform, and Load operations (ETLs) to get data where it needs to go.

title: Senior Business Development Manager - SaaS
description:
Apply now
Senior Business Development Consultant / Manager

London, UK (95% remote working)

£50,000 - £60,000 /- £100K OTE

This special company launched with a goal — a goal to be the very best. They don't just believe it; they know their team is our biggest asset. They are a group of passionate innovators (*nerds), obsessed with personal growth, that believes in challenging the status quo to ensure they come up with the best solutions. They have a phenomenal culture, unparalleled drive, and every single person in our team is very carefully selected to make sure they maintain this. They are diverse, and they celebrate that. The role

You will be responsible for developing leads from marketing campaigns and meeting sales targets.

Operating with complete autonomy, you will use various sales techniques and channels, mainly telephone and email campaigns, to create new sales opportunities for your colleagues. You will also play a vital role in supporting the sales team throughout the full sales cycle to generate the best possible results. You will be engaging with senior-level stakeholders throughout.

You could be dealing with multiple sales cycle within one sales opportunity. Being able to sell solutions, multi-task, manage time efficiently and be a self-starter is a must.

If you're a person who thinks outside the box and enjoys solving complex solutions for customers and thrive selling value to customers, get in touch!

? Research relevant sales target (verticals, customer segments, etc) based on our customer ideal profiles

Key Skills

? You are highly motivated with a strong technical aptitude and natural sales instinct

Your Experience

Please send me your CV and i will arrange a time to call you to discuss further. This opportunity isnt to be missed. Awesome company!

title: Data Scientist
description:
Apply now
Data Scientist - London
Salary: up to £40k dependent on experience
Our client, a Marketing, Technology and Data specialist company offers an unrivalled range of data, marketing and IT solutions to a wide range of industries across both the public and private sectors. Their integrated Marketing and Location Planning divisions provides data, software and consulting services to improve our clients’ sales and marketing programmes. They help clients find, retain and grow profitable customers through our understanding of consumer characteristics and behaviour. And they help commercial property developers and retailers plan retail provision in the UK and overseas.
Their Technology and Network Services divisions provides a range of software, consultancy and managed services to SME and large enterprise clients from across the public and private sector. With their experience and understanding of big data analytics, systems integration, secure cloud and IT networks, they help clients improve operational processes, gain greater insight into their business and reduce costs. They work closely with their clients to ensure they understand their aims and objectives, incorporate their feedback and knowledge, and develop a bespoke solution to meet their business needs.
They are looking for a data scientist with up to 5 years’ experience, to work within their Location Intelligence technical team. It is a young and sociable team that are looking for a self-motivated person with a willingness to learn new skills and who is comfortable receiving a high level of responsibility from day one.
They are looking for a problem solver, who can come up with creative solutions to our clients’ problems and help to drive innovation and efficiency within the team.
The selected candidate will be working with the leading Location Intelligence team across the world, responsible for delivering advanced spatial analysis and insight to major organisations across a range of sectors and countries. Projects typically last between a week and 6 months, ranging from performance analysis, customer insight, defining network strategies, BI & visualisation and advanced predictive modelling.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE
Taking on deep-dive analysis of data and generate new business insights with the development of predictive models
Helping to create and deliver a wide range of bespoke projects and tools using a variety of different environments, languages and techniques
Developing their analytical capabilities, researching related technologies and approaches, enabling other areas of the group
Playing a part in owning and maintaining the underlying processes and infrastructure they are building to support the day-to-day work
CORE SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE REQUIRED
A degree in a numerate discipline and strong understanding of statistics
Familiar with programming languages (e.g. R, Python) and experience with, learning to write and maintain programming code and database scripts
Knowledge and experience building spatial and non-spatial predictive models in real-world applications.
Can demonstrate skills in algorithm development, data manipulation and visualisation
Familiar with analytics and business intelligence platforms (e.g. Alteryx, Tableau, Power BI, QlikView/Sense)
The ideal candidate must be a self-starter, creative and willing to challenge the status quo also demonstrating an intellectual curiosity and passion for learning data science, exploring the fields of data engineering and machine learning
DESIRABLE SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Familiar with database query language (e.g. SQL)
Strong Microsoft Excel skills
Excellent oral and written communication
Experience with a cloud platform (e.g. AWS, Snowflake)
Coding standards, version control (e.g. Git)
A communicative person that can explain complex topics in simple terms
Experience and knowledge of the consumer retail market or areas within the public sector
BENEFITS
Competitive salary and benefits package (including technical team bonus)
Flexible working
Pension scheme enrolment
Health & Wellbeing Cash Plan benefit
Private healthcare scheme (eligible after two years of service)
Life assurance, personal accident and income protection cover
Optional season ticket and bicycle purchase loans
Free Gym membership
Important Information: We endeavour to process your personal data in a fair and transparent manner. In applying for this role, Additional Resources will be acting in your best interest and may contact you in relation to the role, either by email, phone or text message. For more information see our Privacy Policy on our website. It is important you are aware of your individual rights and the provisions the company has put in place to protect your data. If you would like further information on the policy or GDPR please contact us.
Additional Resources are an Employment Business and an Employment Agency as defined within The Conduct of Employment Agencies & Employment Businesses Regulations 2003.

title: Mid Level JavaScript Developer -Microservices/NodeJS -REMOTE
description:
Apply now
The Nottingham Tech scene is host to an incredibly vibrant, electric Fintech spirit. We're absolutely no stranger to a start-up. If anything, as a city we have become renown for it. So.. we're not quite Silicon Valley, but we're undoubtedly on the map for bringing new, revolutionary Finance products to market. And doing it really, really well.
If you're a smart, ambitious Developer looking to work for the most enviable name in the local Fintech market.. These are the guys you wanna be working for. I'll tell you exactly why...
I'm super proud to be working with one of the most exciting Tech Start-ups.. Not only in the Midlands, but also within the UK. I've recruited for these guys since their conception - their product has absolutely disrupted its industry. Having built a team of some of the most brightest, smartest and most likeable Devs in the local market, we're now after another couple of Engineers to join them and play a key role in driving their product forward and being a part of their evolution. The product is leading the way within its industry and despite its success to date - there is so much more that the guys want to do with it and are looking for x2 Developers to help them take it to the next level.
My client embody the principles of what makes a truly wonderful business - They simply do things.. the right way. Their ethos? Build with a test-first approach.. release early and release often. These guys absolutely do NOT compromise on quality - they take it seriously. They place a huge emphasis on delivery so its naturally critical we find someone that shares and owns this mindset.
The beauty of this role is these guys are pretty agnostic to tech-stack in the sense that you don't need to be a wizard in every language under the sun….
Their product is built mainly around the NodeJS ecosystem and they'd like you to have some React exposure. These guys are even using spots of Go and Python too, their tech continues to evolve as they look to really push the boundaries.
I want you to be technically inquisitive and have a good attitude. You'll have the aptitude to take to their tech stack like a duck to water and be bold enough to maybe even suggest better ways of working.. these guys will totally encourage and support your personal development and learning too.
To put it bluntly, you'll join a mega bunch of people who all absolutely love what they do. There are no ego's here. There's very little (if any) hierarchy and you'll essentially have a laugh every day and work collaboratively towards a collective end goal… Absolutely shaking up their industry!
You'll be obsessed with keeping up to date in new tech trends, techniques and upcoming innovations in the world of software development and data engineering. These guys envisage that their future stack will include significant investment in AI technologies, particularly in the area of "robo advice" and machine learning.. so if you have a thirst for learning and are passionate about staying abreast of the latest developments in the software landscape - this truly is the place to be.
In return you'll receive a really competitive salary of up to £55k depending on your experience plus bonus scheme, pension scheme, 25 days holiday (plus bank holidays) and life assurance. Oh… and your very own annual personal development budget (that can be used for anything within reason!) You'll also have the option of using 10% of your time for personal development and R&D and conference attendance is fully encouraged and supported. They are also very open to flexible working hours.
Contact Jake at Modis in Nottingham on today for immediate consideration.
Modis International Ltd acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and an employment business for the supply of temporary workers in the UK. Modis Europe Ltd provide a variety of international solutions that connect clients to the best talent in the world. For all positions based in Switzerland, Modis Europe Ltd works with its licensed Swiss partner Accurity GmbH to ensure that candidate applications are handled in accordance with Swiss law.
Both Modis International Ltd and Modis Europe Ltd are Equal Opportunities Employers.
By applying for this role your details will be submitted to Modis International Ltd and/ or Modis Europe Ltd. Our Candidate Privacy Information Statement which explains how we will use your information is available on the Modis website.

title: Data Platforms Lead
description:
Apply now
My client a leading Data & Analytics organisation is focused on supporting their customers in making better use of their Data


They provide advice, support and delivery services across various industry sectors covering a multitude of areas, ranging from Data Strategy, Governance and Security to Data Platform Modernisation, Cloud and Customer Intelligence.


The Data Platforms Lead sits within the Solutions Consulting team and will report directly to the Head of Consulting. This is a high profile, customer facing role with the opportunity to make a significant impact across the business as they continue to grow.
The role will lead the "go to Market" strategy and will be responsible for growing a community of Consultants of various levels of seniority to help win business and deliver world-class services for our clients in Data, Analytics and Cloud related technologies.
Tasks and Responsibilities:
Working proactively with others, strive to maintain an annual individual billable utilization level of approximately 70% for your role.
Contribute towards GTM and Community development, such as:

Production and delivery of Whitepapers, Webinars, Blogs and other promotional material
Authoring of content for use with Sales Value Propositions (SVP)
Building an inventory of pre-sales assets and demonstration environments
Building and encouraging development of unique IP
Building appropriate website content.
Undertake direct and indirect People Management and champion people initiatives
Identify and develop motivated, enthusiastic and capable consultants to ensure succession
Build and develop a Community and social spirit within your team.
Own, share and collaborate on Community information using appropriate communication tools such as Microsoft Teams, company intranet and other channels.
Help evolve and develop all consultants within your Community to support career progression, succession planning and skills building.
Collaborate with Core Tech Team leads to facilitate the Community to actively build core partner technology capabilities.
Collaborate with Core Tech Team leads to ensure the Community achieves its expected levels of certification for partner technology capabilities and that partner training offerings are aligned with Consultant career paths.
Identify and deliver in senior roles on client-site engagements alongside our consultant, to contribute to your GTM revenue and build critical experience to improve your thought leadership.
Build out a winning sales-mentality in your Community to ensure active participation in PreSales and Bid Support activities.
Continue to build a cross-function collaborative team of consultants in your Community to support commercial account managers in Sales and other key functions such as Marketing, Demand Generation and HR.
Help identify and develop potential Account Leads from key consultants in your Community who are able to go on to develop IP, company assets and case studies etc.
Help win and get rewarded on the winning of business which requires key skills and capabilities from consultants in your Community.
Hold monthly Community meetings and work with the other GTM Leads to ensure consistency of Community management and cascading of information across multiple channels.
Manage and support the recruitment of resources into your Community, along with the performance management processes to develop your consultants where applicable.
Manage and support the enablement of key consultants in your Community with the project management and technical leadership skills needed to assure the delivery of our services to our clients.
Support allocation of the resources in your Community to upcoming engagements and client accounts.
Support bench management processes to help alignment to career paths and development of the consultants in your Community.
Essential Skills and Capabilities
Significant and proven experience in a technical lead / technical team management role.
Significant & proven experience in a project management or technical leadership role for the delivery of Data Management, Data Engineering or Data Modernisation projects and initiatives.
Significant and proven Consulting experience.
Proven ability to balance multiple client requirements and employer needs while in a billable role.
Understanding of delivery methodologies including Waterfall and Agile Methodologies.
Significant written and verbal communication skills bridging both technical and business user concepts.
Demonstrable focus on delivering client value.
Strong stakeholder management skills.
Strong and demonstrable Line Management experience for the full employee lifecycle, including supporting team members developing through formal career paths frameworks.
Proven record of identifying and filling training needs in a team, along with demonstrable coaching and mentoring skills to support your colleagues / line reports achieve success.
Passion for the Data-driven organization and the ability to convey the business benefits of achieving this.
Location - UK Remote (with Occassional customer travel)

title: Business Analyst
description:
Apply on employer's website
We're looking for a Business Analyst who will join our tech team on a key initiative to rethink how we support the acquisition, allocation and movement of stock around Footasylum.

This is an exciting role for an experienced business analyst who can:
Work closely with a multi-disciplinary team to help them make meaningful improvements to the day-to-day operations of our merchandising team.
Evaluate existing legacy system and identify key responsibilities grouped by business domain to influence the design of the new solution.
Build strong relationships and engage business stakeholders across the warehouse, merchandising, retail and e-commerce teams to fully understand related processes and share the pain points with a development team.
Promote informed decisions on the build or buy approach needed for the initiative.
Support a procurement process to ensure any selected vendor meets the functional and non-functional business requirements.
Collaborate with a delivery manager and product manager to break down the work into small, testable deliverables, as well as contributing to the short, medium and long term goals in the form of a roadmap
Align to business objectives and key results, using the metrics and measures to evaluate and prioritise value.

Why Footasylum?
We've been going through a digital transformation, changing how we deliver value to our business. A big part of this change is fostering a culture of being open and honest, collaborating, having fun and enabling psychological safety.
We want to create a place for teams to do their best work, and you'll have the opportunity to influence our decisions, help define standards across the teams and contribute to a healthy and happy working environment.
Our teams work against our four pillars to ensure we make data led decisions to deliver value safely and quickly, working together openly and building a learning culture. We are shifting to using OKR's to frame our goals and keep teams aligned to our business priorities.

The Team
The goal of the Right Product, Right Place team is to help empower teams across the businessby giving them the ability to effortlessly keep stock close to our customer. This means providing the teams with improved processes and solutions to enable better stock visibility and tracking and improve order fulfilment no matter where the stock is located.
You will be working as part of a multi-disciplinary team alongside a product manager, delivery manager and engineers across Navision, software, QA and data engineering. You will be playing the part of helping to make the decision on the best solution to meet the stakeholders needs and solve their problems. This may conform of a combination of build or buy solutions.

About You
We're looking for someone who can take complex systems and create clarity, simplicity and be able to share their findings with the wider team. You will be inquisitive and have no issues with asking lots of questions, or for diagrams or documentation of existing systems to help you discover more. You bring people together to dive into problems, ensuring you don't become the centre of all knowledge.
You engage stakeholders and understand the objectives using empathy. You'll need to be patient and proactive to understand what people do, not just what they say they do.?
You'll have experience of working with merchandising, allocation and warehouse teams in a retail business and bring real world experience to complement your analysis skills.
You will have the skills and confidence to identify and engage key business stakeholders and other development teams to build a clear picture of requirements using shared context and domain language that everyone understands.

Salary and Benefits?
We're offering a salary of up to £50,000 for the right person, which we assess based on your own experiences, business analysis skills and against the principles of our department and our ways of working. You'll also get access to our ‘FA Presents' company benefits platform, 25 days holiday and pension as standard, and use of our training budget to help you develop your skills.

Diversity?
We recognise and value the importance of diversity to help make sure we have lots of different perspectives when we are building products and services. We know that this will help us build useful and accessible things which our customers will love. This is great news for our business. Diversity for us is also, importantly, about building happy teams full of people that want to learn and want to be inspired by each other and our different experiences and backgrounds.

Recruitment Process?
We review applications on an individual basis, and if we feel you would be a good fit we'll invite you to meet with a few members of the Footasylum team for an informal chat about the role over Zoom, and to see if we're a good fit for you.
With the COVID-19 situation our teams are all working remotely, adjusting to this new way of working as best we can - and as such we'll help make the interview process as clear and stress-free as possible, giving you the same opportunity as if we were meeting face to face.
Primarily the role will be remote and while there is no intention for the team to go back to full time office work any time soon, candidates within reasonable distance of our offices in Rochdale and Manchester are preferable to enable face to face team and stakeholder sessions in the future.

title: Principal UX Designer
description:
Apply on employer's website
We are hiring a Principal UX Designer to join our omni-channel team who are defining and delivering the services we need to provide to our customers. We are striving to offer our customer any product from any location with the minimum amount of friction. The product manager will balance the customers voice and opinion along with the businesses desire to build the right omni-channel services.

This is an exciting role for an experienced UX designer who can:
Map end to end services and processes across all touchpoints online and offline.
Create rapid prototypes to test assumptions.
Communicate complex systems in simple terms to other teams and stakeholders.
Be the voice of the user, leading the research and testing to gain a better understanding of the journeys and playing these back to the teams.
Advocate high quality, inclusive and accessible user experiences, making appropriate decisions alongside the Product Manager and Delivery Manager.
Take responsibility for the design artifacts, systems and outcomes using established UX methodologies and processes.
Collaborate using clear communication, written and facilitation skills working closely with engineers, UX Designers and stakeholders to create a user-centric approach to the development of the omni-channel experience.
Engage in conversations with stakeholders as well as the departmental teams to produce high quality outcomes and present back decisions.
Help to drive innovation and good practice through the UX Community of Practice.

The Team
You will be working in a multi-disciplinary team alongside a delivery manager, developers, QA, data engineering and product manager. The team have currently developed an App which reduces the time in store, for customers to check stock and request products from the storeroom. This App is the foundation to build a true omni-channel experience, allowing customers to purchase products that are out of stock in store from a different channel, with no friction.
We are also in the early stages of creating a community of practice for UX to learn from other teams and promote better ways of working. You will be expected to help setup and contribute to the community.
This is a chance to help us define and deliver a solution that creates a unique omni-channel shopping experience for our customers. You will work closely with the senior team of retail, merchandising, ecommerce and logistics as this experience impacts a significant number of business functions and is at the heart of our digital transformation journey.

About You
You can demonstrate valuable experience and competency across a range of Research methods, UX Methodologies and processes and have experience of rapid prototyping tools such as Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD and remote collaborative tools such as Miro.
We like to talk to people with a desire to investigate, innovate, and develop emerging design and technological trends and champion accessibility. Having a thorough knowledge of UX design will support our focus on ensuring the highest quality output based on a deep understanding of the audience. In this case the focus will be around store colleagues and customers.
You will have a can-do attitude engaging in the full end to end journey that might include offline solutions as well as the visual UI design or supporting other teams with the promotion of new features and concepts.
Within your current organisation, you can demonstrate that you are highly inquisitive, spending time forming relationships with other business functions to create openness to allow the vision and strategy.
The team continuously reflects and adapts to improve how they work. At every point, you will have the support of your team and the business to do the right thing with autonomy, mastery, and purpose. Being supportive of those around you, demonstrating a growth mindset you are constantly engaged in learning. Whilst working in a kind, considerate and collaborative manner helps our teams work more productively and collaboratively.
Above everything else, you will have the opportunity to influence our decisions, help define standards across the teams and contribute to a healthy and happy working environment.

Salary and Benefits?
We are offering a salary of up to £50,000 for the right person, which we assess based on your own experiences, delivery skills and against the principles of our department and our ways of working. You'll also get access to our ‘FA Presents' company benefits platform, 25 days holiday and pension as standard, and use of our training budget to help you develop your skills.

Diversity?
We recognise and value the importance of diversity to help make sure we have lots of different perspectives when we are building products and services. We know that this will help us build useful and accessible things which our customers will love. This is great news for our business. Diversity for us is also, importantly, about building happy teams full of people that want to learn and want to be inspired by each other and our different experiences and backgrounds.

Recruitment Process?
We review applications on an individual basis, and if we feel you would be a good fit you'll meet with a few members of the Footasylum team for an informal chat about the role over Zoom, and to see if we're a good fit for you.
With the COVID-19 situation our teams are all working remotely, adjusting to this new way of working as best we can - and as such we'll help make the interview process as clear and stress-free as possible, giving you the same opportunity as if we were meeting face to face.
Primarily the role will be remote and while there is no intention for the team to go back to full time office work any time soon, candidates within reasonable distance of our offices in Rochdale and Manchester are preferable to enable face to face team and stakeholder sessions as well as store visits.

title: Junior Clinical Systems Database Developer - SQL
description:
Apply on employer's website
Job Title: Junior Clinical Systems Database Developer - SQL
Hours: Full time (Permanent)
Salary: £28,000 - £35,000 pa
Location: 26-28 Streatham Place, London, SW2 4QY
AT Technology Services Ltd (AT Tech) works in partnership with AT Medics – one of the largest Primary Care providers in London enabling technology-based solution within health care settings. We are improving healthcare through patient centric solutions, developed to provide patients and practitioners with a seamless and end-to-end digital experience. We are seeking a Junior Clinical Systems Database Developer, with experience within primary care clinical system ideally with EMIS and SystmOne to reproduce the reports.
Responsibilities
To assist BI Team with the development of complex queries and report from large databases (MS SQL Server and PostgreSQL).
To support the team in converting EMIS/S1 search logics and specifications into SQL queries.
To maintain and configure our in-house developed BI tool, which is known as “EZ Analytics”.
To liaise with DevOps team and PMO in order to track and accomplish business requirements
To work with BI developers using visualisation techniques in Power BI to support reporting specifications and develop the required knowledge
To interact with clinical and corporate teams and subject matter experts to understand their problems and translate their needs.
To assists Data warehouse and Business Intelligence teams with SSIS, SSRS, DAX (R/Python is highly beneficial).
To enhance data extract mechanism across NHS datasets with a focus on the delivery of information to support key areas of business.
To assist Healthcare Data Scientist in extracting information and knowledge across complex EHR data sources.
Person specifications:
Education, Training and Qualifications-
Essential
First degree in software, computer, IT, data engineering or similar discipline, or relevant experience to an equivalent
Desirable
• Master’s degree in a relevant discipline
• Agile Qualification
Experience
Essential
• Good exposure to relational database systems (MS SQL Server or PostgreSQL)
• Adequate SQL knowledge in: joining tables, bulk operations, and nested queries (DDL, DML)
• Understanding of data visualisation techniques and dashboard design with Power BI
• Numerate and able to analyse and interpret data and information accurately and effectively
• Willing to work in NHS primary care segment
Desirable
Knowledge of PHP, Java Scrip is a huge advantage
Experience of working with primary care data, as well as understanding NHS datasets
A good understanding of the health and social care environment and roles and responsibilities within i
Knowledge / Skills
Essential
Clear communicator with excellent writing, report writing and presentation skills
Ability to analyse and interpret information, pre-empt and evaluate issues.
Problem solving skills and ability to respond to sudden unexpected demands
Attention to detail combined with the ability to extract key messages from complex analysis
Desirable
Evidence of success in efficient and effective project and programme management
Skills for nurturing key relationships and maintaining networks
Personal Characteristics
Essential
A proactive, innovative and pragmatic approach to problem solving
Ability to cope with and manage high levels of change
Willing to learn new technologies, and self-motivation for research and innovate
If you want to be part of a vibrant, forward-thinking organisation and you share our ideas, take the first step by applying for this position.
If you have not heard from us within 4 weeks of the closing date you should assume you have not been shortlisted but we would like to thank you for your interest in our organisation.
